Here’s the links:  http://web.archive.org/web/20200501012945/https://dapre.presidencia.gov.co/normativa/normativa/DECRETO%20417%20DEL%2017%20DE%20MARZO%20DE%202020.pdf  http://web.archive.org/web/20200429211423/https://www.lafm.com.co/colombia/duque-anuncia-que-queda-prohibido-el-desalojo-por-no-pago-de-arriendo  From March 18 onwards the government offered: i) free reconnection of the aqueduct service for those families who have the service suspended; ii) freeze the increase of the water and aqueduct services bills; and iii) suspension of the collection of tariffs for water purification.  Here’s the links:  http://web.archive.org/web/20200501013557/https://id.presidencia.gov.co/Paginas/prensa/2020/MinVivienda-explico-nuevas-medidas-desde-el-sector-de-agua-potable-relacionadas-con-la-contencion-del-coronavirus-200318.aspx  https://id.presidencia.gov.co/especiales/200317-medidas-enfrentar-coronavirus/index.html  According to the IMF the following benefits have been granted by the Colombian government: “ a two-month suspension of pension contributions by both employees and employers, delayed tax collection for the tourism and air transportation sectors, an exemption of tariffs and VAT for strategic health imports and selected food industries and services, delayed utility payments for poor and middle income households, additional taxes for public sector workers (to help fund the response), and expanded transfers for vulnerable groups…. Superfinanciera [agency that supervises financial companies] has allowed supervised entities to reprofile all loans that were less than 30 days over-due on Feb 29. These new provisions can include grace periods or extended deadlines. Banks cannot increase interest rates on loans, charge interest on interest, or report entities to credit registries for availing themselves of any forbearance measures.” Here’s the links:  http://web.archive.org/web/20200429202626/https://www.imf.org/en/Topics/imf-and-covid19/Policy-Responses-to-COVID-19
notes_E1: Since April 7 the government started implementing different transfer schemes  through different national programmes (Colombia Mayor, Ingreso Solidario and Familias en Acción) the government has delivered financial assistance to 2 million elderly individuals (with an amount of $240,000 Colombian pesos), financial assistance to 2,600,000 families (with an amount of $330,000 Colombian pesos), and financial assistance to 1,200,000 families that were not registered in previous government programmes (with an amount of $160,000 Colombian pesos). The Solidarity Income transfers replace less than 50% of the median salary. Here’s the links that explain the transfers from the national government:    http://web.archive.org/web/20200501011226/https://ingresosolidario.dnp.gov.co/  http://web.archive.org/web/20200501011226/https://ingresosolidario.dnp.gov.co//web/20200501011033/https://ingresosolidario.dnp.gov.co/documentos/ETAPAS.pdf  http://web.archive.org/web/20200429202305/https://id.presidencia.gov.co/Paginas/prensa/2020/Gobierno-Nacional-presenta-balance-sobre-entrega-ayudas-economicas-durante-Aislamiento-Preventivo-Obligatorio-200428.aspx
notes_C3: A 4-day strict quarantine is in effect since Thursday in the capital city of Bogota, which is now on "Red Alert".  https://web.archive.org/web/20210110055917/https://gestion.pe/mundo/capital-de-colombia-decreta-cuarentena-por-segunda-ola-de-covid-19-temen-presencia-de-nueva-cepa-noticia/
notes_C6: Stronger measures have been implemented until Easter to counter rise in cases  https://web.archive.org/web/20210325005854if_/https://www.reuters.com/article/us-health-coronavirus-colombia-idUSKBN2BG04W
notes_C8: The Decree 412  issued on March 16  by the Presidency ordered the closure of all international frontiers (land, maritime and river) from March 17 and until May 30.  Here’s the link to the Decree: https://web.archive.org/web/20200603144410/https://dapre.presidencia.gov.co/normativa/normativa/DECRETO%20412%20DEL%2016%20DE%20MARZO%20DE%202020.pdf Later, the Presidency issued Decree 439 of March 20, which suspended (between March 23 and April 23, international flights incoming to Colombia. Here’s the link of the decree:  https://web.archive.org/web/20200409082330/https://dapre.presidencia.gov.co/normativa/normativa/DECRETO%20439%20DEL%2020%20DE%20MARZO%20DE%202020.pdf Finally, the Decree 569 issued on April 15, extended the suspension of international flights incoming to Colombia until the end of the “sanitary emergency status” (May 30).  Here’s the link of the decree:  https://web.archive.org/web/20200603144726/https://dapre.presidencia.gov.co/normativa/normativa/DECRETO%20569%20DEL%2015%20DE%20ABRIL%20DE%202020.pdf [archived web version]
notes_H8: Strict quarantines in the neighborhoods of Kennedy, Fontibon, and Teusaquillo ended on January 22.    Source: https://archive.vn/lMeYv#selection-347.18-347.231    "Colombia’s government will extend its health state of emergency by three months, President Ivan Duque said on Wednesday, as he urged people to avoid crowds and keep up safety measures to contain the spread of the novel coronavirus.    (...) “The sanitary emergency will extend until February 28, 2021,” Duque said on his nightly television program. “We will extend this process for 90 days and we’re doing it to maintain control (and) detailed monitoring.”  Duque urged viewers to avoid crowds and use safety measures to avoid second outbreaks like those seen in Europe."    Source: https://archive.vn/8wmTQ
notes_C2: A 4-day strict quarantine is in effect since Thursday in the capital city of Bogota, which is now on "Red Alert".  https://web.archive.org/web/20210110055917/https://gestion.pe/mundo/capital-de-colombia-decreta-cuarentena-por-segunda-ola-de-covid-19-temen-presencia-de-nueva-cepa-noticia/
notes_C4: Large gatherings (of over 50 people) are prohibited.  https://web.archive.org/web/20201104050936/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/colombia/coronavirus
notes_H7: A, C:    The first stage of vaccination will be for the priority population, i.e. frontline health personnel and 100% of the population over the age of 80. This comprises about 11 million people (7.6 million over the age of 60 and 1.2 million in health personnel) and would begin in January 2021.    In phase two it will focus on vaccination of 100% of the population from 60 to 79 years old and health personnel of the second and third hotlines. This comprises about 7.19 million. While in phase three, 2.95 million people will be vaccinated; phase four, 4.91 million; and in phase five, about 17.4 million.    https://web.archive.org/web/20201221215935/https://www.larepublica.co/especiales/mis-documentos-2020/conozca-como-sera-el-plan-de-vacunacion-contra-el-covid-19-en-colombia-desde-enero-3104233
notes_H3: Government Decree #1374 issued on October 19th  The government has created something called “El Programa de Pruebas, Rastreo y Aislamiento Selectivo Sostenible (PRASS)”. This directly translates to “The sustainable program for testing, tracking, and self isolation”     On page 2, the last paragraph says that the Ministry of Health created an information system called “SegCovid19” to hold he information about the health response, as well as any cases, or important information to do with the pandemic. This is where they capture all of their data.     On page 5, paragraph 3.5 it says that any person that has been exposed to a confirmed COVID-19 case, or a suspected case, will have to follow the instructions of the Ministry of Health.     Page 6, paragraph 4.1 states the structure and teams that make up PRASS. 4.1.2, 4.2, and 4.3 says that there are contract tracing teams. These teams are interdisciplinary and made up of individuals with different levels of technical and professional expertise. Additionally, the teams have support from individuals trained in telephone and in person tracing, as well as in tracking confirmed and suspected cases and their contacts.     Page 12, Article 17 outlines the responsibilities of the tracing teams:  -On a daily basis they have to track the confirmed and suspected cases, in addition to all of their contacts.  -They use an algorithm to determine the priorities for tracking.  -They follow-up with cases and contacts for a 14 day period.  -They ensure that those with positive or suspected cases are isolated and monitor their symptoms.     Page 13, Article 19 says that all of the data that is collected by the contact tracing team must be entered into the SegCovid19 database.      https://web.archive.org/web/20201109135635/https://www.minsalud.gov.co/Normatividad_Nuevo/Decreto%201374%20de%202020.pdf
notes_C5: A 4-day strict quarantine is in effect since Thursday in the capital city of Bogota, which is now on "Red Alert".  https://web.archive.org/web/20210110055917/https://gestion.pe/mundo/capital-de-colombia-decreta-cuarentena-por-segunda-ola-de-covid-19-temen-presencia-de-nueva-cepa-noticia/

name: Comoros
notes_H6: Presidential decree makes compulsory to wear face masks in all public spaces.    Archived web: https://archive.vn/LQsYf

name: Cape Verde
notes_H1: Cap Verde ministry of health produces Coronavirus Information video and shares it on Facebook (presumably also airing it on other media / in schools etc.); https://web.archive.org/web/20200514153616/https://www.facebook.com/ministeriodasaude.cv/posts/2467699946827763
notes_H2: Updating indicator back to code 3; please review previous code.    Citizens requiring a COVID-19 PCR-RT test for international travel should contact their nearest health delegation. The cost for the PCR-RT test is 6,500 CVE (approximately $70).    Citizens requiring a rapid test for inter-island travel should contact their nearest health delegation or a private lab.  The cost for a rapid test is generally less than 2,000 CVE (approximately $22).    Results are generally provided via phone call. Travelers can choose to receive their results via email or by picking up a hard copy of the test results.    Effective 15 December 2021, the Government of Cabo Verde has authorized the use of antigen tests (Ag-RDT) to detect COVID-19 prior to travel.  Travelers entering Cabo Verde?must?present results of?a negative COVID-19 PCR-RT test or an antigen test (Ag-RDT, commonly known as a “rapid test”) administered no more than 72 hours prior to?flight departure?to?gain entry?to Cabo Verde. Children under age seven are exempt?from presenting test results?to gain?entry?to Cabo Verde.?  PCR test results are still required to transit Lisbon and the Azores.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210405155015/https://cv.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_C7: No change in policy.  "If you are travelling from Santiago, Santo Antão, São Vicente, Maio and Fogo, you will need to present a COVID-19 (rapid antigen test) done in the last 72 hours before you travel."    https://web.archive.org/web/20210316014017/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/cape-verde/coronavirus
notes_C1: On the island of S. Vicente the state of emergency (calamidade)was declared, on all other islands there is a disaster (contingencia).  http://web.archive.org/web/20210329202341/https://graphics.reuters.com/world-coronavirus-tracker-and-maps/countries-and-territories/cape-verde/
notes_H6: The use of a face covering is mandatory in enclosed spaces (supermarkets, shops, health centers, banks, schools, public services, airports and port, restaurants, public transport). Face coverings are also mandatory outdoors where social distancing cannot be maintained.      People who are practicing individual physical activity are exempt from this obligation to use masks, as long as they respect social distance and respiratory etiquette. Children under 10 years old, people with cognitive developmental disabilities or mental disorders are also exempt.    Anyone in violation of the law may be subject to a fine up to 15,000 CVE.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210105002414/https://covid19.cv/o-uso-de-mascaras-em-todos-os-locais-publicos-incluindo-via-publica-passa-a-ser-obrigatorio/    https://web.archive.org/web/20210103205242/https://cv.usembassy.gov/covid-19-tests-no-longer-needed-for-inter-island-travel-from-santiago-but-required-from-fogo-maio-sao-vicente-and-santo-antao/    https://web.archive.org/web/20210104234336/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/cape-verde/coronavirus
notes_E2: Moratorium on insurance payments and loans repayment remain unchanged.   https://web.archive.org/web/20210316011515/https://covid19.cv/medidas/
notes_E1: No policy change.  http://web.archive.org/web/20210330133048/https://medidascovid19.proempresa.cv/https:/www.imf.org/en/News/Articles/2021/03/26/pr2189-cabo-verde-imf-execboard-completes-third-review-under-the-policy-coordination-instrument
notes_C3: From March 16, the government declared contingency situation and restricts public events with large gatherings of people.  Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20200426210315/https://www.governo.cv/declarada-situacao-de-contingencia-em-todo-o-territorio-nacional/    "No dia 16 de março de 2020, o Governo declara a situação de Contingência, para todo o território nacional, com a adoção das seguintes medidas de carácter excepcional: f) Restrição à realização de eventos públicos que reúnam número significativo de participantes, em espaços abertos ou fechados, independentemente da sua natureza"
notes_C6: Social distancing measures are in force in Cape Verde, and the wearing of non-surgical masks is mandatory in enclosed public spaces, such as supermarkets, schools, restaurants, and public transport. Over-65s and those with chronic medical conditions are required to wear surgical masks at all times when outside their homes. Public gatherings are banned except for religious ceremonies such as funerals, with the latter being restricted to 20 people in attendance. Restaurants, cafes, and bars have been limited to 50 percent capacity. The government has declared that it is a civic duty to remain at home and only go outside for essential purposes, such as shopping for essential items, to seek medical care, exercise, and to work if unable to do so from home.
notes_C8: "Effective Monday, October 12, commercial flights and international maritime transportation of passengers resumed operation.  Travelers entering Cabo Verde must present results of a negative COVID-19 PCR-RT test that was administered within 72 hours of departure to gain entry to Cabo Verde.  Children under age seven are exempt from presenting a COVID-19 PCR-RT test result."    Source: http://web.archive.org/web/20201020120212/https://cv.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_H8: The Cape Verdean government has introduced a de-confinement plan for the whole country which includes:    The mandatory use of surgical masks for those over the age of 65 and those with chronic diseases at all times when outside their homes.     The ongoing civic duty to stay at home, except:  - to buy food or other essential times;  - to go to work if unable to work from home;  - to go to hospital or health centres;  - to carry out caring or similar duties or in case of real need;  - to exercise outdoors and at some facilities and to walk pets.    https://web.archive.org/web/20200715170104/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/cape-verde/coronavirus
notes_C2: "Some cultural, recreational, sporting, leisure and entertainment facilities have reopened but are subject to limited capacity due to social distancing. Most nightclubs, dance halls, event venues and facilities, sporting academies and gymnastics and martial arts clubs remain closed. "      "Until further notice, additional restrictions are in force on the island of São Vincente. These include:  -bars and open air cafés selling alcohol close at 9pm  -restaurants and snack bars close at 9pm"    https://web.archive.org/web/20210316014017/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/cape-verde/coronavirus
notes_C4: Updating indicator as 10 is included in code 4, not code 3.    Gatherings at private events should not exceed more than ten people.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210331024041/https://www.covidchecker.com/en/
notes_H7: For this first phase of vaccination, some groups of people were prioritized taking into account the risk of developing serious disease that can cause even death and professional groups that are on the front line of combating the pandemic. Thus, the priority groups to be vaccinated in this first phase are health professionals; chronic patients (hypertensive and diabetic); population over 60 years of age; hotel professionals and related to tourism; professionals from ports and airports; teachers and support staff in schools; police; armed forces; and civil protection professionals and firefighters.    So far the country has received two types of vaccines, bewith achstraZeneca and the Pfizer/BioNTech vaccine. Meanwhile, the country may receive other vaccines, with the support of the World Bank.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210405155801/https://covid19.cv/vacinas/
notes_H3: Contacts traced for all positive cases. https://web.archive.org/web/20200716103342/http://www.capeverdetips.co.uk/news-cape-verde/cape-verde-flight-ban-and-news-links-17th-march-2020
notes_C5: As the economy is re-opening, it is expected that public transport has re-opened.   From June 3, inter-island travel by sea has been permitted between all islands, except Santiago, provided those wishing to travel have been granted a permit from the National Civil Protection Service. The permit will be granted following a negative COVID-19 test. Travel to and from Santiago island is expected to resume from June 30, as are domestic inter-island flights. Cape Verde's borders remain closed, and international flights are suspended indefinitely.  https://web.archive.org/web/20200806203839/https://www.garda.com/crisis24/news-alerts/348566/cape-verde-authorities-announce-easing-of-travel-restrictions-june-3-update-5

name: Costa Rica
notes_H1: Since February 3rd, Ministry of health has been communicating on response and prevention measures - https://web.archive.org/save/https://www.ministeriodesalud.go.cr/index.php/centro-de-prensa/noticias/741-noticias-2020/1532-lineamientos-nacionales-para-la-vigilancia-de-la-infeccion-por-coronavirus-2019-ncov;  Daily briefings were active as of 24 April: https://web.archive.org/web/20200426074949/https://www.ministeriodesalud.go.cr/index.php/centro-de-prensa/noticias/741-noticias-2020/1532-lineamientos-nacionales-para-la-vigilancia-de-la-infeccion-por-coronavirus-2019-ncov
notes_H2: https://web.archive.org/web/20200411111628/https://www.ministeriodesalud.go.cr/sobre_ministerio/prensa/docs/lineamientos_coronavirus_2020.pdf
notes_C7: Vehicular restrictions are in place according to the US Embassy in Costa Rica from 7 pm on December 31 until 5 am on January 1, 2021. The restrictions will continue into Jan 1, 2, and 3rd from 8 pm until 5 am. "Emergency vehicles, registered taxis, and tourists with verified hotel reservations traveling to and from their hotel are exempt from the restriction. Public transportation will continue to operate normally."    https://web.archive.org/web/20210102220556/https://cr.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_C1: According to the Tico Times, face-to-face teaching was resumed on the 8th of February. However, and significantly, there are important differences to usual operations. The model used combines in person and online teaching, and places limitations on the amount of students allowed to be present, and the days on which they can attend.   https://web.archive.org/web/20210221165827/https://ticotimes.net/2020/12/16/costa-rica-will-resume-in-person-learning-in-2021  https://web.archive.org/web/20210222033612/https://ticotimes.net/2021/02/09/a-decision-we-took-as-a-country-inside-costa-ricas-first-day-back-at-school
notes_H6: Facial coverings are required in all public spaces and in all indoor settings except when eating, while alone, or in a private home.    https://web.archive.org/web/20201116065025/https://cr.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_E2: Presidential directive asks to restore water services that have been suspended due to late payment and to reschedule payments if necessary for two months.  /web/20200501232649/https://www.elmundo.cr/costa-rica/lista-directriz-que-evita-cortes-de-agua-a-morosos-y-reestablece-suspensiones-por-falta-de-pago/
notes_E1: Bono Proteger, a three-month temporary financial aid that will be provided to people affected by the COVID-19 health emergency.    The amount of the Protect Bonus will depend on each particular situation. Those fired, with a suspended employment contract, with a workday reduced by 50% or more, independent and informal workers whose application has been approved will receive a bonus of ¢ 125 thousand per month for 3 months. Meanwhile, for those who suffered a reduction in their working hours by 50% or less, the amount will be ¢ 62,500 per month, for the same period.      The Government intends to allocate ¢ 296 billion for this program. With this amount, it is expected to help 612,000 people, as well as 68,000 households in poverty, for an approximate total of 680,000 beneficiaries.    /web/20200501233235/https://www.presidencia.go.cr/comunicados/2020/04/gobierno-lanza-bono-proteger-para-personas-trabajadoras-afectadas-por-covid-19/
notes_C3: mass events and football games cancelled: https://web.archive.org/web/20200407173315/https://www.voanoticias.com/a/costa-rica-coronavirus-cancel-eventos-/5322312.html
notes_C6: More restrictions for Easter, with the statement from President Alvarado: “Stay at home. Protect yourself. Follow protocols, and protect our country. Together, we can move forward from this.”  On 2 April, Ministry of Health also released a statement asking people to stay at home during Easter.  https://web.archive.org/web/20200617205610/https://ticotimes.net/2020/04/01/costa-rica-enacting-strict-measures-during-semana-santa-country-adds-28-new-coronavirus-cases
notes_C8: Residents from all countries and all U.S. States will be allowed to enter starting November 1.  To enter, visitors will need to complete an online epidemiological form and carry specified travel insurance. A quarantine period is not required for tourists when entering. COVID-19 tests are also NO LONGER required (since October 26).     https://web.archive.org/web/20201101081718/https://www.twoweeksincostarica.com/costa-rica-coronavirus/
notes_H8: There are guidelines for Costa Rica government-run long-term care centers, with updated guidelines for isolation of residents and hygiene protocols like wearing masks. These guidelines were released on August 21, 2020.  Visitors are not allowed unless for extenuating circumstances, in which case there must be 6 ft distance.     https://web.archive.org/web/20201222045643/https://www.ministeriodesalud.go.cr/sobre_ministerio/prensa/docs/ls_si_011_hle_21082020.pdf
notes_C2: Bars and casinos are allowed to open since October 5. The reopening of new businesses will be decided in the following days. Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20201006030357/https://www.infobae.com/america/agencias/2020/10/05/autoridades-de-costa-rica-anuncian-la-reapertura-de-bares-y-casinos/
notes_C4: With the new measures implemented from 1 August, private gatherings are allowed in places of worship with mandatory use of a face mask, and a maximum occupancy capacity of 75 people. This number of people does not include the staff of the place (which must be the minimum), with distance measures of 1.8 meters respecting social bubbles.    Event rooms for activities of a maximum of 30 people (with seating separation measures of at least 1.8 meters, respecting social bubbles, and with lists of attendees with an identification number and contact number). The 30 people should include the event logistics staff and guests.    http://web.archive.org/web/20200806161050/https://www.elmundo.cr/costa-rica/estas-son-las-nuevas-medidas-que-regiran-a-partir-del-1-de-agosto/
notes_H7: The current vaccine groups are as follows for Costa Rica, and the first vaccine shots have started becoming administered. Tico Times reports that the vaccine is free but not mandatory for citizens.   """    Staff and residents at retirement or nursing homes.  First responders, including health personnel.  Costa Rica’s older population, defined here as those ages 58 and up.  People with risk factors, including hypertension, diabetes, heart disease, respiratory illness, kidney disease and obesity, among others.  Teachers and other staff within the Education Ministry (MEP).  Imprisoned people and judicial staff.  Workers for the 911 service.  Health science students and related technicians in clinical fields.  People ages 40-57 without any of the aforementioned risk factors but whose work puts them in contact with others. This includes laborers in agriculture, construction, service industries, etc.  """    https://web.archive.org/web/20201231091456/https://ticotimes.net/2020/12/29/costa-rica-reports-no-adverse-effects-after-first-vaccine-shot
notes_H3: On 9 July, the WHO declared Costa Rica as one of the new countries entering the "Community transmission" phase of the COVID-19 pandemic. At this stage, contact tracing efforts are more difficult to maintain. On the week of 6 July, in more than 60% of the registered cases in the country, it was not possible to investigate the epidemiological links due to the collapse of the tracking systems, given the large number of infections being registered.    http://archive.fo/2I9qF
notes_C5: no changes   https://web.archive.org/web/20210405205607/https://cr.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/  https://web.archive.org/web/20210405210144/https://sites.google.com/presidencia.go.cr/alertas/inicio

name: Cuba
notes_H1: "On January 28, the Cuban government announced the formulation of an interagency working group to direct host government response to COVID-19 chaired by the Ministry of Public Health (MINSAP)." Archived Source: /web/20200406214929/https://cu.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_H2: No policy change
notes_C7: Travel and transport within each Province varies according to the measures in place. The suspension of inter-provincial transport was lifted on 19 October 2020. The current exceptions are to/from Sancti Spiritus and Pinar del Rio. Any change in the situation in a province or municipality may mean inter-provincial or municipal transport links also change.  https://web.archive.org/web/20201201181436/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/cuba/coronavirus
notes_C1: Since January 14, the closure of schools was in 34 municipalities (those that returned to the transmission stage), but not in the whole country, so I have changed the previous note (below) from 3G to 3T  (http://web.archive.org/web/20210222010330/http://www.granma.cu/cuba/2021-02-11/curso-escolar-en-cuba-no-se-reanudara-el-20-de-febrero-aclara-ministra-de-educacion-video-11-02-2021-11-02-05)    Previous note:  Authorities in the Cuban capital announced that from this Thursday schools, bars and restaurants will close and that public transport will be suspended at night, a measure seeking to contain a recent coronavirus regrowth, an official medium reported Wednesday.  https://web.archive.org/web/20210115203138/https://www.infobae.com/america/america-latina/2021/01/14/la-habana-limitara-el-transporte-publico-y-cerrara-las-escuelas-para-contener-el-avance-del-coronavirus/
notes_H6: On 1 april 2020, “Use of face masks is made obligatory in public” according to MEDICC Review, April 2020, Vol 22, No 2, “CUBA’S COVID-19 STRATEGY: MAIN ACTIONS THROUGH APRIL 23, 2020” . See MEDICC Review website, archived:  https://web.archive.org/web/20210321122148/https://mediccreview.org/cubas-covid-19-strategy-main-actions-through-april-23-2020/
notes_E2: The collection of electricity, water and gas services is postponed. The monthly billing will remain in force with the same rates but payments will be deferred without penalty or cut of services.  In addition, the collection of fines for the government is temporarily suspended, extending the deadline. Due to the pandemic, the established surcharges will not be applied when the fine is not paid in the established period.   /web/20200503181135/https://www.cibercuba.com/noticias/2020-04-09-u157374-e157374-s27061-gobierno-cuba-aplaza-pago-facturas-luz-agua-gas
notes_E1: The Ministry of Work and Social Security established that workers who are in the high risk group due to their age or comorbidities, or workers who cannot be reallocated during the pandemic, should perceive 100% of their salary during the first month and 60% while measures against covid are in place.   See: Actualizacion de medidas aprobadas por el Gobierno" (30/4/20). 2-4 and 7. http://web.archive.org/web/20200514215725/http://www.mtss.gob.cu/  The Ministry of Finance established that the payments for workers wages have to be assumed by the entity to which they belong, with their own financial resources. Only if the entity cannot afford to cover wages, it can apply for Government support. (not the workers individually).   See Gaceta Oficial - NORMAS DEL MINISTERIO DE FINANZAS Y PRECIOS RELATIVAS AL ENFRENTAMIENTO DE LA COVID-19. Resolucion No. 148/2020, Art 3 and 4.
notes_C3: "Large gatherings and events are also suspended . Some are postponed or resized, and even the International Tourism Fair is suspended, which will be held when appropriate."  Archived Source: /web/20200406225645/http://www.cubadebate.cu/noticias/2020/03/20/gobierno-cubano-informa-nuevas-medidas-para-el-enfrentamiento-a-la-covid-19-video/
notes_C6: A new quarantine is in effect from February 5th:  https://web.archive.org/web/20210205030256/https://elpais.com/sociedad/2021-02-05/cuba-decreta-el-toque-de-queda-en-la-habana-por-la-subida-de-casos-de-la-covid-19.html  In the Google Spanish-to-English translation of the article, the description is that the government re-imposes a curfew for Havana and a mandatory quarantine for “all travelers who arrive in the country”.  During quality review, Adil Sayeed changed the code from 3T to 2T on the grounds that the quarantine for travellers applies more to C8 than C6.
notes_C8: “In addition, from January 10, all travelers arriving in Cuba from any destination must provide a negative PCR test at their entrance, carried out 72 hours before the trip, and undergo two other tests on the island: one at the airport and another four days later. Until receiving confirmation that they are not positive, passengers, whether they are tourists or residents of Cuba, must be quarantined in the place where they are staying.” (http://web.archive.org/web/20210221235858/https://elpais.com/internacional/2020-12-29/cuba-reducira-la-entrada-de-viajeros-de-ee-uu-y-mexico-ante-la-subida-de-casos-de-covid-19.html)
notes_H8: Thursday, January 14 - "New restrictions were introduced in Havana as Cuba on Sunday reported 388 new COVID-19 cases, the highest single-day count since the onset of the pandemic on the island in March.  The measures were imposed over the weekend in response to surging cases following a holiday season when thousands of overseas Cuban nationals traveled to the island to celebrate New Year's Eve with families and friends.  Local media reported that the fundamental causes of the outbreak are parties and breaches of social distancing rules in private and public areas.  The provincial government in Havana has suspended the public transportation service from 9 p.m. to 5 a.m. and closed bars and nightclubs to avoid non-essential movements.  Though a night-time curfew has not been imposed, social gatherings at parks, squares and public areas during night hours have been banned from 7 p.m."  Source: https://archive.vn/4j3Xp
notes_C2: Cuba is strengthening its measures after a peak in coronavirus cases  https://web.archive.org/web/20210109193328/https://www.prensa-latina.cu/index.php?o=rn&id=422571&SEO=cuba-refuerza-medidas-tras-repunte-de-contagios-con-covid-19
notes_C4: See Art.3 and 10. https://web.archive.org/web/20200514152223/https://www.gacetaoficial.gob.cu/sites/default/files/goc-2020-ex25.pdf  Before mother's day the president insisted on the importance of respecting social distancing measures. https://web.archive.org/web/20200514155915/http://www.cuba.cu/sociedad/2020-05-09/felicita-diaz-canel-a-las-madres-de-cuba-e-insiste-en-la-disciplina-con-el-distanciamiento-social/51595
notes_H7: Two groups, A, and adults. Vaccines: Soberana 02 and Abdala  Cuba is creating their own vaccines, and two of them are now in Phase III trial, where tens of thousands of adults are being vaccinated. Additionally, health workers and adults in Havana are receiving the vaccines as part of “interventional studies”	. Two million Cubans are expected to be vaccinated by end of March, and massive vaccination will begin in June.   https://web.archive.org/web/20210405050929/https://blogs.lse.ac.uk/latamcaribbean/2021/03/31/cubas-five-covid-19-vaccines-the-full-story-on-soberana-01-02-plus-abdala-and-mambisa/
notes_H3: In the new protocol (May) it is stated that contacts from suspect cases will be admitted to an isolation centre for 14 days (see pages 13 and 15, 2.1.3) https://web.archive.org/web/20200514191153/http://files.sld.cu/editorhome/files/2020/05/MINSAP_Protocolo-de-Actuaci%25C3%25B3n-Nacional-para-la-COVID-19_versi%25C3%25B3n-1.4_mayo-2020.pdf  Also, in the daily report by the Ministry of Health, the new cases are individually identified, and the number of contacts being monitored for each of them is recorded. https://web.archive.org/save/https://salud.msp.gob.cu/?p=5248
notes_C5: Curfew is implemented in La Habana, which includes suspension of public transport at nights, from 9 pm to 5 am.   http://web.archive.org/web/20210222035956/https://elpais.com/sociedad/2021-02-05/cuba-decreta-el-toque-de-queda-en-la-habana-por-la-subida-de-casos-de-la-covid-19.html)

name: Cyprus
notes_H1: Date for start of information campaigns is unavailable. From this link, it could be gathered that the information campaign began from March 5: http://www.ucy.ac.cy/hr/en/covid-19-action-plan#Q-A  List of Public information campaigns: https://www.pio.gov.cy/coronavirus/en/info.html
notes_H2: Eligible to get tested are people who work in the public and wider public sector and the local government with priority being given to those who serve the public. It also includes the National Guard, police and fire service.  http://web.archive.org/web/20200430095651/https://cyprus-mail.com/2020/04/11/coronavirus-testing-begins-on-20000-workers-who-serve-the-public/  https://cyprus-mail.com/2020/04/11/coronavirus-testing-begins-on-20000-workers-who-serve-the-public/
notes_C7: movement between Districts is permitted provided that the purpose for  which the movement takes place falls within the Categories referred to in the  text message, which normally does not exceed three (3) hours.  https://web.archive.org/web/20210308092102/https://publications.gov.cy/assets/user/publications/2021/2021_995/8/index.html
notes_C1: A partial lifting of the restrictive measures was decided. For schools:  - Primary Schools in the District of Lemesos and Gymnasiums reopened island-wide, with the physical presence of students, with the presentation of a negative rapid antigen test.  - Following consultation that will take place between representatives of the Ministries of Education and Health and the Scientific Advisory Committee with organized bodies, a program will be drawn up in the near future for nasal rapid antigen testing in Cycle B’ pupils of Primary Schools (4th, 5th and 6th grade).    https://web.archive.org/web/20210406023941/https://www.pio.gov.cy/coronavirus/uploads/31032021_dilosihealthministerEN.pdf
notes_H6: Downgrading indicator because policy is dependent on the presence of other people.    According to the Quarantine (Determination of Measures to Prevent the Spread of COVID-19) Decree (No. 6) of 2021:    The use of protective face mask is mandatory for all persons over twelve (12) years old, indoors where there are more than one person and outdoors where there are more than two persons with the exception of the cases specified by the guidelines issued by the Ministry of Health.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210204164311/https://www.pio.gov.cy/coronavirus/uploads/28012021_DecreeEN.pdf
notes_E2: Quote: Moving to give hard-pressed tenants a temporary respite, the Council of Ministers on Thursday approved a bill suspending evictions until May 31 for non-payment of rent. The bill will cover non-payment of rent after March 1.  http://web.archive.org/web/20200615214036/https://in-cyprus.philenews.com/coronavirus-freeze-on-evictions-for-non-payment-of-rent-until-may-31/
notes_E1: https://web.archive.org/web/20200515020204/https://www.activpayroll.com/news-articles/cyprus-covid-19-measures-for-small-and-medium-sized-businesses
notes_C3: The maximum number of persons at church services and/or other forms of religious worship is 50 people, in compliance with the health guidelines.  Weddings, christenings and funerals with a maximum number of 10 persons are allowed. The holding of luncheons and/or dinners that are related to weddings and christenings, is prohibited.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210323141223/https://www.pio.gov.cy/en/press-releases-article.html?id=19146#flat
notes_C6: From 5am on 10 January, until at least midnight on 31 January, all outings from your place of residence require permission granted either by sending an SMS to “8998” from a Cypriot mobile number, or by completing and carrying a written form if you do not have a Cypriot phone number (or are over 65 and prefer this method). You are also required to carry official identification at all times.  https://web.archive.org/web/20201214091800/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/cyprus/coronavirus
notes_C8: The 3rd phase of reopening Cyprus started on 9 June. This included the re-opening of airports and ports. Flights to and from a 13 countries have resumed with flights to and from an additional 6 countries to resume as of 20 june. If persons test positive for Coronavirus after visiting, the Cypriot government will reimburse the travel costs. Initially all travellers will need to show proof of a negative COVID-19 test undertaken within 72 hours of travel, but from June 20, only those arriving from six countries in the second category, such as Poland and Romania, will need to do so.  http://web.archive.org/web/20200610194818/https://www.schengenvisainfo.com/news/cyprus-to-reopen-its-borders-for-several-eu-schengen-nationals-in-two-phases/  http://web.archive.org/web/20200610192955/https://www.pio.gov.cy/en/press-releases-article.html?id=14067  http://web.archive.org/web/20200610194633/http://www.xinhuanet.com/english/2020-06/04/c_139111920.htm
notes_H8: Downgrading indicator because even though movements are restricted as indicated in C6, exceptions are allowed, including:    helping people who are unable to take care of themselves or must protect   themselves or who are in self-isolation and/or in places of compulsory   isolation, visiting nursing homes, care for the elderly units, homes and   hostels for vulnerable groups or a house.    Also, in Decree No. 9 of 2021, it is noted that:    Visits to nursing homes, care for the elderly units, chronic patients’ units, homes   and hostels for vulnerable groups, transitional hospitality hostels for the   homeless, day centres and child protection units are allowed subject to the   guidelines of the Ministry of Health and the Ministry of Labour, Welfare and Social   Insurance.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210315174023/https://www.pio.gov.cy/coronavirus/uploads/26022021_Decree%20n.9_EN.pdf
notes_C2: As of Monday, 1st February, hair salons, barbershops, beauty salons and driving schools reopen.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210204165941if_/https://publications.gov.cy/assets/user/publications/2021/2021_993/HTML/
notes_C4: Restrictions back to normal after New Year's Eve - i.e. meetings other than two persons are prohibited.
notes_H7: Currently, the following groups are being vaccinated:    1. Residents and staff of senior people’s homes and institutions for chronic adult illnesses. - Group C  2. Healthcare professionals: Workers in hospitals with COVID19 patients, and in all ICU, Accident and Emergency Departments, Ambulance Departments (regardless of COVID hospitalization). - Group A  3. People >80 years old (priority in vulnerable groups). - Group B    Vaccines administered to date: AstraZeneca and BioNTech/Pfiser    https://web.archive.org/web/20210126171422/https://www.pio.gov.cy/coronavirus/uploads/NationalVaccinationPlan.pdf
notes_H3: Comprehensive testing https://web.archive.org/save/https://www.financialmirror.com/2020/04/22/covid19-cyprus-fighting-the-virus-through-contact-tracing/
notes_C5: Following a decision by the Ministry of Transport, Communications and Works, as of 9 June, public transport (Cyprus only has buses and taxis) can ride with 100% fully capacity inside the buses. Since March the buses were only allowed to carry maximum 30% capacity (increased to 50% in May). The wearing of masks is obligatory.    http://web.archive.org/web/20200709114147/https://www.intercity-buses.com/?wp=news-details&id=1C88B7DCABFD13B13AE1D1FBDA910967&id=1C88B7DCABFD13B13AE1D1FBDA910967

name: Czech Republic
notes_H1: Czech ministry of health starts information campaign with daily updates and extends Coronavirus hotline to 24/7 operations in response to meeting of Central Epidemiological Commission one day prior; https://web.archive.org/web/20200510172816/https://www.mzcr.cz/dokumenty/na-ministerstvu-zdravotnictvi-zasedla-kvuli-koronaviru-ustredni-epidemiologicka-_18596_1.html; https://web.archive.org/web/20200228210141/https:/twitter.com/ZdravkoOnline/status/1233495618913521672; https://web.archive.org/web/20200228210537/https://twitter.com/ZdravkoOnline/status/1233496226869514241
notes_H2: Testing requirements changed on 27th March to allow anyone displaying symptoms including a fever, dry cough, or shortness of breath to be eligible for a free test.    http://web.archive.org/web/20200419112751/https://www.idnes.cz/zpravy/domaci/koronavirus-testovani-covid-19-horecka-kasel-dusnost-doporuceni-pacient-nakazeny-mrtvi.A200327_170734_domaci_rapc
notes_C7: Policy: From 1 March, there are restrictions on freedom of movement. You must avoid all non-essential movement. Shopping and exercise are only permitted within your municipality (‘obec’). You must not travel outside of your district (‘okres’ in Czech) unless this is for a permitted exceptional reason. Exceptions are permitted for essential travel to work, to the airport, to attend a medical appointment, or to care for an infirm relative, but you may be asked to provide written evidence of the need for your journey.  Source:   https://web.archive.org/web/20210315200623/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/czech-republic/coronavirus
notes_C1: On December 21 and 22, all children attending elementary and secondary schools, conservatories, higher vocational schools, elementary art schools, language schools etc. will be off school. These days will be added to the Christmas holiday (ends January 3rd).   https://web.archive.org/web/20210101112055/https://koronavirus.mzcr.cz/en/the-government-has-decided-that-stricter-4th-tier-pandemic-measures-will-start-to-apply-on-friday-affected-businesses-will-be-helped-by-compensations/
notes_H6: From 20 March, "People will not have to wear a mask or respirator while exercising outdoors (even in urban areas of the village), as long as a distance of at least 2 m from other people is maintained."  "You do not need to wear a mask or respirator only in the countryside outside of the city, as long as long as a distance of at least 2 m from other people is maintained. (persons living in the same household do not count)."    https://archive.vn/womBe
notes_E2: The companies as employers will be able to pay social insurance premiums in the amount of 24.8 % of wages for May, June, and July 2020 until October 20, 2020. The employers are still obliged to pay employee health insurance premiums in the amount of 6.5 % of wages. However, there is an obligation to pay a lower penalty of 0,01 % of the debt per day (this is a reduced penalty from a regular amount of 0.05 % of debt per day). Employers do not have to pay a penalty that does not exceed 1,000 CZK. The law entered into force recently.  https://news.expats.cz/prague-business/important-news-for-small-business-owners-impacted-by-coronavirus-closures-in-the-czech-republic/
notes_E1: No change in policy  https://web.archive.org/web/20210315203529/https://www.vlada.cz/en/media-centrum/aktualne/measures-adopted-by-the-czech-government-against-coronavirus-180545/
notes_C3: https://web.archive.org/web/20210123115143if_/https://www.reuters.com/article/us-health-coronavirus-czech/czech-parliament-extends-state-of-emergency-until-feb-14-idUSKBN29Q2P0
notes_C6: Policy: You should not leave your place of residence between 9pm and 5am unless you are travelling to, or from work, or making an essential trip.  Source:   https://web.archive.org/web/20210315200623/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/czech-republic/coronavirus
notes_C8: As of 14 April, travelling abroad for "essential activities" will be allowed. This will include business trips, the assembly of a production facility, a visit to a doctor or to a relative. Each trip will be followed by 14 days of obligatory quarantine on return.    As of Monday April 27, the rules for crossing state borders have been changed. EU citizens arriving in the Czech Republic for business purposes and university students from EU countries may now come to the Czech Republic. Czech citizens are able to travel abroad, however on their return they must submit to  14 days’ quarantine or provide a test with a negative Covid-19 result.    As of Monday 11 May, the current rules for border crossing will be relaxed. All citizens will be able to cross the state border at selected border crossings, which were previously used only by commuters. Railway corridors to Germany and Austria will also be functional.    As of 26 May, the regime at the state borders will be eased. EU citizens and foreigners with the status of a long-term resident in EU Member State will be able to enter the Czech Republic in order to perform economic activities, to visit relatives or to study at a university. Everyone will have to prove themselves with a negative test for covid-19 upon entry.    https://web.archive.org/web/20200715165336/https://www.vlada.cz/en/media-centrum/aktualne/measures-adopted-by-the-czech-government-against-coronavirus-180545/
notes_H8: The curfew applies to the elderly hence this code classification.   Source:  https://web.archive.org/web/20210315200623/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/czech-republic/coronavirus
notes_C2: As of the 18th of December, all bars, restaurants, zoos, museums, swimming pools and other indoor sports facilities will be closed. Shops and services can remain open if they ensure there is only 1 customer per 15 square metres.   https://web.archive.org/web/20210101121028/https://www.vlada.cz/en/media-centrum/aktualne/measures-adopted-by-the-czech-government-against-coronavirus-180545/
notes_C4: "mass events indoors up to 10 participants  mass outdoor events for up to 20 participants"    http://web.archive.org/web/20201008121940/https://koronavirus.mzcr.cz/aktualni-opatreni/
notes_H7: Vaccinations are available for groups A(paramedics, healthcare workers, critical infrastructure workers), B (people with chronic conditions), C (elderly 70+). Current vaccines used are BioNTech/Pfizer, Moderna, Astra Zeneca. (Orders & negotiations for other vaccines are ongoing.)  "The central registration system is available for groups: persons older than 70 and 80 years of age, paramedics, people with chronic diseases, critical infrastructure. These categories are sorted by age, not by order of registration. Registration through GPs and specialist care centers:  persons older than 70 and 80 years of age who are not registered at vaccination sites and persons with serious chronic diseases who do not meet the age conditions."  https://archive.vn/SKvll   https://archive.vn/DGgQy
notes_H3: Infected are isolated in infectious clinics, and hygienists are now conducting the necessary epidemiological investigations, including tracing all those with whom the infected have come into close contact.    https://web.archive.org/web/20200414010140/https://www.mzcr.cz/dokumenty/v-ceske-republice-jsou-prvni-tri-potvrzene-pripady-nakazy-koronavirem_18605_4107_1.html
notes_C5: From the 30th of January, the operation of cableways is restricted to the operation of rescue services.   https://web.archive.org/web/20210131174522/https://www.vlada.cz/en/media-centrum/aktualne/the-government-has-made-adjustments-to-the-measures--and-further-restrictions-on-the-use-of-hotel-services-or-contacts-will-be-ordered-from-saturday-186322/

name: Germany
notes_H1: German health ministry cooperates with Helmholtz Institut to produce series of videos on Coronavirus, including how to protect oneself from Coronavirus; https://web.archive.org/web/20200212103102/https:/twitter.com/BMG_Bund/status/1227538838140047361, https://twitter.com/BMG_Bund/status/1227535818237063168, https://twitter.com/BMG_Bund/status/1227536321473761282, https://twitter.com/BMG_Bund/status/1227536825000103936, https://twitter.com/BMG_Bund/status/1227537328261881856, https://twitter.com/BMG_Bund/status/1227537831473664000, https://twitter.com/BMG_Bund/status/1227538838140047361, https://twitter.com/BMG_Bund/status/1227540851389276166
notes_H2: Since 8 March 2021, the Federal Government has been covering the cost of at least one free rapid test per week (public testing).  With the increasing availability of rapid tests and self-administered tests, comprehensive testing in schools and daycare centres is currently being introduced in the Länder."    Source: http://web.archive.org/web/20210326145328/https://www.bundesregierung.de/resource/blob/656632/1881470/f0922369004c03634f34e502e79490b2/2021-03-24-mpk-beschluss-corona-en-data.pdf?download=1
notes_C7: The 15 km rule technically still applies to some states, although some states like Bavaria have overturned the rule.  However, it appears that this rule is not strictly enforced (Source: http://web.archive.org/web/20210327015201/https://www.mdr.de/nachrichten/deutschland/politik/fuenfzehn-kilometer-regel-corona-100.html), thus I have brought down the coding to 1G.  "The Federal Government and the Länder maintain their urgent appeal to all members of the public to refrain from non-essential local and international travel."  Source: http://web.archive.org/web/20210326145328/https://www.bundesregierung.de/resource/blob/656632/1881470/f0922369004c03634f34e502e79490b2/2021-03-24-mpk-beschluss-corona-en-data.pdf?download=1
notes_C1: "Day care centers and elementary schools in 10 German states reopened on Monday, almost two months after their doors were shut due to a resurgence in the COVID-19 pandemic.    The states of Saxony and Lower Saxony had already had pupils return to schools. The latest reopenings bring the total number of states with open schools to 12 out of 16."     http://web.archive.org/web/20210227212106/https://www.dw.com/en/germany-schools-reopen-for-younger-children-amid-rising-covid-infections/a-56648597
notes_E2: Known measures terminated on 1 July 2020.      "Payment arrears from April 1 to June 30, 2020 do not entitle the landlord to terminate the contract for a period of 24 months. This limitation applies to cases where the backlog is due to the effects of the corona pandemic. The regulation is limited to the period from April 1 to June 30, 2020. ... These expired on July 1, 2020 and will not be extended. It has been shown that tenants and landlords were able to agree on a private basis in very many cases. For small businesses and solo self-employed, there were or are emergency aids and bridging aids, which can be used to offset operating costs such as rent or lease."    "The deferral of payments for consumer loan contracts and livelihood contracts such as telephone, electricity and gas expired on July 1, 2020."    (http://web.archive.org/web/20200619200735/https://www.bundesregierung.de/breg-de/themen/coronavirus/corona-informationen-miete-verbraucherschutz-1734914)
notes_E1: The measures mean that some sectors of the economy will still have to face significant restrictions on their business operations in the coming year. The Federal Government will therefore continue to provide financial support for the affected companies, self-employed individuals and selfemployed members of the independent professions. The improved interim financial help III package, which envisages subsidies for fixed costs, is available to this end. With improved conditions, in particular a higher monthly subsidy of up to a maximum of 500,000 euro for companies directly and indirectly affected by the closures, the Federal Government is doing what it can to safeguard businesses and employment.  Other than that, regular unemployment insurance is mandatory for all German workers, with 60% income replacement for 6-12 months following unemployment (depending on how long the individual was working in a formal job in the previous 36 months (24/36 months -> 12 months of 60% replacement, 12/36 months > 6 months). Only if individual was not working for more than 12 months in the previous three years, ALG II (fixed rate of 432€/month + other costs such as rents or heating) gets paid out instead.  https://web.archive.org/web/20201214202434/https://www.bundesregierung.de/resource/blob/656632/1827686/e97802de12b5f6e60f41b73234e618b7/2020-12-14-mpk-beschluss-corona-en-data.pdf?download=1
notes_C3: All states have banned social events, gatherings: "Meetings of small groups in public spaces are prohibited in all states"  https://web.archive.org/web/20200723095642/https://www.tagesschau.de/inland/laender-corona-103.html
notes_C6: Curfew between 8pm/9pm/10pm (depending on state) and 5am remains in place in Baden-Württemberg, Bayern, Sachsen, Bradenburg, and Thüringen, during which leaving the house is only allowed under very limited circumstances (e.g. medical emergencies). Between 5am and 8pm/9pm/10pm, there are more exceptions, including going to the supermarket, going to work (provided it is required and allowed under other restrictions), and exercise. In Berlin, you can only leave the house with "valid reasons" (effectively exceptions).    Other states have mostly adopted the federal guidelines limiting movement to within 15km around one's home whenever incidence over the past 7 days is above 200 infections/100000 residents. Mecklenburg-Vorpommern,       At least Bremen, Niedersachsen and Hamburg seem to have no such restrictions, making 2T the best fit.     https://web.archive.org/web/20210130185647/https://www.focus.de/gesundheit/coronavirus/corona-regeln-naechtliche-ausgangssperre-in-welchen-bundeslaendern-sie-immer-noch-gilt_id_12858482.html  https://web.archive.org/web/20210130191559/https://www.pnn.de/brandenburg/lockdown-bis-zum-31-januar-2021-das-ist-in-potsdam-und-brandenburg-erlaubt/26739656.html
notes_C8: In a press release of 13 May 2020, changes in the border regime were announced (see http://web.archive.org/web/20200528130558/https://www.bmi.bund.de/SharedDocs/pressemitteilungen/EN/2020/05/changes-in-the-border-regime.html) including    -"Restrictions at land borders will be relaxed. All cross-border traffic routes will be reopened. Checks will no longer be systematic, but rather flexible and risk-based"... "While travellers will still need a valid reason for entering Germany, more allowances will be made for travel for family-related and personal reasons.  -"Checks at the border with Luxembourg will end at midnight on 15 May 2020"  -"Regarding the EU’s external borders, the European Commission has recommended continuing restrictions on entry from non-EU countries until 15 June 2020. Germany is following this recommendation."  -" A 14-day quarantine should be ordered in future only for travellers entering Germany from countries outside of the EU."
notes_H8: Unclear about exact dating of individual measures.     In early summer, all states again allowed visits to nursing facilities. However, specific dates differ. Strict measures on visits prevail in principle. These also differ in the individual federal states.    https://web.archive.org/web/20201218095246/https://www.mdr.de/sachsen/corona-sachsen-besuchsregelung-seniorenheime-100.html    https://web.archive.org/web/20201218095311/https://www1.wdr.de/nachrichten/themen/coronavirus/altenheime-besuch-angehoerige-100.html    https://web.archive.org/web/20201218095346/https://www.mags.nrw/pressemitteilung/aufhebung-des-generellen-besuchsverbots-einrichtungen-der-pflege-und-der-eingliede
notes_C2: Hairdressers are to open across Germany, provided they follow strict hygiene restrictions and adopt a reservations-only system.    Source: http://web.archive.org/web/20210304015200/https://www.dw.com/en/german-hair-salons-reopen-as-covid-rules-eased/a-56733825    (**recorded from 3T because hairdressers are allowed to open, which I deem to be non-essential; also seems to apply across the country)    Previous coding: 3T  "Garden centres, florists and nail parlours are among businesses that will be allowed to reopen in several German states from Monday as regional leaders defied Mrs Merkel’s calls to extend the lockdown. Clothes shops will be allowed to reopen in the western state of Rhineland-Palatinate, but customers will have to make an appointment in advance."   https://archive.is/AUJqt#selection-177.0-181.145
notes_C4: Restrictions are now in place across the country, limiting the max of people meeting to be 2 households.   https://web.archive.org/web/20201101062313/https://www.bundesregierung.de/resource/blob/975226/1805024/5353edede6c0125ebe5b5166504dfd79/2020-10-28-mpk-beschluss-corona-data.pdf?download=1
notes_H7: "Partly as a result of the amount of unused Oxford/AstraZeneca supplies, the health ministry has altered its priority lists of who should be vaccinated so that teachers and carers from schools and kindergartens are eligible to receive one from Wednesday. Homeless people are also expected to be moved up the priority list."     However, as teachers and carers still qualify as key workers, no change in coding.     http://web.archive.org/web/20210224235807/https://www.theguardian.com/world/2021/feb/24/germany-frustration-grows-sluggish-rollout-covid-vaccines-falling-behind-uk
notes_H3: ***Recoded from 2 to 1. New lockdown measures note that while a contact tracing system is in place, it has been "impossible" due to high case loads. "Authorities hope the lockdown will bring down the infection rate enough to restart effective contact tracing — the high number of infections has made contact tracing impossible."     https://web.archive.org/web/20210106175200/https://www.dw.com/en/coronavirus-germany-extends-covid-lockdown-until-january-31/a-56134498
notes_C5: The federal and state governments call for unnecessary travel to be avoided in general. This also includes unnecessary journeys in public transport. Please wear an everyday mask on the S-Bahn and trains, in the train station, on the platform and at the stops as well as on the airport premises and on the plane. The minimum distance of 1.5 meters to travelers and staff should always be observed. Deutsche Bahn provides many tips on safe travel on its website. Unnecessary queues, e.g. B. in front of the on-board toilet can be avoided. The respective national hygiene regulations apply when getting on and off and at the airports. In general, please adhere to the rules of conduct that are summarized in the AHA formula (distance, hygiene rules, everyday mask). In this way, everyone can make a contribution while traveling to contain the spread of the new type of coronavirus. This formula is supplemented by A for app (the Corona warning app helps to break chains of infection) and L for ventilation.  https://web.archive.org/web/20201207220918/https://www.zusammengegencorona.de/informieren/alltag-gestalten/

name: Djibouti
notes_H1: The objectives are to provide intersectoral coordination; strengthen surveillance, laboratory confirmation and reporting; take preventive and precautionary measures; correctly detect and treat suspect, probable and confirmed cases; limit the transmission of COVID-19 in the event of cases or epidemic clusters at country level, in particular by reducing secondary infections; and communicate the necessary information on the risks of the disease to the community as well as fight against misinformation.   http://web.archive.org/web/20201113133151/http://www.emro.who.int/media/news/djibouti-joins-global-action-to-prevent-covid-19-as-first-case-is-confirmed-in-the-country.html
notes_H2: https://web.archive.org/web/20210104112225/https://dj.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/  COVID-19 Testing:      The Government of Djibouti offers COVID-19 tests at Bouffard Hospital. While the test itself is free, a negative COVID-19 test certificate costs 5,000 Fdj or $30.
notes_C7: Restrictions gradually being eased. https://web.archive.org/web/20200604203136/https://reliefweb.int/report/djibouti/republic-djibouti-covid-19-situation-report-7-10-may-2020
notes_C1: Schools are fully open   http://web.archive.org/web/20210329020811/https://en.unesco.org/covid19/educationresponse
notes_H6: Everywhere in public where social distance is not possible   http://web.archive.org/web/20210329030902/https://masks4all.co/what-countries-require-masks-in-public/
notes_E1: "Article 4: During the period of partial activity, the employee receives compensation for his loss of salary up to 70% of his previous gross salary.  This compensatory compensation is financed by the State up to 30% of the gross remuneration of the employee placed in partial activity. The remaining 40% is funded by the employer. The compensation under this article must not, in any case, be less than the guaranteed minimum interprofessional wage (SMIG) provided for by law n ° 221 / AN / 17 / 8ème L amending and supplementing law n ° 133 / AN / 05 / 5th L of January 28, 2006 on the Labor Code."      http://web.archive.org/web/20201113122936/https://www.presidence.dj/texte.php?ID=2020-049&ID2=2020-04-29&ID3=Arr%EF%BF%BDt%EF%BF%BD&ID4=8&ID5=2020-04-30&ID6=n
notes_C3: Government offices and places of worship have reopened with social distancing in place.    https://web.archive.org/web/20201115085005/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/djibouti/coronavirus
notes_C6: The use of facial masks in all public or private spaces in which social distancing cannot be observed is now mandatory, so is the installation of hand-washing facilities in any public or private establishment open to the public    https://web.archive.org/web/20200604203136/https://reliefweb.int/report/djibouti/republic-djibouti-covid-19-situation-report-7-10-may-2020
notes_C8: The Republic of Djibouti will reopen its air traffic on 17 July. According to the Government spokesperson, measures to prevent the transmission of COVID-19 will be taken within the airport, including systematic testing of passengers on arrival. The government will also work with neighboring countries to reopen land borders to allow Djiboutians to travel in the region during the summer.  https://web.archive.org/web/20200720204058/https://reliefweb.int/report/djibouti/iom-djibouti-covid-19-situation-report-9-12-july-2020
notes_C2: Restaurants, nightclubs, and the movie theater at Bawadi Mall are currently open.  Hotels resumed normal operations on 30th June 2020.  Restaurants and cafes reopened on 16th June 2020 with social distancing and hygiene measures in place; Conference rooms, event halls, and cinemas are closed until 1st September 2020;    https://web.archive.org/web/20201028083548/https://www.tralac.org/documents/resources/covid-19/regional/4180-covid-19-measures-in-place-in-comesa-member-states-27th-edition-23-october-2020/file.html    https://web.archive.org/web/20201028083802/https://dj.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_C4: Have inferred a ban of public gatherings from the closure of all events and non essentials services with the Nation wide lockdown imposed on the 23rd March 2020.   Lockdown has been extetended to May 1, 2020.   http://archive.fo/P9CqP
notes_H7: Djibouti received vaccines from AstraZeneca/Serum Institute of India (SII) through COVAX.   http://web.archive.org/web/20210329024920/https://www.unicef.org/mena/press-releases/first-quantity-covid-19-vaccines-arrives-djibouti     A- Health workers, B- Vulnerable population  The drive will cover health workers and the vulnerable population initially; wider inoculation will begin only by 2022.  http://web.archive.org/web/20210329044339/https://country.eiu.com/Djibouti/ArticleList/Updates/Economy
notes_H3: https://web.archive.org/web/20200416143208/http://www.sante.gouv.dj/Covid-19%20%20FINI.pdf  Explanation such as following indicates policy on contact tracing: "Close contact is a person who, starting 24 hours before the onset of symptoms of a confirmed case, shared the same place of life (for example: family, same room) or had direct contact with him, face to face, within 1 meter of the case and / or for more 15 minutes during a discussion; flirt; close friends; class or office neighbors; neighbors of the case in a prolonged means of transport; person providing care of a confirmed case or laboratory staff handling samples biology of a confirmed case, in the absence of adequate means of protection."
notes_C5: As of 17 May, urban public transport vehicles (buses, minibuses, tricycles and taxis) will be authorized to resume their activity  https://web.archive.org/web/20200604203136/https://reliefweb.int/report/djibouti/republic-djibouti-covid-19-situation-report-7-10-may-2020

name: Dominica
notes_H1: Original:  This data point is copied from the previous contributor; I could not find a source confirming when the campaign might have started. /web/20200421013223/http://dominica.gov.dm/corona  Dowling:  Website does not have a launch date but does say "March 2020" near the footer
notes_H2: Community level testing still continuing.   http://web.archive.org/web/20210208114529/https://www.dominicavibes.dm/news-264073/
notes_C7: Since businesses, shops, offices, churches, sports facilities and beauty salons are now operating normally without restriction, it could be implied that there are no longer restrictions in place. See: https://web.archive.org/web/20200706194429/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/dominica/coronavirus
notes_C1: Fully open under government safety guidance.   https://archive.vn/QR2yu
notes_H6: Required in public transportation.    https://web.archive.org/web/20201205233138/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/dominica/coronavirus  If you are healthy, you only need to wear a mask if you are taking care of a person with suspected 2019-nCoV infection.  https://web.archive.org/web/20210118180555/http://dominica.gov.dm/wear-a-mask-to-protect-against-coronavirus
notes_E2: No policy found.
notes_E1: "To mitigate the socio-economic impact authorities announced income transfers to the most vulnerable segments and tax relief programs for households and businesses." Source: https://www.imf.org/en/Topics/imf-and-covid19/Policy-Responses-to-COVID-19#D
notes_C3: No change.   http://web.archive.org/web/20210208111220/https://dominica.gov.dm/images/documents/Safe_Event_Checklist_Rev_2_Nov_1220_v4.pdf
notes_C6: People are recommended by the Ministry of Health, Wellness and New Health Investment Response to COVID-19 to "keep the elderly home to reduce their risk of getting sick" and "limit visitors".  https://web.archive.org/web/20210118164837/http://dominica.gov.dm/tips-to-protect-self-family
notes_C8: The government has released a list of countries within the CARICOM travel bubble, low risk, medium risk, and high risk. Depending on the risk level there are different procedures that must be followed. The strictest protocol applies to those coming from high risk countries: These individuals must quarantine for 5 days and receive a PCR test on day 5, if positive they must continue quarantining.  https://web.archive.org/web/20201021161244/https://dominica.gov.dm/images/documents/Travelprotocols_Portrait_Aug25_Rev6b.pdf
notes_H8: The Prime Minister held a news conference on 23 Mar 2020 and asked anyone over age 70 to stay home.   ” I am asking all persons over the age of 70 years old or any person who has an underlying that is not being managed properly to stay at home and minimize contact with the general public,”   https://web.archive.org/web/20201208184715/https://dominicanewsonline.com/news/homepage/news/covid-19-skerrit-suspends-classes-asks-elderly-and-medically-vulnerable-to-stay-home/    The government website now lists recommendations as well, so I am leaving this as in place from 23 March 2020 onward.   Recommendations:   Keep the elderly home to reduce their risk of getting sick.  To protect the elderly against COVID19, limit visitors, especially those that are sick.  To protect against COVID19 keep elderly in a well ventilated room.  https://web.archive.org/web/20201028144106/https://dominica.gov.dm/tips-to-protect-self-family
notes_C2: Businesses, shops, offices, churches, sports facilities and beauty salons are now operating normally without restriction, except for health protocols (physical distancing, hand sanitising, wearing face masks). Hotels and tour operators are not open in full capacity.   https://web.archive.org/web/20201205233138/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/dominica/coronavirus
notes_C4: Policies before the carnival weekend are still in place.   http://web.archive.org/web/20210208110444/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/dominica/coronavirus
notes_H7: All citizens are encouraged to get vaccinated.   Vaccines: Oxford-AstraZeneca vaccines, Sinopharm  http://web.archive.org/web/20210329194352/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/dominica/coronavirus  https://archive.vn/KKsmB
notes_H3: Latest information published on Mar. 1st.   https://archive.fo/WwKPc
notes_C5: I've seen no indication of bus closures; to the contrary, masks are required when riding the bus. Thus, I'm indicating "no measures" but would welcome seeing any reporting to the contrary, as I don't want to code this inaccurately.   https://web.archive.org/web/20201201151147/https://discoverdominica.com/en/island-transportation#:~:text=Dominica%2520has%2520a%2520reliable%2520public,%252410.25%2520according%2520the%2520specific%2520route.

name: Denmark
notes_H1: https://web.archive.org/web/20201020123535/https://coronasmitte.dk/en/entry-into-denmark
notes_H2: An offensive testing strategy comprising the testing of both a cohort of healthcare staff and a cohort of the general population, the tracking and tracing of outbreaks of coronavirus and home isolation of people with coronavirus. A representative portion of the population will be tested at regular intervals based on a clear plan.  https://web.archive.org/web/20200521225925/https://politi.dk/en/coronavirus-in-denmark/controlled-reopening-of-denmark
notes_C7: The restrictions imposed in North Jutland were "significantly eased from 19 November 2020", with a few exceptions.     It seems there are no restrictions on internal movement elsewhere in the country.    https://web.archive.org/web/20201121062734/https://coronasmitte.dk/overblik
notes_C1: ***Recoded from 2G to 3T. As of March 29: Following the broad political agreement on reopening, the Danish Agency for Patient Safety has also issued orders to close all schools and leisure facilities in Brøndby, Ishøj, Høje Taastrup and Vallensbæk municipalities due to high infection. The municipalities will at the same time be exempt from the political agreement on the reopening on 6 April 2021, cf. above    Coding remains at 3T due to these closures despite the following reopening:     As of 6 April 2021 further reopening of schools and higher education is accommodated nationwide. However, schools in Ishøj, Brøndby, Høje-Taastrup, Gladsaxe, Vallensbæk, Halsnæs, Helsingør, Fredensborg, Rødovre and Albertslund also remain closed. https://archive.vn/ZB3Xc     Schools and educational institutions which do not open from 6 April - https://archive.vn/7M6L1     Overview of reopening - https://archive.vn/NwXpb
notes_H6: The Danish Ministry of Transport and Housing issued a press release that as of 22 August 2020, all passengers aged 12 or more must wear face masks or shields on all means of public transport, on ferries and in taxis. Customer-facing staff must also wear face masks or shields.    http://web.archive.org/web/20200826184752/https://politi.dk/en/-/media/mediefiler/corona/genaabning/face-masks-or-shields-required-on-all-forms-of-public-transport-from-22-august-2020.pdf?la=en&hash=3438F39C3B8F72E5FA2BE5BC514308FF091C910C
notes_E2: Can't find any current evidence of current debt or contract relief for households. A review of this indicator going back to August shows that it's been consistently recoded using data related to businesses, rather than households or individuals (hence the shift from 2G to 0).
notes_E1: The compensation schemes for salary and revenue loss will continue until 31 January.    "The government and a broad majority of the parliamentary parties have just entered into an agreement that extends the aid packages until 31 January. "    There are also measures in place for self-employed and freelancers affected by restrictions.    http://web-old.archive.org/web/20201124093950/https://em.dk/nyhedsarkiv/2020/oktober/covid-19-ny-aftale-udvider-hjaelpepakker-til-dansk-erhvervs-kultur-og-idraetsliv/    https://archive.vn/xmKCO
notes_C3: New restrictions limit public gatherings to 5 people.     Source:  https://web.archive.org/web/20210108132053/https://coronasmitte.dk/overblik
notes_C6: Socialising and activities outside the house are not recommended. Guidance is to reduce seeing people as much as possible.     Source:  https://web.archive.org/web/20210108132053/https://coronasmitte.dk/overblik
notes_C8: Citizens of all countries have been banned from entering Denmark from January 9 until January 18, as part of the country’s efforts to prevent the further spread of the Coronavirus pandemic, precisely due to the new mutation of the virus found in Britain and some other countries.    In addition, Denmark’s Ministry of Foreign Affairs has urged all its citizens to avoid travelling to other countries due to the disease’s rapid spread, SchengenVisaInfo.com reports.    The latest announcement of Denmark’s authorities clarified that the whole world would be “sharpened from being orange to red.”    Denmark’s Foreign Minister Jeppe Kofod has stressed that the new mutations of the Coronavirus pandemic, spread in several other countries pose a significant risk that Denmark’s infection rates may escalate.      “The safety and security of Danes is the government’s priority. We can see the finish line. The vaccine is here. We must not stumble on the run-up stretch. Not least in the light of the new mutations, we will have to – all of us – make an extra effort. And today’s package of travel initiatives is an expression of that,” says Foreign Minister Jeppe Kofod.    Recently Denmark announced plans to impose a digital ‘vaccine passport’ which would permit all vaccinated citizens against COVID-19 disease to travel to countries which oblige citizens to have such a document, in order to be able to enter these countries.    According to the Danish Health Ministry, the ‘vaccine passport will be rolled out in early 2021,” and all those vaccinated would be eligible to obtain the document through Denmark’s public health website.  https://web.archive.org/web/20210111123210/https://www.schengenvisainfo.com/news/denmark-temporarily-bans-from-entering-citizens-of-all-countries/    From 5:00 p.m. on 9 January 2021 through 7 February 2021, Denmark has instituted a flight ban on the transport of passengers, including Danish citizens, who are unable to present a negative COVID-19 test taken within 24 hours before departure.   https://archive.vn/eOv2R
notes_H8: ***Recoded from 1G to 2G; as there are hygiene programs and some limitations/guidance on visitors to long-term care facilities, this meets the threshold for a 2G ("Narrow restrictions for isolation, hygiene in LTCFs, some limitations on external visitors and/or restrictions protecting elderly  people at home")      Original coding note:   Compared to previous advice, new guidance 25th November which contains:  Expansion of the National Board of Health's general advice and change in the formulation of the main priorities in the prevention of the spread of infection.  Clarifications regarding sections on the virus' transmission modes and symptoms of COVID-19.  Addition of a section on airways and ventilation.  Sharpened focus on situations where there is no concrete suspicion of infection with a new coronavirus, including a new section on the use of face protection products in common areas in accordance with temporary legal requirements, as well as the use of face protection products in close contact with the citizen in the citizen's home.  Clarifications in relation to the description of visit restrictions, including clarification of resp. The role of the Danish Agency for Patient Safety and the Ministry of Social Affairs and the Interior in this regard.  Addition of sections on resuscitation.  Addition of sections about employees who are at increased risk of a serious course with COVID-19  Clarifications in the section on testing when COVID-19 is not suspected or detected, as well as in the section on organizing testing for detected COVID-19 in the institution.  http://web.archive.org/web/20210115185122/https://www.sst.dk/da/Udgivelser/2020/Vejledning-om-forebyggelse-af-spredning-af-COVID-19-paa-plejecentre-bosteder
notes_C2: "Stores, such as DIY stores and interior design shops, with a size of no more than 5000 m2 - that are not located in a shopping centre - can reopen as of 1 March 2021 with a stricter requirement to ensure minimum distance between customers. Stores above 5000 m2 can open for a limited number of customers with a pre-booking. Shopping centres, shopping arcades and bazaars must continue to stay closed. The same applies to liberal professions who are not able to maintain the distance required to prevent infections, such as hairdressers, massage therapists, tattooists and driving schools. On the island of Bornholm, liberal professions who are not able to maintain distance can reopen with the requirement to wear face mask and present a negative COVID-19-test no older than 72 hours.    Further measures applicable until the end of 5 April 2021 include, but are not limited to, a ban on on-site consumption of food and drinks at restaurants etc. and the requirement that indoor cultural and sports facilities must stay closed. Further, citizens are still encouraged to work from home."     https://archive.is/8n1YM
notes_C4: On a press conference on October 23rd the prime minister announced new restrictions which are implemented from October 26rd. As part of these restrictions you are no longer allowed to be in groups with more than 10 people both in private homes and public places.   https://web.archive.org/web/20201030113153/https://coronasmitte.dk/overblik
