name: Jamaica
notes_H1: "Minister of Health and Wellness, Dr. the Hon. Christopher Tufton, says a Ministry-led national public education campaign is under way to heighten citizens’ awareness about the novel coronavirus.  Addressing journalists at a media briefing at the Ministry’s offices in New Kingston on February 5, Dr. Tufton said newspaper advertisements have commenced, and there are social media postings on his personal page as well as those of the Ministry and Regional Health Authorities.  “I understand we will hear some radio ads coming out soon,” the Minister added.  “We would have done a series of interviews… myself [and] the various medical team members. I get a call almost every day for a comment… and I try to respond because I know it’s important." https://web.archive.org/web/20200416163126/https://jis.gov.jm/public-education-campaign-to-heighten-awareness-about-coronavirus/
notes_C7: Are there restrictions on intercity or interstate travel? Yes   /web/20210216003154/https://jm.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information-jamaica/
notes_C1: Monday 4th Jan sees the start of the new school term, with some 129 schools offering face-to-face teaching and learning, providing they are safe to do so. Though some schools are still recommended to close and delivering virtual learning     https://web.archive.org/web/20210104145320/https://www.loopjamaica.com/content/129-schools-approved-face-face-learning-january-4
notes_H6: On April 20th, during a virtual press conference in Jamaica House, in Kingston, Prime Minister, the Most Hon. Andrew Holness said: “The wearing of a mask is now mandatory in all public spaces and that would include all public passenger vehicles". Source: http://web.archive.org/web/20200906212950/https://jis.gov.jm/all-jamaicans-must-wear-a-mask-in-public-pm/
notes_E2: No additional debt/contract relief reported   https://web.archive.org/web/20210322103045/https://www.imf.org/en/Topics/imf-and-covid19/Policy-Responses-to-COVID-19
notes_E1: Covid Allocation of Resources for Employees (CARE) program  All grants under CARE:  1. SET CASH - SUPPORTING EMPLOYEES WITH TRANSFER OF CASH  2. BEST CASH - BUSINESS EMPLOYEE SUPPORT & TRANSFER OF CASH  3. COVID-19 GENERAL GRANTS  4. COVID-19 COMPASSIONATE GRANTS  5. COVID-19 PATH GRANTS  6. COVID-19 SMALL BUSINESS GRANTS  7. COVID-19 TOURISM GRANTS  8. COVID-19 STUDENT LOAN RELIEF  9. OTHER COVID-19 SUPPORT PROGRAMMES  The Business Employee Support and Transfer of Cash (BEST Cash):  This will provide temporary cash transfers to registered businesses operating in the hotel, tours, attraction companies, segments of the tourism industry who are licensed with the Jamaica Tourist Board based on the number of workers they keep employed who are under the income tax threshold of $1.5 million. When such businesses file and pay their payroll returns as usual on the 15th of April, May and June, for each employee, with taxable income that is less than 1.5 on whose behalf statutory returns are applied, the Government will transfer funds at a rate of $9,000 per fortnight to that tourism related business, by direct transfer to their bank account, paid monthly. For the months of April, May and June that will equate to $54,000 for each employee they retain whose taxable income is less than $1.5 million    Informal sector - The Government will allocate $1 billion in additional funding to the Ministry of Labour and Social Security to provide Covid Grants to those who are marginally self-employed and informally employed.    The application portal for CARE opened on 9th April, 2020.     Minimum wage in Jamaica is $7000 per week i.e. $28000 p.m. Under this package, the maximum allocation over three months (April, May, June) is $57,000 i.e. $18,000 p.m. Hence, this will be less than 50% of lost income for many workers.      https://web.archive.org/web/20200531114547/https://jis.gov.jm/media/2020/04/CARE-Brochure-Ministry-of-Finance-2020.pdf  https://web.archive.org/web/20200531114621/https://home.kpmg/xx/en/home/insights/2020/04/jamaica-government-and-institution-measures-in-response-to-covid.html
notes_C3: "Where the law requires the granting of a permit for any event or gathering, no permits will be issued within the next 14 days, so that means any event, any entertainment events, any gathering that requires the issuing of a permit, we will instruct the permitting authorities, police, and the municipal councils not to issue any permits. Permits that are already issued will be rescinded, revoked effectively."    http://web.archive.org/web/20200426205459/https://opm.gov.jm/news/government-restricts-public-gatherings-for-the-next-14-days-in-wake-of-second-covid-19-case-in-jamaica-2/
notes_C6: There is an island wide curfew from 8pm to 5am.  /web/20210216001754/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/jamaica/coronavirus
notes_C8: 2. Jamaica’s most recent disaster risk management order, published on August 5th, stated: “All persons arriving in Jamaica are required to undergo a health screening and risk assessment.”  “ A person seeking to enter Jamaica at any time during the period from August 7, 2020, to September 30, 2020, who is ordinarily resident in Jamaica shall, on being permitted to enter Jamaica, be required to remain in quarantine, in isolation from other persons, in accordance with— (a) a home quarantine order; or (b) a Government facility quarantine order, issued to the person by a Medical Officer (Health)”   In the case of a “non-resident visiting Jamaica for business (duration of stay-less than fourteen days)” “the Medical Officer (Health), Medical Officer or public health officer has determined that you require testing for COVID19 and you are to be quarantined until released by the Parish Health Department. If you test negative and will be in country for less than fourteen days, the Parish Health Officer will advise you of your result and your release from quarantine.”  Also, any “non-national visiting Jamaica for tourism and staying in the resilient corridor” is “required to remain in the hotel property stated below within the COVID19 Tourism Resilient Corridor for the duration of your stay. You are required to report symptoms 842 PROCLAMATIONS, RULES AND REGULATIONS [AUGUST 5, 2020 to the health desk in your hotel or to the health department and based on assessment, you may be required to do a COVID-19 PCR test”.  Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20200906095950/https://jis.gov.jm/media/2020/08/Disaster-Risk-ManagementEnforcement-Measures-No.-11-Amendment-Order.pdf  Also, “from 20 August, visitors from high risk places the USA, Brazil, Mexico and the Dominican Republic will be required to upload a valid Polymerase Chain Reaction (PCR) test result, no more than seven days old. Approval for travel will be subject to the upload of the test result.” Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20200906175955/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/jamaica/entry-requirements
notes_H8: Prime Minister Andrew Holness has announced new and stricter COVID-19 measures under the Disaster Risk Management Act, effective March 1. Persons 60 years and older must Stay-at-Home.  Link: https://archive.vn/2FunD
notes_C2: The main business district, the Corporate Area of Kingston, will be restricted for the purposes of essential activity and residents should only venture out for such purposes  https://web.archive.org/web/20210111143809/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/jamaica/coronavirus
notes_C4: Gatherings of more than 10 people in any public place are not permitted     https://web.archive.org/web/20210410120042/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/jamaica/coronavirus
notes_H7: A & health officials over 60 years of age       Jamaica will begin administering COVID-19 vaccinations Tuesday to top government officials, including Cabinet members, Parliamentarians and heads of ministries and government agencies who are at least 60 years of age.     The Ministry of Health announced Monday night the group follows healthcare workers, police and members of the military who have already gotten their shots against the virus.   https://web.archive.org/web/20210322135947/https://www.voanews.com/covid-19-pandemic/jamaica-begin-mass-vaccinations-top-govt-officials-over-60-years-old    Since Jamaica began its immunization program six days ago, some 15,000 people have been vaccinated.
notes_H3: Actions the Ministry of Health and Wellness are taking include continuing “contact tracing, testing and quarantine of MOHW workers who are contacts of a confirmed case at the MOHW Head Office.”, and escalating “the identification of cases and contacts, contact tracing, establishment of national quarantine and isolation facilities and installation of equipment and materials for case management.” The Pan American Health Organisation (PAHO) situation report for Jamaica states 8,064 contacts have been identified and 2,465 close contacts are being followed (contact tracing figures were updated at 18:00 on September 3rd). Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20200906102239/https://www.paho.org/en/situation-report-covid-19-jamaica
notes_C5: "It also reminded commuters that passengers will only be carried between 6:00 am and 6:00 pm daily, in keeping with the latest restrictions announced by the Government."  Source: http://www.jamaicaobserver.com/auto-front-page/new-rules-for-public-transportation_192749

name: Jordan
notes_H1: On March 5, abriefing noted that a free hotline number, 111, will be established soon under the title "Ask about Corona" for inquiries about the virus, its symptoms and preliminary diagnosis.    The ministry also organised a media tour of Queen Alia International Airport to view the newly installed thermal detectors and precautionary measures in dealing with arrivals.    The Ministry of Health called on the public to avoid direct contact with any person showing symptoms of respiratory diseases and to maintain personal hygiene.    The Jordan Ministry of Health has established the following hotline numbers for virus-related enquiries: 065004545 and 0778410186.  https://web.archive.org/save/https://jordantimes.com/news/local/health-ministry-bolsters-measures-combat-spread-coronavirus
notes_H2: Testing is available to everyone in Jordan, with a cost of 28JD, across 33 centres.   https://web.archive.org/web/20210329193841/https://jo.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_C7: There is no restriction on travel between cities/regions, but travel is restricted during the curfew hours.   "The daily curfew will now begin at 6 p.m. for businesses and 7 p.m. for individuals and will extend until 6 a.m. the following morning."  "The comprehensive Friday curfews will continue and will now begin at 7 p.m. on Thursday and end at 6 a.m. on Saturday"  https://web.archive.org/web/20210329155751/https://jo.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_C1: "Starting March 10, all schools are closed.  Students in all grades, including students in universities, cultural centers, and vocational training institutes, will conduct remote learning until further notice. Nurseries remain open"  https://web.archive.org/web/20210323002949/https://jo.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_H6: The Government of Jordan continues to implement social distancing regulations and mandatory mask wearing in business establishments, public transportation, and government facilities due to COVID-19.   https://web.archive.org/web/20210329193841/https://jo.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_E2: Unable to find new updates regarding the same.  https://web.archive.org/web/20210308145220/https://jo.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/  http://web.archive.org/web/20210308150310/https://corona.moh.gov.jo/en/MediaCenter/2660
notes_E1: "In an attempt to reduce the consequences on the poorest households, the Jordanian government established official prices for different commodities, including bread and vegetables. ... According to Basma Ishaqat, minister of social development, around 350,000 families have received financial and in-kind support since the virus outbreak." https://web.archive.org/web/20200615110849/https://www.middleeasteye.net/news/coronavirus-jordan-economy-year-over-for-us
notes_C3: Starting March 10, the following sectors will be closed until March 31: nightclubs, bars, discos, and counters that serve alcoholic drinks, swimming pools, sports centers, academies, and clubs, oriental baths, equestrian clubs, and public parks.  https://web.archive.org/web/20210323002949/https://jo.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_C6: As of 6th October 2020, there will be a nationwide comprehensive curfew? every Friday at 12:00 a.m. until 12:00 a.m. Sunday. The nightly curfew will remain in effect nationwide from 1 a.m. to 6 a.m., and 12:00 a.m. to 6 a.m. for commercial establishments.  https://web.archive.org/web/20201015100923/https://jo.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_C8: Update: Jordanian authorities suspended flights between Jordan and the UK from Dec. 21-Jan. 3 due to concerns regarding the spread of a newly discovered coronavirus disease (COVID-19) strain; the measure applies to both direct and indirect flights.  https://web.archive.org/web/20201221175540/https://www.garda.com/crisis24/news-alerts/418901/jordan-authorities-suspend-flights-with-the-uk-through-jan-3-due-to-new-covid-19-strain-update-59
notes_H8: While there are measures to protect the overall population, there are no specific measures which address the needs of the elderly specifically. For example, there are no policy recommendations in relation to a specific age group or no long term care facility policies/recommendations.   https://web.archive.org/web/20210329201129/https://corona.moh.gov.jo/en/MediaCenter
notes_C2: Starting March 10, the following sectors will be closed until March 31: nightclubs, bars, discos, and counters that serve alcoholic drinks, swimming pools, sports centers, academies, and clubs, oriental baths, equestrian clubs, and public parks.  https://web.archive.org/web/20210323002949/https://jo.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_C4: " Jordan restricts gatherings to 20 people."  https://web.archive.org/web/20200819000926/https://jo.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_H7: Vaccinations paid by the government and available to a broad group. "Any individual on Jordanian soil is eligible to receive the vaccine, and it is free-of-charge"  https://web.archive.org/web/20210329210938/https://help.unhcr.org/jordan/en/frequently-asked-questions-unhcr/covid-19-vaccine/  https://web.archive.org/web/20210329193841/https://jo.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_H3: Health experts in the country said the resurgent pandemic illustrated the limits of lockdowns and closed borders without a strong testing and contact-tracing system, especially when dealing with a lengthy pandemic:  https://web.archive.org/web/20210201213954/https://www.theguardian.com/world/2020/nov/04/jordan-suffers-covid-surge-after-early-success-against-virus
notes_C5: Public transportation remains operational at 50% capacity and mask wearing is mandatory.    Source: http://web.archive.org/web/20200909093411/https://jo.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/  http://web.archive.org/web/20200909091639/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/jordan/coronavirus

name: Japan
notes_H1: Cabinet Office Twitter -- Published informational leaflet on COVID-19 control; free to reprint, reproduce (https://web.archive.org/web/20200413192433/https://twitter.com/kantei_saigai/status/1224589187719946240)
notes_H2: Patients are being identified from doctor reports on suspected patients in accordance with the Infectious Diseases Control Act. A PCR test is conducted if the doctor considers it necessary based on the diagnosis.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210123085826/https://www.mhlw.go.jp/stf/seisakunitsuite/bunya/0000121431_00182.html
notes_C7: Recommendation from Minister in charge of covid response: “We’re extremely alarmed by the situation,” Nishimura said, urging the public to avoid nonessential outings and traveling in and out of the targeted regions, even though there is nothing forcing people to comply." http://web.archive.org/web/20210409112108/https://www.japantimes.co.jp/news/2021/04/09/national/tokyo-kyoto-okinawa-covid-19-measures/
notes_C1: Some schools are closed because of outbreaks or local govt recommendations, but most schools are open with some measures in place  In most prefectures of Japan, schools have reopened by June 1. However, the situation continues to be monitored on the local level, and municipalities can choose to keep some schools closed or to close them again. Most universities are still conducting research and teaching in an online format to the greatest possible extent. (1.) For example, on June 13,  a local cluster was found in a Kitakyushu school, leading to an announcement that the school will be closed again. (2.)     (1.) https://archive.vn/oUa0v   (2.) https://archive.vn/D8EL1    https://www.mext.go.jp/content/20200603-mxt_kouhou01-000004520_4.pdf (For reviewers and updaters: Web archive services are unavailable in China, please archive this link when you see this)  Education Ministry  98% of the schools in total of all levels have reopened as of 1 June.    Note from 21 Aug: "Many schools across the nation reopened Monday after summer vacations were shortened to allow students to catch up on classes missed when schools closed due to the novel coronavirus pandemic."      https://web.archive.org/web/20200821005509/https://www.japantimes.co.jp/news/2020/08/17/national/japan-schools-restart-coronavirus/
notes_H6: "People have posited several reasons for Japan's success, including an existing culture of mask-wearing."    https://web.archive.org/web/20201130181516/https://www.businessinsider.com/how-japan-tackled-coronavirus-without-a-lockdown-2020-5      "Infections among essential workers have also been limited in Japan in comparison to Western countries, which is probably due to avoidance of the three Cs and wearing of masks.  The national state of emergency has been lifted, but heightened awareness of the danger of the three Cs remains and this has helped to curtail any major increase in infections even after the end of the “soft” lockdown."    https://web.archive.org/web/20201130181501/https://www.nippon.com/en/in-depth/d00592/
notes_E2: ***Recoded from 0 to 2 to reflect new policies located. May exist pre-Jan 22, but this is the farthest back located on the policy. Should be reviewed historically.   htps://archive.vn/9q2Pst    Coding Note:     Found new information, and have to revise coding up to 2.    Support for improvement of household finances: the government provides support for the use of delinquent rent, taxes, utility charges, etc., as well as various benefit systems.    10-day life support: For those who have lost their residence, the government provides necessary support for daily life such as food, clothing, and housing for a certain period of time.    Housing Security Benefits: Rent expenses will be provided for a long-term period of time to those who are financially distressed due to turnover, etc., and who have lost their residence or who are likely to do so, provided that they are seeking employment.    These details about the measures are provided on the related ministry’s website, linking of to pdf docs:   https://archive.vn/9q2Ps  PDF does not get archived, so uploaded as shared file to oneDrive: https://1drv.ms/b/s!AjvFoN9mD2CwkZgCGc6g4PGdeq-rkQ?e=a8Nhb5  Auto-translated Word doc:  https://1drv.ms/w/s!AjvFoN9mD2CwkZgDpXFXEH8efFJpJQ?e=IuM6VT
notes_E1: ***Recoded from 1A to 2A based on new information, see below:     Have to revise up because I found new information.    Eligible: workers from small and medium-sized businesses which were closed between April 1, Reiwa 2 (2020) and February 28, Reiwa 3 (2021) because of the novel coronavirus and measures to prevent its spread, so who were unable to receive payment of wages (leave allowance) during this period.    Amount paid:  Of pre-holiday wages 80% (Maximum daily amount 11,000yen)  In addition, as maternal health management measures related to the novel coronavirus infection, a paid leave system is established. This applies to pregnant female workers who are required to take leave under the guidance of a doctor or midwife has been established.    The application period for this is valid from June 15 2020 to May 31 2021.    These details about the measures are provided on the related ministry’s website, linking of to pdf docs:   https://archive.vn/9q2Ps    PDF does not get archived, so uploaded as shared file to oneDrive: https://1drv.ms/b/s!AjvFoN9mD2CwkZgCGc6g4PGdeq-rkQ?e=a8Nhb5  Auto-translated Word doc:  https://1drv.ms/w/s!AjvFoN9mD2CwkZgDpXFXEH8efFJpJQ?e=IuM6VT    While the latest information I can find that confirms freelancers are eligible for this support is from May 2020, I also can’t find any information that expressly excludes freelancers in subsequent extensions of this support policy, so coding as A rather than F.  https://archive.vn/WFdtg#selection-773.157-773.179
notes_C3: Some events have been cancelled, postponed, or held online.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210102183310/https://www.japan.travel/en/coronavirus/
notes_C6: Voluntary restrictions have been loosened again in Tokyo.  https://www.japantimes.co.jp/news/2020/09/10/national/tokyo-bars-hours-coronavirus/
notes_C8: "To contain the spread of COVID-19, the Government of Japan will reimplement strict travel regulations barring most foreign entry into Japan effective Monday, December 28. While Japanese citizens and foreign residents with a reentry permit will be generally permitted to reenter the country, these reimplemented restrictions include suspension of short-term travel programs, suspension of quarantine relaxations for certain travelers, imposition of travel deadlines for already-issued visas, and enhanced COVID-19 screening protocols for travelers arriving from specific destinations."      https://web.archive.org/web/20210104182744/https://jp.usembassy.gov/health-alert-december-28-2020/      "From December 28, 2020, until the end of January 2021, entry into Japan from all countries and regions (except for the United Kingdom and Republic of South Africa) under this framework will not be permitted.  The GOJ decided that all foreign nationals who stayed in the United Kingdom (from December 24, 2020) and South Africa (from December 26, 2020) within 14 days prior to submitting the application of landing with this framework will be denied to enter Japan until further notice."    https://web.archive.org/web/20210104183340/https://www.mofa.go.jp/ca/cp/page22e_000925.html      Dec 26, 2020: "The Japanese government has decided to suspend new entries of foreign nationals in an effort to stop the influx of a new coronavirus variant."    https://web.archive.org/web/20201226141906mp_/https://www3.nhk.or.jp/nhkworld/en/news/20201227_01/
notes_H8: Restrictions expanded to all Japanese prefectures:    "The MHLW will also notify and ensure the following measures to thoroughly  prevent nosocomial infection in medical institutions and facilities for the  elderly.  - Take every possible precautious measure to prevent workers from being a  source of infection including by thoroughly avoiding the 3-Cs.  5  - Temporarily stop receiving visitors except for emergency cases in order to  prevent infection.  - Consider measures such as suspending or restricting temporary use of  such facilities in areas where infection is prevalent.  - Isolate a suspected patient immediately and implement counter-infection  measures under the guidance of public health centers."    http://web.archive.org/web/20210110131747/https://www.mhlw.go.jp/content/10900000/000624195.pdf
notes_C2: "The government of Hokkaido, which has been asking nightlife establishments not to operate between 10 p.m. and 5 a.m. since Nov 7, also decided Thursday to extend the duration of its request to Dec 11. The local government originally planned to lift the request Saturday."    https://web.archive.org/web/20201130175735/https://japantoday.com/category/national/4-major-cities-seek-shorter-business-hours-amid-pandemic
notes_C4: National guidelines continue to be events are allowed, but with a restriction to 5000 people.  (Maximum number of people / accommodation rate)  [Indoor] 5000 people or less and 50% or less of the capacity  [Outdoor] 5000 people or less and a sufficient distance between people (2m as much as possible)    https://archive.vn/kqhkl
notes_H7: A: medical personal  Vaccines: Pfizer approved and being used. AstraZeneca under review.  https://archive.vn/iuQV6#selection-2727.0-2743.29    The period of inoculation has started February 17, 3rd year of Reiwa (2021). Initially, vaccinations will be given to medical staff. After that, it is expected that vaccination will proceed in the order of elderly people and those with underlying diseases. The inoculation of elderly people is expected to start after April 1st at the earliest.  https://archive.vn/SqjEL#selection-2283.0-2289.128    Health care workers began to receive vaccination. A total of about 40,000 people from 100 medical institutions nationwide, including the National Hospital Organization , are scheduled to receive it. Of these, 20,000 will be subject to health surveys, and information such as side effects will be collected during this period, which will lead to vaccination of a wide range of residents including the elderly from April.  Priority vaccination of about 3.7 million medical workers following the advance vaccination is scheduled to start in March, but if a sufficient amount is secured for the advance vaccination, it can be advanced at the discretion of the medical institution.  https://archive.vn/Q296C
notes_H3: Cabinet Office  http://www.kantei.go.jp/jp/singi/novel_coronavirus/th_siryou/sidai_r020130.pdf (in Japanese)  The first case confirmed on 15th Jan.
notes_C5: Scheduled changes to reduce late night crowds on public transportation ended on March 12th.  https://archive.ph/E5ud8    There are no restrictions to public transportation other than hygiene measures.  https://archive.ph/SAyqX    There are extensive measures in place to circulate air regularly and disinfect surfaces, social distancing and to avoid having to touch surfaces like ticket machines.  https://archive.ph/8xcFI

name: Kazakhstan
notes_H1: On March 16 Kazakstan declared the state of emergency, followed by massive information campaign: (https://web.archive.org/web/20200413200152/https://liter.kz/v-kazahstane-vvedeno-chrezvychajnoe-po/)
notes_H2: The government is not testing everyone showing COVID-19 symptoms. The price of the COVID-19 test is still expensive for the general public. The government has promised to reduce the price of the COVID-19 test soon.   Link: https://archive.vn/WKHZu
notes_C7: Uilsky district of Aktobe region entered the "red zone" for the spread of coronavirus. Sanitary posts have been established there.   "Everyone who enters or leaves the district center will have their temperature measured and data recorded. Those who have symptoms of COVID-19 will be isolated for two days in a quarantine hospital for PCR testing.  Link: https://archive.vn/6iATq
notes_C1: From January 11, Grades 1-5 will study in a traditional format in duty classes. For Grades 9, 11, 12 - 70% of subjects will be held in a traditional format, 30% - remotely. Other grades will study fully remotely. Links: https://archive.vn/LucfO https://archive.vn/uLQBC
notes_H6: Face masks are required at all times in public places.  *******  Quote from archived link:  "Masks Required: The Chief Sanitary Doctor of Kazakhstan has mandated that masks be worn nationwide in public settings, including both indoor and outdoor spaces and on public transportation. Failure to comply with this measure could result in administrative penalty."  _______________________________________________________________________________________________  Web Archived Link:  http://archive.today/2021.02.15-161556/https://kz.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/      ******  Quote from archived link:  "Residents must wear protective facemasks and practice social distancing at all times while in public."    _____________________________________________________________________________________  Web Archived link:  https://www.garda.com/crisis24/news-alerts/430916/kazakhstan-as-of-jan-18-authorities-re-add-nur-sultan-to-red-zone-for-covid-19-infections-update-30
notes_E2: No debt and contract relief for a household is provided.  Link: https://archive.vn/aC6JN
notes_E1: Income support was provided during strict lockdown measures in 2020. However, the government has not announced any income support measures in 2021 for those who lost their jobs. Links: https://archive.vn/1e9Dy https://archive.vn/aC6JN
notes_C3: Government cancels all public events, including the Norouz holiday celebrations and a military parade devoted to 75th anniversary of the victory over Nazi Germany.  https://web.archive.org/web/20200825082025/https://www.reuters.com/article/us-health-coronavirus-kazakhstan/kazakhstan-suspends-all-public-events-over-coronavirus-idUSKBN20Z0OD https://web.archive.org/web/20201113213642/https://www.rferl.org/a/armenia-puts-restrictions-on-public-and-private-events-amid-spike-in-coronavirus-cases/30492284.html https://archive.vn/wjQVP
notes_C6: Elderly people (65+) are required to stay at home, which is recorded here as a 1. Otherwise, non-essential businesses remain open, albeit some with requirements and curfews.    Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20210405224633/https://www.garda.com/crisis24/news-alerts/463681/kazakhstan-authorities-amend-list-of-regions-based-on-epidemiological-risk-april-5-update-36
notes_C8: According to the US embassy, the Kazakhstani border remains closed to foreigners with highly limited exceptions, including citizens of those countries with which Kazakhstan has resumed direct flights (China, South Korea, Japan, Thailand, and Turkey).  http://web.archive.org/web/20200808130057/https://kz.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_H8: 'Persons over 65 years of age are not permitted to leave their accommodations except in an emergency.'    Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20210405224633/https://www.garda.com/crisis24/news-alerts/463681/kazakhstan-authorities-amend-list-of-regions-based-on-epidemiological-risk-april-5-update-36
notes_C2: As of 5th April 2021, the 'government of Kazakhstan has updated the nation's list of regions under strict quarantine regimes due to high COVID-19 activity'. 'Authorities use a color-coded system to track disease activity in each region and impose local restrictions accordingly. Under the system, regions are classified as one of three zones - green, yellow, or red, in order of increasing risk of transmission.'     In red zones, namely the cities 'Nur-Sultan, Almaty, and Aktobe, as well as the regions of Almaty, Atyrau, and West Kazakhstan', 'Operating hours have been reduced and capacity restricted at restaurants, cafes, theaters, cinemas, shopping malls, and leisure facilities.'     In yellow zones, catering establishments operate on a curfew, and 'Shopping centers must close at 17:00 on Saturdays and are not permitted to operate on Sundays.'    In green zones, 'nonessential businesses are operating, including shopping centers, retailers, covered markets, salons, and restaurants; all establishments must operate at reduced capacity, enforce social distancing, and provide hand sanitizer.' 'Recreational and cultural facilities, such as cinemas, nightclubs, and bowling alleys, may not operate on weekends.'    This indicator is coded as 1T on weekdays, as there are limits on the operations of businesses in some zones.     Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20210405224633/https://www.garda.com/crisis24/news-alerts/463681/kazakhstan-authorities-amend-list-of-regions-based-on-epidemiological-risk-april-5-update-36
notes_C4: According to a new decree of Chief Sanitary Doctor from December 25, more than 5 people in a group are not allowed to walk outside.  Link: https://archive.vn/Ywh7y
notes_H7: An announcement was made by the government of Kazakhstan to commence mass vaccinations from 1 Feb 2021    A - Key workers : E.g. doctors, teachers, and law enforcement workers  (Sputnik V)    **************  Quote from site linked:  "Kazakhstan launched local production of the Russia-developed vaccine (Sputnik V) in December 2020 and started voluntary vaccination of the local population on February 1. The authorities plan to vaccinate six million people (about one third of the population) free of charge by end-2021. The first stage vaccination is expected to cover groups with high risk exposure, including doctors, teachers, and law enforcement workers. In addition, a locally developed vaccine (QazCovid-in) and the vaccine developed by Pfizer are expected to be available for vaccination later in the year."    _____________________________________________________________________________________________  Web Archived link:  http://archive.today/2021.02.15-163514/https://www.imf.org/en/Topics/imf-and-covid19/Policy-Responses-to-COVID-19%23top    AND    http://archive.today/2021.02.15-161556/https://kz.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/    AND    http://archive.today/2021.02.15-180358/https://www.gov.kz/memleket/entities/dsm/press/news/details/148026?lang=ru
notes_H3: No manual contact tracing is reported in Kazakhstan. Some cities launching pilot testing of the Ashyq app that allows identifying infected people. However, this is not a manual tracing.  Link: https://archive.vn/uhqGf
notes_C5: As of 5th April 2021, the 'government of Kazakhstan has updated the nation's list of regions under strict quarantine regimes due to high COVID-19 activity'. 'Authorities use a color-coded system to track disease activity in each region and impose local restrictions accordingly. Under the system, regions are classified as one of three zones - green, yellow, or red, in order of increasing risk of transmission.'     In red zones, namely the cities 'Nur-Sultan, Almaty, and Aktobe, as well as the regions of Almaty, Atyrau, and West Kazakhstan', 'Public transport is suspended on weekends and public holidays.'     In yellow zones, 'Public transport operates 06:00-23:00 on weekdays and is suspended on Sundays.'     In green zones, 'Public transportation and nonessential businesses are operating, including shopping centers, retailers, covered markets, salons, and restaurants; all establishments must operate at reduced capacity, enforce social distancing, and provide hand sanitizer.'     This indicator is coded as 1T on weekdays because there are some restrictions in place, but they do not apply to green zones. On weekends, this indicator is coded as 2T as public transport is required to close entirely in some zones (as above).    Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20210405224633/https://www.garda.com/crisis24/news-alerts/463681/kazakhstan-authorities-amend-list-of-regions-based-on-epidemiological-risk-april-5-update-36

name: Kenya
notes_H1: Public Communications on Covid-19, including posters, on social media from Ministry of Health.  http://web.archive.org/web/20200824054005/https://twitter.com/MOH_Kenya/status/1232361147904466949/photo/1
notes_H2: Rapid antigen tests will be used for symptomatic individuals and their immediate household and workplace contacts; health-care workers in high risk areas, rapid response teams, labs and A&E; in outbreaks associated with superspreader events; for prison remandees; and for high risk patients in health facilities.  Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20201214155230/https://www.health.go.ke/wp-content/uploads/2020/12/Interim_Antigen_Testing_Guide_COVID-19.docx-1.pdf
notes_C7: 'On 26 March the Government of Kenya imposed a cessation of all movement by road into or out of Nairobi, Kajiado, Machakos, Kiambu and Nakuru counties, effective from 20:00 on Sunday 28 March and until further notice. It clarified that trains will operate until 12:00 on Monday 29 March and domestic flights will continue to operate until 18:00 on 29 March, and will cease thereafter. ... Travel inside the five county zone is also permitted. Starting from midnight on 26 March the curfew in these five counties will be in effect from 20:00 to 04:00 (local time).'    https://archive.vn/fc0R8
notes_C1: Schools reopen across at all levels across Kenya with safety measures.    Source: http://web.archive.org/web/20210104165206/https://uk.reuters.com/article/us-health-coronavirus-schools-kenya/parents-worry-as-crowded-kenyan-schools-reopen-after-coronavirus-shutdown-idUKKBN29912E  Source: http://web.archive.org/web/20210104165042/https://drive.google.com/file/d/1yC9Vo6HzKUQC_v85HQZZJYlCRfIoaRcC/view
notes_H6: No change.  The Government of Kenya has directed that face masks must be worn in public places, except when dining, or when adhering to social distancing in hotels, gardens or on beaches.  Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20201116132652/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/kenya/coronavirus
notes_E2: "Kenyan banks will allow personal borrowers who get into difficulties because of the coronavirus crisis to extend their loans for up to a year"  http://web.archive.org/web/20200718162454/https://www.reuters.com/article/health-coronavirus-kenya/update-2-kenyan-rwandan-banks-to-offer-relief-to-distressed-borrowers-central-banks-say-idUSL8N2BB2J1
notes_E1: Labour and Social Protection Cabinet Secretary Simon Chelugui has indicated that the cash transfers to poor households will be terminated in the first week of October when funds will dry up. This will end six months of social safeguards to the poor. The government has been sending about Sh1.3 billion every month. Since May, some 341,958 households have received the weekly Sh1,000 stipend to cushion them from the economic hardships caused by the pandemic.  Link: https://archive.vn/I9Pc8
notes_C3: On March 13, the Health Ministry announced that for at least 30 days, "All Kenyans should observe the following: [...] Suspend all public gatherings, meetings, religious crusades games events etc. Normal church services can go on provided they provide sanitizing/and hand washing." SOURCE: http://web.archive.org/web/20200420175657/http://www.health.go.ke/first-case-of-coronavirus-disease-confirmed-in-kenya/
notes_C6: No change. 60 day curfew 11pm-4am as announced on the 29th of September.
notes_C8: Travellers must present a negative COVID-19 PCR test upon entry. Travellers not from one of 186 quarantine exempt countries must quarantine upon arrival.  Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20201116132652/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/kenya/coronavirus  Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20201116133203/https://www.kcaa.or.ke/sites/default/files/docs/covid_19/exempted_states.pdf
notes_H8: While the statement from the Ministry of Health does not single out elderly individuals in terms of staying home (rather, opting for a more general recommendation), it does include special protections for shopping (separated lines and priority at the supermarkets) and the provision for *hospitals* (not LTCFs) "to restrict patient visitation to family and relatives of patients who have been expressly contacted by the hospital."    While this does not seem to rise to a 2G, 0 seems like a bad fit given the additional restrictions. Therefore, coded as 1G.    https://web.archive.org/web/20201101195445/https://www.health.go.ke/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/1584711987736-Press-statement-20th-March-2020.pdf
notes_C2: 'On 26 March 2021, the Government of Kenya confirmed that bars in the counties of Nairobi, Machakos, Kajiado, Kiambu and Nakuru are closed and that eateries and restaurants in the same counties will provide takeaways services only and will not serve alcohol. Bars, restaurants and eateries in all other counties would continue to close at 9pm (local time), but will be permitted to sell alcohol.'    Despite of the new strictions, '[p]ublic places, tourism and hospitality establishments, travel and tour companies, hotels and other accommodations, and recreation facilities are allowed to operate, provided they comply with Government of Kenya public health protocols, including 1.5 metre social distancing and the night-time curfew.  ...  Pharmacies and other shops selling essential products remain open, though business hours may be affected by the nationwide curfew.'    https://archive.vn/fc0R8
notes_C4: On 26 March 2021, the Government of Kenya confirmed that '[t]he suspension of large gatherings, in person meetings of any nature, congregational worship, conferences and political events have been suspended in the counties of Nairobi, Machakos, Kajiado, Kiambu and Nakuru until further notice.  In other counties the maximum number of persons permitted to attend meetings or events has been capped at 15, permitted to attend funerals has been capped at 50, weddings capped at 30, with all in attendance expected to abide by Ministry of Health protocols.'    https://archive.vn/fc0R8
notes_H7: 'Kenya has offered free COVID-19 vaccines to all diplomats based there, including thousands of United Nations staff, even though it has not completed inoculating its own health workers, other frontline staff or elderly, drawing criticism from local medics.  ...  The government note said vaccinations would begin on March 23 and only accredited diplomats and their families were eligible.'    https://archive.vn/O6H7H
notes_H3: Because testing is generally available through the voluntary testing scheme, it may be assumed that contract tracing is also comprehensive.   https://web.archive.org/save/https://www.africanews.com/2020/05/31/kenyans-heed-govt-s-voluntary-covid-19-testing-scheme//
notes_C5: According to the UK government's website on travel to Kenya, The Government of Kenya has directed that, in addition to public transport systems, social distancing rules – in the form of capacity restrictions – will also apply when using private vehicles, including taxis. This means five-seater vehicles will only be allowed to carry two passengers in addition to the driver, while seven-seater vehicles will only be allowed four passengers in addition to the driver. Please see:   https://web.archive.org/web/20210411174349/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/kenya/coronavirus

name: Kyrgyz Republic
notes_H1: There is a dedicated government website on the epidemic: covid.kg , which reports daily cases and advice for keeping safe, as well as a Telegram channel: https://xn--r1a.website/s/RshKRCOV.    The Kyrgyz Ministry of Health also publishes COVID-related advice  on their website: med.kg
notes_H2: Quote (1):    "COVID-19 Testing    Are PCR and/or antigen tests available for U.S. citizens in the Kyrgyz Republic? Yes  If so, are test results reliably available within 72 hours? Yes   The Ministry of Health provides free testing only for symptomatic patients.  For those requiring a negative PCR test for travel, state laboratories in Bishkek and Osh can provide tests for a fee (approximately $20), depending on testing capacity.  Private COVID-19 testing is also available for a fee ($30) at Bonetsky Laboratory or Aqualab. "    Link (1):    http://archive.today/2021.04.03-155858/https://kg.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/  _________________________________________    Quote (2):  "Private laboratories are offering COVID-19 testing for people who are not showing symptoms of Coronavirus. Both PCR and antibody tests are available."    Link (2):    http://archive.today/2021.04.03-155331/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/kyrgyzstan/coronavirus
notes_C7: From 11 December 2020, inter-regional transport services has resumed, though passengers must undergo health screenings. name: Cambodia
notes_H1: MOH in cooperation with Unicef is distributing posters and billboards, there are radio and TV announcements, and until recently MOH was issuing text messages to mobile phones recommending safety steps (haven’t seen any for about 10 days now). This prohibition is applicable to travel between all provinces, except for travel between Phnom Penh and Kandal province.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210412191011/https://kh.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/

notes_C6: Phnom Penh has implemented a daily curfew from 8:00 pm to 5:00 am effective from April 1 through April 14, 2021. The curfew suspends in-person restaurant and food stall service and forbids most types of gatherings and travel within the city during curfew hours. Exceptions to restrictions during curfew hours include travel for emergency medical need, gatherings with family members, and travel for work for those businesses permitted to remain open.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210412191011/https://kh.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_C8: Since the last update by the US embassy it seems like everyone must abide by the 14 day quarantine, even if everyone entering the country has a negative test result:  "Cambodian authorities have also introduced the following requirements for prevention, containment, and response to the spread of COVID-19 for all travelers entering Cambodia by air, land, and water.? All arriving foreigners must:  Fully abide by locally enforced quarantine measures for 14 days at a hotel designated by the Government of Cambodia."  https://web.archive.org/web/20201124224049/https://kh.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_H8: Government recommends stay home if possible for all populations.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210221195415/https://www.who.int/cambodia/internal-publications-detail/covid-19-joint-who-moh-situation-report-32

name: Kiribati
notes_H1: Article suggests that Kiribati has a suspected case of Covid-19 (a person from Papua New Guinea who recently came to Kiribati on a flight from Fiji on 19th March).    The article also refers to the provision of information about Covid-19 on multiple media channels (radio, TV and internet) by the Ministry of Health and Medical Services (MHMS), hence the change of code for H1 from "0" to "2".  It is entirely possible that a coordinated campaign has been in existence prior to this, although no policy announcement about such a campaign has been found.    "People were also kept reminded by the MHMS over radio Kiribati, the media and tv of steps to combat with the deadly convid-19 on all levels.    On the island people had their hand-held mobile smart telephone on site with them for any current viral news for the corona virus updates. They can access the latest news with their mobile any moment."    http://archive.today/2021.01.24-161213/https://kiribatiupdates.com.ki/kiribati-is-now-on-level-2-in-the-convid-19-scale-in-tarawa/
notes_H2: Article from Kiribati updates.    Notes that a suspected Covid case (a captain of a ship) had been tested for Covid-19 and the results had come back negative.  This suggests a policy of testing is in existence and is likely to have been in place prior to 28th March, although no policy on testing has been found, so code prior to this has been left as "0".  The tests were carried out in Australia.  It is assumed that reliance on other countries for testing will mean that testing is limited to symptomatic / suspected cases and is not available more widely.      Link:  http://archive.today/2021.01.26-174948/https://kiribatiupdates.com.ki/convid-19-results-proof-negative-in-tarawa/    Subsequent Facebook posts by the Australian High Commission for Kiribati notes the delivery of testing supplies and equipment (GeneXpert) on 1st May, 21st May, 25th August and 9th November 2020 which suggests that testing capacity within Kiribati progressively increases over the coming months.  A further post by the High Commission on 12th November comments on support provided for Kiribati to develop a PCR lab at Tungaru Central Hospital which will reduce its need for sending samples overseas for testing.  Taken as a whole, these comments suggest that whilst testing capacity increases, it has remained limited and is therefore unlikely to meet coding criteria for "2" or "3" throughout 2020.    Additional context: borders remained closed from March 2020 and Kiribati has continued to report no confirmed cases of Covid-19 throughout 2020.
notes_C1: From UN Sustainable Development Group (UNSDG).  Article not dated, link below.    "COVID-19 pandemic  A National State of Public Health Emergency was first declared by the Kiribati government on 25 March 2020; and a partial lockdown was effective between 30 March to 20 April 2020, [...] schools [...] closed. Schools reopened on 20 April 2020 "    http://archive.today/2021.02.15-164719/https://unsdg.un.org/un-in-action/kiribati
notes_C6: The previous code of "2" was given in light of both the policy relating the persons under 18 years of age and the associated police Facebook post referring to enforcement of stay at home requirements.  As the policy was set to end on 16th April and as no further policy announcements have been found, it is assumed that the stay at home requirement for persons under 18 years of age ceased after 16th April.  Hence the code of "0".
notes_C8: IMF: "borders have been closed on March 21, except for delivery of essential goods (quarantine requirements apply at all ports). "  https://web.archive.org/web/20200501002338/https://www.imf.org/en/Topics/imf-and-covid19/Policy-Responses-to-COVID-19#K

name: South Korea
notes_H1: http://ncov.mohw.go.kr/en/
notes_H2: KCDC- The newly developed diagnostic will be available at the 50 designated health facilities from 7 February. The improved real-time PCR can detect the novel Coronavirus within six hours.   https://web.archive.org/web/20200406091812/https://www.cdc.go.kr/board/board.es?mid=a30402000000&bid=0030  BBC- South Korea managed to get testing centres up and running 17 days after the 1st case (20th of January)  https://web.archive.org/web/20200406084319/https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-asia-51836898
notes_C7: The two weeks from September 28 to October 11, when the Chuseok holiday begins, are planned to be set as a special quarantine period for the whole country and strengthen quarantine management in consideration of the high risk aspect. In religious facilities, all religious activities, including worship, mass, and court, should be conducted non-face-to-face, and that all face-to-face meetings, events, and group meals should be refrained.   http://web.archive.org/web/20201003225816/http://ncov.mohw.go.kr/tcmBoardView.do?brdId=&brdGubun=&dataGubun=&ncvContSeq=360146&contSeq=360146&board_id=&gubun=ALL   http://ncov.mohw.go.kr/tcmBoardView.do?brdId=&brdGubun=&dataGubun=&ncvContSeq=359862&contSeq=359862&board_id=&gubun=ALL (link can’t be archived)
notes_C1: ***Recoded from 2G to 1G. Under current restrictions, schools are open with restrictions. With the previous localized closure expired at the end of February, there is no evidence of any closures of any levels.     No change at social distancing level: Level 2 for Greater Seoul, Level 1.5 for non-Greater Seoul  https://archive.is/EnyfJ    In-person class attendance capped at one-third at level 2, two-third at level 1.5     Korean social distancing level: http://web.archive.org/web/20210211130346/http://www.koreaherald.com/view.php?ud=20201106000174
notes_H6: Facemasks are compulsory in public places and on public transport. Failure to wear a mask can result in a fine of up to 100,000 Korean Won (£66).    South Korea is currently at level 1 on its five-level national social distancing scale. Under this level facemasks are compulsory in most public places and on transport, and local authorities are able to impose their own restrictions in some circumstances.    https://web.archive.org/web/20201109100146/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/south-korea/coronavirus
notes_E2: On March 17, 2020, the National Assembly Strategy and Finance Committee made an announcement on the “Amendment to the Restriction of Special Taxation Act” to minimize and to overcome the economic impact due to COVID-19.  https://web.archive.org/web/20200618215120/https://www.rsm.global/korea/tax-benefits-due-covid-19-korea  South Korean authorities in March 2020 approved tax relief in an effort to address the impact of the coronavirus (COVID-19) pandemic.  https://web.archive.org/web/20200618215233/https://home.kpmg/us/en/home/insights/2020/04/tnf-korea-tax-relief-includes-reduced-rates-temporary-increased-deductions.html
notes_E1: Quotation: "President Moon Jae-in announced Monday during a meeting with a special task force that the government will pay about $820 to all households except for those in the top 30% income bracket, bringing the total amount to $7.4 billion."  Link: https://www.voanews.com/science-health/coronavirus-outbreak/s-korea-offer-emergency-payments-help-ease-impact-covid-19
notes_C3: New Year events and holiday parties organized by in facilities such as hotels, ballrooms, and guesthouses are prohibited.    https://archive.vn/TmagY    In Busan, singing practice halls, indoor concert halls, and direct sales promotion halls are banned after 9pm starting today, December 1st.    https://archive.vn/d29d7
notes_C6: The two weeks from September 28 to October 11, when the Chuseok holiday begins, are planned to be set as a special quarantine period for the whole country and strengthen quarantine management in consideration of the high risk aspect. In religious facilities, all religious activities, including worship, mass, and court, should be conducted non-face-to-face, and that all face-to-face meetings, events, and group meals should be refrained.   http://web.archive.org/web/20201003225816/http://ncov.mohw.go.kr/tcmBoardView.do?brdId=&brdGubun=&dataGubun=&ncvContSeq=360146&contSeq=360146&board_id=&gubun=ALL   http://ncov.mohw.go.kr/tcmBoardView.do?brdId=&brdGubun=&dataGubun=&ncvContSeq=359862&contSeq=359862&board_id=&gubun=ALL (link can’t be archived)
notes_C8: South Korea said on December 23, 2020, it will suspend flights leaving for and arriving from United Kingdom until the end of the year (December 31) over concerns about a new strain of the novel coronavirus. The country will also place all international arrivals from United Kingdom in a 14-day quarantine and conduct an additional virus test at the time of the quarantine being lifted, according to health authorities. The measure takes effect immediately, according to health authorities.    https://web.archive.org/web/20201226075508/https://en.yna.co.kr/view/AEN20201223004400320
notes_H8: Nursing hospitals and nursing facilities will continue to take measures to prevent high-intensity infections, but will conduct non-contact visits from July 1. The Mayor or Province Governor will decide whether or not to allow visitations according to COVID-19 outbreak by region, and the institution operator (quarantine manager) should establish a visit plan to minimize the risk of infection of patients and residents if necessary.  Visitation guidelines are as follows: (1) Visiting is operated by reservation system in advance, and a separate meeting space is provided, and are notified of the visitation rules in advance with quarantine supplies and access list. (2) Visits must be conducted in a separate space or outdoors where a transparent barrier is installed, and direct physical contact or food intake other than indirect contact through vinyl, etc. is restricted.    https://archive.vn/DomUW#selection-2359.0-2367.248
notes_C4: Previous directive of Stage 2.5 in metropolitan areas and Stage 2 in non-metropolitcan areas will be extended for two further weeks until January 17. In addition, measures to ban private gatherings from 5 people will be expanded nationwide and implemented for the two weeks.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210102055818/http://ncov.mohw.go.kr/tcmBoardView.do?brdId=&brdGubun=&dataGubun=&ncvContSeq=362858&contSeq=362858&board_id=&gubun=ALL
notes_H7: ***Recoded from 2G to 3G     As of Tuesday, seems three groups are being actively vaccinated - 1) key workers, 2) clinically vulnerable, and 3) elderly. See below:     "South Korea’s government on Tuesday began inoculating nearly 300,000 people at care hospitals and nursing homes who are 65 or older and medical workers there as it steps up its vaccination drive.    About 680,000 high-risk healthcare professionals and critically ill people have been vaccinated since the campaign kicked off at the end of February, according to the Korea Disease Control and Prevention Agency (KDCA)."     http://web.archive.org/web/20210328141508if_/https://www.reuters.com/article/us-health-coronavirus-southkorea-idUSKBN2BF02D
notes_H3: Extensive public information campaign, most notably location tracing apps. The Corona 100m (Co100) app launched on February 11 and, using government data, alerts users when they come within 100 metres of a location visited by an infected person. Coronamap website shows the travel histories of confirmed COVID-19 patients and Coronaita aims to function “like a search engine” for information on coronavirus-hit areas.   https://web.archive.org/web/20200330202823/https://www.smartcitiesworld.net/news/news/south-korea-to-step-up-online-coronavirus-tracking-5109   https://web.archive.org/web/20200330202916/http://www.korea.net/NewsFocus/Society/view?articleId=183129

name: Kuwait
notes_H1: From 18 Feb, the government has ramped up its public information activities in a coordinated manner.  On 18 Feb, the Ministry of Health allocated a hotline for citizens to answer any queries. A protocol of cooperation between Kuwait National Guard and Ministry of Health media office was activated on the same day to enhance awareness of the National Guard.  https://web.archive.org/web/20200504120433/http://www.arabtimesonline.com/news/hotline-allocated-to-answer-inquiries-on-coronavirus/  On 12 March, the government launched a website with all the latest updates and information.  https://web.archive.org/web/20200504120229/https://www.kuna.net.kw/ArticleDetails.aspx?id=2877656&Language=en  The Kuwait Ministry of Health has also been also providing regular updates in Arabic and English on its Twitter feed.
notes_H2: 'The Ministry of Health is randomly testing citizens and residents daily as part of its measures to curb COVID-19. Detailed instructions will be sent to those selected for a COVID swab via text message.'    https://web.archive.org/web/20201013195918/https://kw.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_C7: U.S Embassy in Kuwait reports that no restrictions currently exist in relation to inter-city and inter-state travel.    https://web.archive.org/web/20201017080651/https://kw.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_C1: On Feb 26, the Ministry of Education announced universities and schools would be suspended for a period of 2 weeks starting 01 March. /web/20200409075927/https://twitter.com/MOEKUWAIT/status/1232659575565885447  Kuwait has further extended the closure of schools and universities, with the latest update on 20 March when the government announced suspension until August 4.  Education Minister Saud Al-Harbi said the decision applies to public and private schools, and that teachers will be paid with full salaries in the duration of the suspension.  The minister said the next school year will begin in December 2020."    https://web.archive.org/web/20200426194131/https://www.arabnews.com/node/1644186/middle-east
notes_H6: 18th May 2020, Kuwait imposes mandatory wearing of masks in public, the country’s health ministry has revealed those who fail to adhere to the strict guidelines could be looking at up to three months in prison or be hit with fines of up to $16,200 (5,000 dinars).    https://web.archive.org/web/20200915055927/https://www.arabianbusiness.com/culture-society/446880-kuwait-imposes-mandatory-wearing-of-masks-in-public

notes_E1: "3. Establishing a mechanism to secure the minimum income that ensures facing the cost of living for workers affected by the current crisis and linked to contracts    4. Support the salaries of those under Chapter 5 in social Security in the affected sectors.    5. Assist owners of small, medium, industrial and agricultural projects by postponing the installments funded by the National Fund for Small and Medium Enterprises Development and the agricultural finance portfolio in the Industrial Park    6. Providing loans on concessional and long term to small and medium enterprises, through joint financing from local banks and the National Fund for Small and Medium Enterprise (SME) Development"  https://web.archive.org/web/20200501022530/https://www.kuna.net.kw/ArticleDetails.aspx?id=2882522&Language=en
notes_C3: https://gulfbusiness.com/kuwait-begins-phased-plan-to-reopen-economy-over-a-million-expats-remain-in-lockdown/ mosques reopen but Friday prayers are not allowed. Public events remained cancelled
notes_C6: Beginning March 7 at 5:00 PM, a 12-hour curfew is in effect from 5:00 PM to 5:00 AM daily until April 8.  Is a curfew in place? Yes, a 12-hour curfew.  Beginning March 7 at 5:00 PM, a 12-hour curfew is in effect from 5:00 PM to 5:00 AM daily until April 8.  Those seeking emergency medical treatment during curfew should call 112.  Curfew passes for medical appointments during curfew hours can be requested at https://curfew.paci.gov.kw/request/create.  Grocery shopping appointments (5:00 PM to 10:00 PM) can be requested at www.moci.shop. Confirmation of the appointment must be presented to authorities upon entering and leaving the market.  Passengers departing Kuwait who need to reach the airport during curfew hours should be prepared to travel directly from their homes to the airport, carrying their passport and flight confirmation to show at potential checkpoints.  Pharmacies, cooperative societies, and grocery stores offer delivery services during curfew hours.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210314213621/https://kw.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_C8: Authorities in Kuwait have amended COVID-19 entry restrictions effective Feb. 21. Passengers arriving from 35 previously banned countries will be able to enter the country. The countries include India, Iran, China, and Brazil, among others.  People entering from these locations will be subject to a 14-day quarantine at a hotel at their own expense. Travelers from these countries will have to undergo two polymerase chain reaction (PCR) tests, one upon arrival and another at the end of their quarantine.  https://web.archive.org/web/20210219122511/https://www.garda.com/crisis24/news-alerts/445301/kuwait-authorities-amend-covid-19-entry-restrictions-effective-feb-21-update-31
notes_H8: Updating indicator to be inline with C6 (stay at home requirements).    https://web.archive.org/web/20210325144456/https://kw.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_C2: "Government offices and private businesses, banking, financial, and construction sectors, retail stores, shopping malls, public parks, restaurant takeout and dine-in services, hotels, and tailors are open with physical distancing measures. Beginning February 7 for a one-month period, all commercial businesses, including restaurants, are closed from 8 PM to 5 AM daily, with the exception of pharmacies, co-ops, and grocery stores. Takeout orders and delivery is not restricted.  Beginning February 7 for a one-month period, health clubs, salons, barber shops, and spas are closed."
notes_C4: Kuwait reopens mosques after months of coronavirus closure.  http://archive.fo/muGeK
notes_H7: Everyone can sign up for the vaccine for free, but the elderly, healthcare workers and clinically vulnerable people are given priority.   https://web.archive.org/web/20210105002053if_/https://gulfnews.com/world/gulf/kuwait/kuwait-all-citizens-to-get-covid-19-vaccine-for-free-1.75488993  https://web.archive.org/web/20210105002646/https://gulfnews.com/world/gulf/kuwait/covid-19-more-than-1000-people-vaccinated-on-1st-day-in-kuwait-1.76123900
notes_H3: /web/20200409143715/https://twitter.com/KUWAIT_MOH/status/1236360623921008647  Screening to all people in contact with travelers.
notes_C5: July 28 2020 onward, Kuwait Authorities announce third phase of COVID-19 reopening of economy.  Reopening Taxi Services (Permitted to One Passenger Only).    https://web.archive.org/web/20200810225430/https://corona.e.gov.kw/Re-Open-PhaseIII-En.pdf

name: Laos
notes_H1: The Prime Minister Exective order mentions about public awareness  through departments and official media. The Exective order implementation is from 30th March.  http://web.archive.org/web/20200618220009/https://www.norway.no/en/vietnam/norway-vietnam/news-and-events/order-of-laos-prime-minister//
notes_H2: The WHO report shows that the testing capacity is enhanced. Tests are being conducted everyday and there are no reports of laboratory or case reporting backlogs.   https://web.archive.org/save/https://www.who.int/laos/internal-publications-detail/covid-19-situation-report-for-lao-pdr-12-21---27-august-2020
notes_C7: "The government has lifted travel restrictions to enable people to travel freely around the country as Laos eases more Covid-19 prevention measures to minimise the impact on livelihoods and the economy." https://web.archive.org/web/20200526102008/http://www.vientianetimes.org.la/freeContent/FreeConten_Travel_93.php
notes_C1: schools/universities are open    http://web.archive.org/web/20201129203136/https://la.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_H6: Facial masks are mandatory required when stepping out of house  Social distancing of one to two meters must be observed    Reference:  https://web.archive.org/web/20201024141830/http:/www.xinhuanet.com/english/2020-09/30/c_139409766.htm
notes_E2: Recent mitigation policies include income tax exemption for both civil servants and employees of private sector with income less than 5 million kip per month for three months; profit tax exemption for microenterprises with annual income between 50-400 million kip for three months; duty fee exemption for imports of goods to be used towards the outbreak; deferring tax collection from tourism related businesses for three months; postponing mandatory contribution to social security by affected businesses for three months and extending the submission of the 2019 financial report (annual tax filing) by two months and road tax payment by three months.    Measures include, establishing a separate task force to address the economic impact of COVID-19. A new electricity tariff, to ensure supply of electricity, in effect from May 1, 2020 through December 31, 2025, is in place.     https://archive.vn/SIeH1
notes_E1: The government has agreed to compensate 60 percent of workers’ salary, who currently participates in the Social Security Scheme, and has had their work suspended during May and June 2020.  https://archive.vn/SIeH1
notes_C3: Public transportation has resumed operation. Restaurants, grocery stores, and schools/universities are open, and large gatherings and religious ceremonies are permitted. Entertainment venues such as karaoke lounges are opened.    http://web.archive.org/web/20201129203136/https://la.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_C6: Everyone is now allowed out, but face-masks must be worn and everyone must "maintain a physical distance of at least one meter from each other". https://web.archive.org/web/20200526095640/https://www.thestar.com.my/news/regional/2020/05/05/laos-reopening-businesses-after-no-virus-cases-for-23-consecutive-days
notes_C8: All entrants will be subject to COVID-19 testing and a 14-day self-quarantine requirement at a designated facility or hotel at their own expense.   http://web.archive.org/save/https://la.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_H8: According the country’s National Deployment and Vaccination Plan (NVDP), this initial batch of AstraZeneca/Oxford vaccines will be used by the Government of Lao PDR to first immunise priority groups in the country who are at greater risk of exposure to COVID-19 and those who are most likely to develop severe symptoms from infection.  This includes frontline healthcare workers, older adults above the age of 60 and people with underlying health conditions. Some essential workers will also be prioritised based on the nature of the job and high-risk of exposure to COVID-19 such as workers at points of entry and in quarantine centres.  http://web.archive.org/web/20210405183726/https://la.usembassy.gov/covid-19-vaccines-shipped-by-covax-facility-arrive-in-lao-pdr/
notes_C2: Public transportation has resumed operation. Restaurants, grocery stores, and schools/universities are open, and large gatherings and religious ceremonies are permitted. Entertainment venues such as karaoke lounges are opened.    http://web.archive.org/save/https://la.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_C4: https://web.archive.org/web/20200714024005/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/laos/coronavirus  FCO travel advice  Social gatherings, weddings and traditional events are now permitted as long as COVID-19 prevention measures and social distancing of 1m are in place.
notes_H7: The government has begun vaccinating the most vulnerable and at-risk groups in a step towards ending the acute phase of the Covid-19 pandemic.  The national rollout of COVAX-supported vaccines began at Mittaphab Hospital in Vientiane on Friday (April 2).  The vaccines were received on March 20 and were provided by the COVAX Facility, a partnership between the Coalition for Epidemic Preparedness Innovations, Gavi, the Vaccine Alliance, UNICEF, and the World Health Organisation (WHO).  The shipment consisted of 132,000 doses of the Oxford/AstraZeneca vaccine manufactured by the Serum Institute of India.  This shipment is the first of Laos’ initial allocation of 480,000 doses. COVAX aspires to provide enough vaccine to supply at least 20 percent of the population this year, according to a press release from UNICEF.   the priority groups comprise healthcare workers, adults above the age of 60, and people with underlying health conditions.  http://web.archive.org/web/20210412183244/https://www.thestar.com.my/aseanplus/aseanplus-news/2021/04/05/laos-mass-rollout-of-covid-19-vaccine-gets-underway
notes_H3: Appears to be comprehensive: https://web.archive.org/web/20200619232042/https://laotiantimes.com/2020/04/12/laos-confirms-19th-case-of-covid-19-infection/ http://web.archive.org/web/20200619232100/https://www.who.int/news-room/feature-stories/detail/support-for-lao-pdr-s-response-to-covid-19
notes_C5: Under the latest announcement, all forms of interprovincial public transport by land, water and air may resume operation, as well as trading and services businesses.    LinKhttps://web.archive.org/web/20200606105442/https://sigma.com.mt/latest-news/casinos-remain-closed-as-laos-eases-lockdown-measures/

name: Lebanon
notes_H1: I could not find a specific date for an official public campaign beginning, but given that on Mar 6 the Health Minister stated "Lebanon is no longer in Coronavirus containment stage", and that on the same day the first domestic restrictions got into place, this seems like the proper time point.  https://web.archive.org/web/20200504213031/https://www.lbcgroup.tv/news/d/news-bulletin-reports/505703/health-minister-hassan-lebanon-is-no-longer-in-cor/en
notes_H2: Lebanon has a mixed approach to testing with symptomatic and eligible ppl able to access testing + population level random testing of ppl without symptoms or eligibility to attempt to estimate the population level of infection.     /web/20200608224645/https://www.executive-magazine.com/economics-policy/healthcare/coronavirus/testing-for-covid-19-in-lebanon On April 20, the Ministry of Public Health began population screening or what they called “random testing” (though it is not so random, see below) in different areas of Lebanon. "
notes_C7: From 21st August 2020, Lebanon has reinstated a nationwide curfew from 1800-0600 daily, during which internal movement will also be restricted (with the exception of travelling to and from the airport).   https://web.archive.org/web/20200826165912/https://lb.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_C1: A nationwide lockdown will come into effect in Lebanon from 5am on Saturday 14 November 2020, until 5am on 30 November to prevent the spread of COVID-19. Public institutions and schools will close.    https://web.archive.org/web/20201114120947/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/lebanon/coronavirus    https://web.archive.org/web/20201114121008/https://lb.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_H6: Fabric masks covering the mouth and nose must be worn when outside the home and in vehicles (unless travelling alone, or exercising).    Masks are required outdoors in all public spaces.    https://web.archive.org/web/20201114121008/https://lb.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/    https://web.archive.org/web/20201114120947/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/lebanon/coronavirus
notes_E2: Extension of deadlines for paying taxes and utility bills, banks are allowed to extend 5yr no interest loans./web/20200611013320/https://www.hrw.org/news/2020/04/08/lebanon-direct-covid-19-assistance-hardest-hit
notes_C3: From 21st August, all public events are banned.  2020https://web.archive.org/web/20200826165912/https://lb.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_C6: Previous curfew ended at 5am, a new curfew began as part of the four-phase easing of restrictions programme.    The first phase: starts from five o'clock in the morning of Monday, 02/08/2021, until five o'clock in the morning of Monday, 02/22/2021.    Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20210208174424/http://drm.pcm.gov.lb/Media/News/Daily-situation-report-06-Feb,-2021_English-Versio.pdf
notes_C8: Lebanon has declared a total curfew which it will lift gradually to allow more businesses to operate. Movement is generally prohibited. You must not leave your accommodation. All hospitality businesses and public institutions will close and banks are operating a greatly reduced service. There are some exemptions for essential work and you can apply by mobile phone or internet to leave your accommodation to undertake certain activities such as medical appointments, chemists and food shopping. Food delivery services are operating, including in the evenings.      The Lebanese government have introduced an online system where you can request an exemption from the curfew for essential purposes e.g. going to a chemist, medical appointment or to buy food. You can do this online via this link.    Beirut International airport will remain open, but land and sea borders will close, apart from for those transiting Beirut airport who hold tickets for flights on that day. All passengers are required to have their tickets with them when transferring to and from the airport. Some exemptions to COVID-19 restrictions are applied to aid workers. For further clarification, aid workers should contact the United Nations for advice.    When travelling to and from the airport, private cars should have no more than four people in them (including the driver). Wearing masks for all passengers is obligatory. Given the total curfew, you are advised to book taxis to and from the airport ahead of time.    Fabric masks covering the mouth and nose must be worn when outside the home and in vehicles (unless travelling alone).    Lebanese authorities may issue fines, impose road blocks, or imprison those violating these measures for up to three years. You should comply with all measures introduced by the Lebanese authorities and obey the instructions of the security forces. These measures may be changed at short notice.    Keep up to date with information from your tour operator, transport or accommodation provider on the impact on any existing travel plans.    https://archive.vn/wip/W7EtA  https://archive.vn/RnP8Q  https://archive.vn/Xk48E
notes_H8: no changes in policy    Based on C6: the strict stay at home requirements also include the elderly.     https://web.archive.org/web/20210208151252/http://drm.pcm.gov.lb/Media/News/Daily-situation-report-25-Jan,-2021_English-Versio.pdf
notes_C2: From 21st August 2020, malls, gyms and restaurants will be closed, although restaurants will be permitted to make deliveries 0600-1800. Grocery stores will be allowed to operate from 0600-1700.  https://web.archive.org/web/20200826165912/https://lb.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_H7: Phase Target population Population  size[1]  Share of  population*  First 35%[2] High risk health workers 55,000 0.8%  Aged 65 and older 600,143 9.2%  Those below age 65 (55 – 64 years) but with comorbidities 237,183 3.6%  All those between ages 55-64 not covered earlier,  16-54 years with co-morbidities[3]  ,  health workers not covered earlier  237,183  1,150,671  5,000  3.6%  17.7%  0.1%  Persons and staff in elderly shelters, prisons, and  individuals essential for preserving the essential function  of the society (the national COVID-19 vaccination  committee will define strict criteria to identify recipients  of the latter group).  25,000 3.4%  Next 35%  Other vulnerable populations, schoolteachers and school  staff**, childcare workers, other critical workers in high  risk settings, remaining health care workers, family  caregivers of those age =65 or with special needs, and all  those above the age of 16 willing to be vaccinated  2,449,820 35%    https://archive.vn/6PeGm
