notes_C8: "Is a negative COVID-19 test (PCR and/or serology) required for entry? [Yes]  Pakistan’s Ministry of National Health Services, Regulation, and Coordination issued updated guidelines for arriving passengers on January 5. The Pakistani Civil Aviation Authority’s (PCAA) latest implementation guidelines began November 20.  On January 5 the PCAA released new guidelines for travelers arriving from the UK and South Africa.  Keep current on your airline’s requirements for initiating a journey to Pakistan.  All passengers are required to install and register on the Pass Track app prior to issuance of boarding pass to Pakistan at point of original embarkation (available for Android and Apple devices).  Passengers who do not have android/Apple phones and are unable to download the Pass Track app will need to enter their data on an accessible web-based form and provide a paper printout of the same prior to issuance of boarding pass to Pakistan at point of original embarkation.  All passengers will also have to fill out a health declaration form (HDF) before landing (see Questionnaire for Travelers).  Countries are categorized into Category A, B, or C primarily based on epidemiological risk assessment, reviewed every two weeks by the Ministry of National Health Services, Regulations, and Coordination.  Travelers arriving from Category A countries:  No COVID-19 RT-PCR (real-time, reverse transcription polymerase chain reaction) test required before or after travel.  Travelers arriving from Category B countries (on January 20, 2021 the United States falls under this category):  Show proof of a negative RT-PCR test result taken within 96 hours of commencement of original travel.  Travelers arriving from Category C countries:  Show proof of a negative RT-PCR test result taken within 96 hours of commencement of original travel. All arriving from a Category C country will also take a mandatory RT-PCR test upon arrival in Pakistan.  Are health screening procedures in place at airports and other ports of entry? [Yes]  Upon arrival, all travelers will line up six feet (two meters) apart and undergo thermo-screening by thermo-guns and/or thermo-scanners.  Detailed information for arriving passengers is available in the Guidelines for International Passengers Arriving at Airports in Pakistan.  For the most up-to-date information regarding visa extensions for residents and/or tourists, please visit here."    "Are U.S. citizens required to quarantine? [No]  Symptomatic travelers will be required to take a COVID-19 RT-PCR test and its results submitted to the designated Pakistani authorities within 48 hours of arrival.  In cases found positive for COVID-19 based on a test upon arrival, travelers may be required to comply with isolation procedures.  Asymptomatic travelers should be provided with written instructions and guidelines for home quarantine for 14 days."    - https://web.archive.org/web/20210126081727/https://pk.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_C2: On Nov 24, 2020, Geo News TV provided a useful summary of COVID19 restrictions that show a patchwork of Workplace/educational/gathering restrictions across the country; source: https://web.archive.org/web/20201129201909/https://www.geo.tv/latest/320263-what-are-the-covid-19-restrictions-in-pakistan    These restrictions across different parts of the country suggest governments at the local and state levels imposing targeted restrictions as and when appropriate for workplace restrictions. The strictest of them seem to start on Nov 20 2020, in Pakistan Administered Kashmir where a 15-day lockdown is in place (starting from Nov 20) -- this lockdown has prompted the 3T designation for C2.    In the order of strictness and how early such restrictions seem have come into effect:  1. "A 15-day lockdown has been imposed by the AJK (Azaad Kashmir, aka Pakistan Administered Kashmir) government since November 20. All businesses and offices are closed while the government offices will operate at 50% capacity. Only essential services are allowed with strict implementation of coronavirus SOPs."  2. "Sindh: Markets and business centres are to close by 6pm on weekdays. They can open by 6am, but have to stay closed on weekends, the Sindh home department notified on Monday. All cinemas, shrines, and gyms will be closed. Government and private offices can call in only 50% of staff to work, while the remaining employees are to work from home."  3. "Punjab: Smart lockdowns imposed in 6 cities: Bahawalpur, Bhakkar, Multan, Rawalpindi, Sargodha, and Lahore. All shopping malls, restaurants, offices (private and public) will remain closed in the areas under lockdown. Public and private offices throughout the (Punjab) province are to ensure that 50% of the staff works from home. This will be applicable till January 31, 2021."  4. "The Khyber Pakhtunkhwa government has issued no new coronavirus restrictions this week. Its home department issued SOPs to be followed last week which are still in place. All shopping malls, restaurants, shops, and marriage halls have been directed to shut by 10pm. Pharmacies, medical stores and tandoor shops (and Petrol Pumps and LPG shops) will remain open 24/7."    The details of the work place restrictions, esp. in Punjab and Sindh were also reported by Deccan Herald on Nov 24: https://web.archive.org/web/20201129202234if_/https://www.deccanherald.com/international/world-news-politics/pakistan-provincial-authorities-introduce-new-covid-19-restrictions-national-tally-reaches-379883-919348.html    In General though, on Nov 25 2020 the Pakistan Government (specifically the Prime Minister) has ruled out any broad nation-wide restrictions to contain COVID19: https://web.archive.org/web/20201129210523/https://in.news.yahoo.com/pak-pm-rules-closing-down-175707452.html
notes_C4: Targeted lockdowns across the country are preventing public events or gatherings.  The local government in Pakistan Administered Kashmir, aka Azaad Kashmir, imposed a strict 15-day lockdown starting on Nov 20 2020. As per the Geo New article: "Public gatherings, including weddings, have been banned."  Similarly, in "Khyber Pakhtunkhwa: All major public gathering have been banned. Legal action will be taken in case of violations."   Such reporting suggests that public events in targeted/specific regions within the country have be halted/banned. source: https://web.archive.org/web/20201129201909/https://www.geo.tv/latest/320263-what-are-the-covid-19-restrictions-in-pakistan    In general, the Pakistan Government issued guidance on public gatherings such as weddings for crowd sizes as small as 25 people. Broadly such guidance suggests that "No indoor gatherings are permitted, and only outdoor wedding events are allowed, in which number of the guests must not exceed 300 individuals with mandatory arrangements for seating  of each individual at-least 6 feet apart. event timing should be restricted to 2 hours with closure evening timing at 10 PM" Source: https://covid.gov.pk/new_guidelines/28November2020_20201127_Additional_Guidelines_for_Marriage_Events_Ceremonies_during_COVID_19_4505.pdf    Additionally, the guidelines provide clear space restrictions for specific crowd sizes. E.g. for a gathering of upto 25 people, there should be at least 900 sq feet of space; for crowds of upto 100 people a minimum of 3600 sq ft. is required.    While the guidance document is date Nov 27th 2020, it also states that "These guidelines will be implemented from 20th November 2020 onwards in urban centers (Karachi, Lahore, Islamabad, Rawalpindi, Multan, Hyderabad, Gilgit,  Muzaffarabad, Mirpur, Peshawar, Quetta, Gujranwala, Gujrat, Faisalabad, Bahawalpur & Swat)".
notes_H7: C (Above 60)
notes_C5: "Public transportation is operating. According to the Government of Pakistan, individuals using public transportation – trains or buses – should wear facemasks and keep a distance of at least six feet from other individuals."    (Despite the mini-lockdowns announced in some cities no restrictions related with public transportation were found).    Source: http://web.archive.org/web/20201026191411/https://pk.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/

name: Panama
notes_H1: Informational webpage launched by the Ministry of Health: https://web.archive.org/web/20200504201936/https://yomeinformopma.org/    "The Ministry of Health presented the web portal https://yomeinformopma.org/ as an official information center, available to all citizens. On this website, you will be able to get the official communications, decrees and relevant data on COVID-19 in Panama and the start of the mandatory national quarantine." https://web.archive.org/web/20200504202120/https://stri.si.edu/minsa-press-release-27
notes_H2: Rapid Response Teams (ERR)  carry out sweep strategies to capture more asymptomatic patients     https://web.archive.org/web/20210222095020/http://www.minsa.gob.pa/noticia/barridos-estrategia-para-captar-mas-pacientes-asintomaticos-dr-cedeno
notes_C7: No intercity or interstate travel     https://web.archive.org/web/20210409203019/https://pa.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_C1: "Panama’s government ordered the temporary closure of all schools due to the fast-spreading coronavirus." All public and private schools are closed. https://web.archive.org/web/20200313001338/https://www.reuters.com/article/us-health-coronavirus-panama-idUSKBN20Y3FA  "The Panama closures apply to both public and private schools and will extend through at least April 7 in most of the country, Education Minister Maruja Gorday said in a statement."
notes_H6: “On June 2, the Government of Panama’s Ministry of Health (MINSA) published a resolution stating that anyone leaving their residence must be wearing a mask that covers their nose and mouth. Any individual not wearing a mask is subject to possible detention and fine.” Source: http://web.archive.org/web/20200903161415/https://pa.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/#Movement%20Restrictions
notes_E2: Taxes, some services and credit payments will be suspended for 4 months  https://www.imf.org/en/Topics/imf-and-covid19/Policy-Responses-to-COVID-
notes_E1: “On July 14, the Cabinet approved … (ii) an augmentation in social spending, including payments to affected workers and small business owners through the "Panama Solidarity Plan”. Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20200823141641/https://www.imf.org/en/Topics/imf-and-covid19/Policy-Responses-to-COVID-19 The Panama Solidarity Plan includes transfers to formal and informal sector workers. The President of the Republic, Laurentino Cortizo Cohen, announced on Twitter, on the August 4: ““This week 360,978 Panamanians will receive their transfer of the digital voucher #PanamáSolidario. The first transfer is made today and the following on August 5, 6 and 7. #UnPanamáMejor” This includes “recharges to those who have previously received their digital voucher: districts of Arraiján, San Miguelito and Colón, Panamanians with suspended contracts, wallets, artists, trainers of the @InadehOficial, peddlers registered in @panamamunicipality.” Source: http://web.archive.org/web/20200823152111/https://twitter.com/NitoCortizo/status/1290615980280946690?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw%7Ctwcamp%5Etweetembed%7Ctwterm%5E1290615980280946690%7Ctwgr%5E&ref_url=https%3A%2F%2Fpanamapress.com.pa%2Frevisa-si-te-llego-inicia-el-pago-de-panama-solidario-anuncia-el-presidente-cortizo%2F “The Digital Voucher is for an amount of B / .100, which the beneficiaries can cash with their personal identity card in supermarkets or pharmacies to buy food and medicine” Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20200823151541/https://panamapress.com.pa/revisa-si-te-llego-inicia-el-pago-de-panama-solidario-anuncia-el-presidente-cortizo/
notes_C3: "Activities, acts and events such as: fairs, congresses, cultural, religious, sporting events are suspended, holidays, dances and / or concerts throughout the national territory.  Only those sports events that may be held behind closed doors with a maximum attendance of 50 people with the express authorization of the Ministry of Health will be excepted."  https://web.archive.org/web/20200316101104/http://www.minsa.gob.pa/noticia/comunicado-ndeg-7
notes_C6: Targeted movement and stay home restrictions across Panama   https://web.archive.org/web/20210215162210/https://pa.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_C8: " As of March 13, all cruise ship passengers are banned from disembarking in Panama"  https://web.archive.org/web/20210315180928/https://pa.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_H8: No specific protection, but protection remains in place from national restrictions and curfews   https://web.archive.org/web/20210131143500/https://pa.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_C2: February 1st saw the beginning of the gradual reopening - beauty parlours, barber shops and daycare centres were authorised to reopen.     Feb 8th: restaurants reopen to serve food with restricted times and public health precautions   Feb 15th: carwashes, tailor shops, non-essential theatres     Other foreseen sates for reopening of gyms, spas, movie theatres etc.     https://web.archive.org/web/20210215162210/https://pa.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_C4: all gatherings larger than 50 people banned     https://web.archive.org/web/20210118203235/https://pa.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_H7: Panama began vaccinating its citizens on January 20th, the day the first batch of Pfizer vaccine arrived, prioritising health workers. President Laurentino Cortizo assured that each of Panama's 4.2 million citizens will have access to two doses.     Current phase 1 of vaccine rollout underway:     A; C   Pfizer     https://web.archive.org/web/20210222100946/https://peoplesdispatch.org/2021/02/16/what-is-happening-in-latin-america-with-vaccine-roll-out/    https://web.archive.org/web/20210222101059/http://www.minsa.gob.pa/noticia/metropolitana-de-salud-continua-con-el-proceso-de-vacunacion-en-la-fase-1
notes_H3: The Ministry of Health reported, on August 29th, that “during this weekend, the regional directorates of the Ministry of Health (MINSA) throughout the country intensified the actions they carry out as part of the traceability work to detect new cases of COVID-19 and their contacts.” Source: http://web.archive.org/web/20200903174431/https://www.yomeinformopma.org/info_detail/189 On September 2nd, The Health Minister, Luis Francisco Sucre, “explained that it [traceability] is an investigation process of where a case starts and where it ends, to cut the chain of transmission of the virus. Once a positive case is found, everyone who was directly in contact with him or her is followed up. In addition to which were the places visited during the last three days and if among these people, we found a second positive case, we repeat the same procedure.” Source: http://web.archive.org/web/20200903165735/http://www.minsa.gob.pa/noticia/comunicado-ndeg-190
notes_C5: Public transportation operation     As of Feb 8th, large group bus trips are not allowed   https://web.archive.org/web/20210215162210/https://pa.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/

name: Peru
notes_H1: The Ministry of Health starts a National Campaign using social media, TV spots, podcasts, radio, and others.    Campaign website: https://web.archive.org/web/20200131160919/https://www.gob.pe/institucion/minsa/campa%C3%B1as/699-protegete-del-coronavirus    Later, when the first case starts, the Government creates a page of daily-updated information on Coronavirus cases in the country  Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20200315070841/https://www.gob.pe/coronavirus    Also, during the whole state of Emergency (from March 15), the President addresses the Nation daily at noon to give updates and announce new measures.  Videos from President's messages: https://www.facebook.com/pg/presidenciaperu/videos/ (unable to archive this link)
notes_H2: Selected points accessible free of charge to anyone with suspect of COVID, where testing will be provided only after medical assessment.  https://web.archive.org/web/20210112033220/https://www.gob.pe/institucion/minsa/informes-publicaciones/835888-puntos-covid
notes_C7: In 10 "extreme" risk regions all road and most air interprovincial transport is suspended.  https://web.archive.org/web/20210131194624/https://www.gob.pe/en/institucion/mtc/noticias/326588-mtc-se-suspende-el-transporte-interprovincial-aereo-y-terrestre-en-diez-regiones
notes_C1: Schools remain suspended, there is a limited resumption of in-person teaching at primary and secondary located in rural areas with limited communication and internet connectivity     https://web.archive.org/web/20210104174051/https://pe.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_H6: Everyone must wear face masks outside of homes, and must additionally wear facial protectors on public transport
notes_E2: No update:  /web/20201130215012/https://www.nht.gov.jm/nht-cuts-interest-rates-announces-measures-assist-mortgagors
notes_E1: 16-March. The government disposes the transfer of around USD110 per family. This is not universalmeant for food expenses of vulnerable families for two weeks. As the State of Emergency has been extended this transfer has been disposed more times (same amount for every two weeks).    The transfer was then extended to some Independent Workers (many of them informal), which do not currently hold contracts.     On April 23, the President announced the same transfer but this time with "inverse targeting", meaning it would give the same amount for "everyone but the people in no need, who are currently receiving a salary". This is meant to reach 75% of the total population.
notes_C3: All public events suspended   https://web.archive.org/web/20210104174051/https://pe.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_C6: Until 14 February, there are red areas (Extreme risk: Ancash, Pasco, Huánuco, Junín, Huancavelica, Ica, Apurímac, Lima y Callao) where there is a 24/24 hours total confinement with exceptions only for health and working reasons.  Curfews in place in other regions, with more flexible restrictions.  https://web.archive.org/web/20210131191757/https://www.gob.pe/8665-sintomas-del-coronavirus-conocer-si-puedo-haber-contraido-el-covid-19
notes_C8: Published legal restrictions from March 14th 2021, state a modification to international travel: 14 day quarantine is now mandatory for Peruvians and foreign residents after coordination with health authority, suspension of entry of non-resident foreigners was suspended until January 31st 2021.     https://web.archive.org/web/20210314120816/https://busquedas.elperuano.pe/normaslegales/decreto-supremo-que-establece-precisiones-y-modifica-el-decr-decreto-supremo-n-004-2021-pcm-1919992-1/
notes_H8: Until 14 February, there are red areas (Extreme risk: Ancash, Pasco, Huánuco, Junín, Huancavelica, Ica, Apurímac, Lima y Callao) where there is a 24/24 hours total confinement with exceptions only for health and working reasons.  Curfews in place in other regions, with more flexible restrictions.  https://web.archive.org/web/20210131191757/https://www.gob.pe/8665-sintomas-del-coronavirus-conocer-si-puedo-haber-contraido-el-covid-19
notes_C2: President of Peru announced heighted restrictions, beginning January 31 - Shopping centre, cinemas, casinos, gyms and clubs are closed to the public. Grocery store, bank and pharmacy open but operating at 40% capacity.   http://web.archive.org/web/20210205200847/https://pe.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_C4: All social gatherings, including those held in homes with family are prohibited in all of Peru     https://web.archive.org/web/20210104174051/https://pe.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_H7: A, B, C.   MINSA plans to immunize 22.2 million people, depending on the availability of vaccines and prioritizing the population at risk.  Phase 1  At this stage, it seeks to protect the integrity of the Health System and the continuity of basic services.  Phase 2  At this stage, the aim is to reduce the number of people at risk who can become ill and die.  https://web.archive.org/web/20210405165946/https://www.gob.pe/11796
notes_H3: June 9 - The minister revealed the measures that he considers key to the success in managing the outbreak, although victory cannot be claimed yet: "Strict tracking and early confinement". Despite the fact that Costa Rica was the first Central American country in which a positive case of Covid-19 was registered, "we made decisions at the right time, such as the fact of having suspended mass concentrations and the entry of tourists when we had only 41 cases"    Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20200701204629/https://www.abc.es/sociedad/abci-rastreo-contactos-y-confinamiento-temprano-claves-milagro-costarricense-gestion-coronavirus-202006091319_noticia.html?ref=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.google.com%2F
notes_C5: In the extreme tier, "Interprovincial land and air passengers transport is stopped". In the very high tier, "Interprovincial land passengers transport available with 50% capacity".    https://web.archive.org/web/20210216010029/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/peru/coronavirus

name: Philippines
notes_H1: https://web.archive.org/web/20200504205049/https://drive.google.com/file/d/1_MYCAYdPcKr-JbVxyCBXwBNoRveB6g2B/view
notes_H2: Good testing capacity, many asymptomatics are being tested, but through contact tracing, not because it is really generally available.  http://web.archive.org/web/20200501000000*/https://theaseanpost.com/article/how-philippines-fighting-covid-19  https://web.archive.org/web/20200803221412/https://catholicphilly.com/2020/07/news/world-news/manila-bishop-tests-positive-for-covid-19-says-hes-asymptomatic/
notes_C7: There is a curfew in place. "The timing for each curfew is set by the Local Governmental Unit (LGU) and varies by region.  ...  Checkpoints are in place and domestic air travel remains limited. LGUs my request information about your purpose of travel. In general, leisure travel is not permitted at this time."    https://web.archive.org/web/20210119020640/https://ph.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_C1: Manila City (six barangays) and Quezon City (specific areas) have been placed under lockdown. Minors are not allowed to go outside their residences, only individuals aged 18-65 years old are allowed to go outside their residences amid the alarming rising number of COVID-19 cases in Metro Manila starting March 17, 2021    https://web.archive.org/web/20210318000507/https://ph.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_H6: All persons are mandated to wear full-coverage face shields together with face masks, earloop masks, indigenous, reusable, or do-it-yourself masks, or other facial protective equipment which can effectively lessen the transmission of COVID-19, whenever they go out of their residences, pursuant to existing guidelines issued by the national government subject to fair and humane penalties or punishments that may be imposed by LGUs or implemented by law enforcement agencies, respectively.       https://web.archive.org/web/20210301032920/https://ph.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information    https://web.archive.org/web/20210301051743/https://app.adpc.net/sites/default/files/public/publications/attachments/IATF-EID%20210211%20%E2%80%93%20Omnibus%20Guidelines%20on%20the%20Implementation%20of%20Community%20Quarantine%20in%20the%20Philippines%20with%20Amendments%20as%20of%20February%2011%2C%202021.pdf
notes_E2: No current debt or contract relief for households.    The 60-day grace period on loan and credit card payments expired in December 2020.   The grace period on residential rent has expired.       https://web.archive.org/web/20201221224337/https://www.covid19.gov.ph/economic/rent    https://web.archive.org/web/20210303065851/https://www.covid19.gov.ph/static/resources/rent.pdf    https://web.archive.org/web/20210303064609/https://www.officialgazette.gov.ph/downloads/2020/09sep/20200911-RA-11494-RRD.pdf
notes_E1: No announcement that the amelioration assistance from the national government during the one-week Enhanced Community Quarantine period has been extended.
notes_C3: “The NTF and the Department of the Interior and Local Government shall ensure that areas flagged for local action shall implement strict lockdown of areas in line with the Zoning Containment Strategy, strict enforcement of minimum health standards, and intensified tracing and quarantine of close contacts and isolation of confirmed cases,” the resolution read.    http://web.archive.org/web/20200906185101if_/https://www.onenews.ph/list-areas-under-gcq-starting-aug-16
notes_C6: Effective March 15-28, 2021, the National Capital Region (NCR) will be under curfew from 10:00 p.m. to 5:00 a.m. Only individuals aged 18-65 years old are allowed to go outside their residences amid the alarming rising number of COVID-19 cases in Metro Manila starting March 17, 2021    https://web.archive.org/web/20210318000507/https://ph.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_C8: The Philippine government has suspended the entry of all foreign nationals effective March 22, 2021, through April 21, 2021.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210323011436/https://ph.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_H8: In all areas, those who are 65 years old and above, those with immunodeficiency, comorbidity, or other health risks, including any person who resides with the aforementioned, shall be required to remain in their residences at all times, except when indispensable under the circumstances for obtaining essential goods and services or for work in permitted industries and offices.       https://web.archive.org/web/20210301051743/https://app.adpc.net/sites/default/files/public/publications/attachments/IATF-EID%20210211%20%E2%80%93%20Omnibus%20Guidelines%20on%20the%20Implementation%20of%20Community%20Quarantine%20in%20the%20Philippines%20with%20Amendments%20as%20of%20February%2011%2C%202021.pdf
notes_C2: Effective 29 March 2021 to 4 April 2021, the Philippine government has placed the provinces of Metro Manila, Bulacan, Cavite, Laguna, Rizal and the National Capital Region under Enhanced Community Quarantine (ECQ) as the strictest of lockdown measures. Effective April 1 until April 30, 2021, Santiago City is placed under Modified Enhanced Community Quarantine (MECQ). Effective April 1 until April 15, 2021, Quirino Province is placed under MECQ. Effective until April 30, 2021 Luzon, the entire Cordillera Administrative Region (CAR); Cagayan, Isabela, and Nueva Vizcaya are placed under General Community Quarantine (MGCQ). All other areas are placed under Modified General Community Quarantine (MGCQ) until end of April 2021.   Exemptions of the ECQ include: Public and private hospitals; health emergency and frontline services; manufacturers of medical supplies; agricultural industries; logistics service providers; construction projects; hygiene products manufacturing; essential retail trade; food preparation establishments; public and private financial service providers.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210329202012/https://pcoo.gov.ph/wp-content/uploads/2021/03/20210328-OMNIBUS-Guidelines-RRD.pdf
notes_C4: Manila City (six barangays) and Quezon City (specific areas) are under lockdown.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210318000507/https://ph.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_H7: A, B, C (Sinovax & AstraZeneca): In press briefing with the Presidential Spokesperson of Philippine, "as of April 3, 2021, 795,320 people have been vaccinated with the first dose of COVID-19 vaccines at 2,669 vaccination sites in the country. Of this number, 765,871 are frontline health care workers. Vaccination has also begun for senior citizens and individuals with comorbidities. A total of 16,121 grandparents were vaccinated in NCR and Region IV-A, while 13,328 were vaccinated against individuals with comorbidity."    The Philippines aims to secure 148 million doses of COVID-19 vaccines from several companies to inoculate an initial 50 to 70 million Filipinos this year. The bulk of vaccine doses are expected to arrive by the second and third quarters of the year.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210406004822/https://pcoo.gov.ph/press-briefing/press-briefing-with-presidential-spokesperson-harry-roque-12/  https://web.archive.org/web/20210406004846/https://www.pna.gov.ph/articles/1135813
notes_H3: Announced April 4, during the period of Enhanced Community Quarantine on provinces Bulacan, Cavite, Laguna, Rizal, and highly urbanized cities of the National Capital Region and Pateros municipality, improved contact tracing efforts will be implemented until April 11, 2021. Efforts include increasing capacity through utilization of personnel from the Department of National Defense/Interior and Local Government/Labor and Employment to supplement contact tracing efforts.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210405230551/https://pcoo.gov.ph/wp-content/uploads/2021/04/20210404-Resolution-108A-RRD.pdf
notes_C5: In areas under General Community Quarantine and Modified General Community Quarantine, the road, rail, maritime, and aviation sectors of public transportation are allowed to operate at such capacity and following the protocols as provided for by the DOTr.     https://web.archive.org/web/20210301051743/https://app.adpc.net/sites/default/files/public/publications/attachments/IATF-EID%20210211%20%E2%80%93%20Omnibus%20Guidelines%20on%20the%20Implementation%20of%20Community%20Quarantine%20in%20the%20Philippines%20with%20Amendments%20as%20of%20February%2011%2C%202021.pdf      General Community Quarantine (GCQ) through March 31, 2021:  Luzon?– National Capital Region, Batangas, Baguio City, Apayao, Kalinga, and Mountain Province in the Cordillera Administrative Region.   Visayas?–Tacloban City; and Mindanao – Davao City, Iligan City, and Lanao Del Sur.  All other areas are under?Modified General Community Quarantine (MGCQ).    https://web.archive.org/web/20210309014800/https://ph.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/

name: Papua New Guinea
notes_H1: This document uploaded on 12th April on website of Ministry of health mentions about comprehensive public awareness campaigns  https://web.archive.org/save/https://www.health.gov.pg/subindex.php?news=1
notes_H2: "COVID-19 Testing    Are PCR and/or antigen tests available for U.S. citizens in Papua New Guinea? Yes  If so, are test results reliably available within 72 hours? Yes  Symptomatic persons are generally able to obtain government-paid or government-subsidized testing services at Port Moresby General Hospital and the Taurama Aquatic Center drive-through testing site operated by St. John Ambulance service. Testing services outside of Port Moresby may be obtained by visiting a provincial hospital or by calling 1800 200 and asking for more information.  Non-symptomatic persons and persons who need testing services in connection with travel may obtain such services through approved swabbing centers and private medical facilities, including:  St John Ambulance  2K Medical Clinic  Pacific International Hospital  Aspen Medical  Sky Medical Services  Testing conducted through private medical facilities may cost as much as 250 USD.  Though electronic test results from such facilities are generally available within 24-48 hours, U.S. citizens who need tests in connection with travel are advised to request clear estimates of the turn-around and delivery methods for test results."    https://web.archive.org/web/20210119024845/https://pg.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_C7: According to the US Embassy in PNG,    "Movement Restrictions:        Is a curfew in place? An official national curfew not currently in place, but business operations are limited to prescribed hours. Note that curfews and other measures may be imposed by provincial government authorities.      Are there restrictions on intercity or interstate travel? Yes, interprovincial domestic air travel is restricted to persons working for approved organizations or persons who have approval from the Office of the Controller or the provincial administrator of the province from which the travel originates. Travelers should consult with their respective airline(s) prior to travel.      The Controller has also delegated authority to provincial governments to establish their own requirements for travel. All domestic air travelers are strongly encouraged to confirm requirements with their respective air service provider(s) prior to travel."    See the US Embassy in PNG's website, archived at https://archive.vn/qBT0v
notes_C1: Per the Ministerial Statement 2/2021 released by the Ministry of Education,    schools (universities not including) are suspended from 22 March to 19 April 2021.    See Ministry of Education's announcement, archived on Dropbox at https://www.dropbox.com/s/xrs00ro8cksb8q1/PNG-20210318-MOE-MinisterialPolicyStatement2.pdf
notes_H6: Per Measure No 10 of the National Pandemic Act,    "I, Commissioner David Manning, Controller, by virtue of the powers conferred by Section 9 of the National Pandemic Act 2020 and all other enabling powers, hereby issue the following  measures:  1. All persons should where possible where masks to protect Papua New Guinea from COVID-19.  2. No person shall be permitted entry into, or otherwise remain within, any market designated in Schedule 1 unless the person is wearing a Mask or Face Covering, in a manner which covers their mouth, nose and chin.  3. No person shall be permitted entry to, or otherwise remain within, any enclosed space within an Establishment unless the person is wearing a Mask or Face Covering, in a manner which covers their mouth, nose and chin.  4. No person shall be permitted entry into or otherwise remain on, public transport unless the person is wearing a Mask or Face Covering, in a manner which covers their mouth, nose and chin.  5. No person shall be permitted entry into an aircraft anywhere in PNG unless the person is wearing a Mask or Face Covering in a manner which covers their mouth, nose and chin.  6. No person shall remove their Mask or Face Covering whilst on an aircraft in PNG in a manner which covers their mouth, nose and chin, except in the case of an emergency.  7. The pilots of the plane are exempt from paragraphs 5 and 6.  8. All persons working in a market, in-door establishment or on public transport in which they interact in person with customers, clients or work in an enclosed space with other colleagues must wear masks at all times.  9. Businesses and government departments and agencies must ensure all employees have Masks or Face Coverings"    See the NCC's Measures, archived on Dropbox, at https://www.dropbox.com/s/xpqofo1aa2qcpj9/PNG-20210412-NCCMeasures.pdf
notes_E2: Commercial banks agreed to provide loan repayment holidays to affected households and businesses for three months (a package estimated at PGK 600 million). See World Bank PNG Economic Update, archived https://www.worldbank.org/en/country/png/publication/papua-new-guinea-in-the-time-of-covid-19---from-relief-to-recovery
notes_E1: Couldn't find any indication of monetary support. Extending a credit line or allowing employees to dip into their provident funds cannot be counted here.  http://web.archive.org/web/20201221143702/https://www.imf.org/en/Topics/imf-and-covid19/Policy-Responses-to-COVID-19
notes_C3: Per Measure 9,    "An immediate ban is placed on gatherings of over 10 people."    See the NCC's Measures, archived on Dropbox, at https://www.dropbox.com/s/xpqofo1aa2qcpj9/PNG-20210412-NCCMeasures.pdf
notes_C6: According to the US Embassy in PNG,    "Movement Restrictions:        Is a curfew in place? An official national curfew not currently in place, but business operations are limited to prescribed hours. Note that curfews and other measures may be imposed by provincial government authorities."    See the US Embassy in PNG's website, archived at https://archive.vn/qBT0v
notes_C8: ALL INCOMING PASSENGERS REQUIRED TO UNDERGO 14-DAY QUARANTINE REGARDLESS OF COUNTRY   https://covid19.info.gov.pg/index.php/2021/01/27/all-incoming-passengers-required-to-undergo-14-day-quarantine-regardless-of-country-of-origin-says-manning/
notes_H8: http://web.archive.org/save/https://www.abc.net.au/news/2020-12-07/familes-torn-apart-covid-19-png-saibai-island-border-closure/12951364  http://web.archive.org/save/https://www.rnz.co.nz/international/pacific-news/430526/papua-new-guinea-s-covid-19-cases-now-at-600
notes_C2: NATIONWIDE    See Measure No. 9 of the National Pandemic Act 2020, updated 20th Jan 2021:    "2. Licensed premises that sell takeaway alcohol, shall not sell alcohol on Saturdays or Sundays.    7. Licensed bookmakers may only operate:  a. on Wednesdays, Thursdays, Fridays, and Saturdays; and  b. only at venues located in places listed in Schedule 1"    See document, archived on Dropbox, at https://www.dropbox.com/s/ec8qwl77a71xv89/PNGMeasure09-20210120.pdf

notes_H7: A- Key Worker    Australia sent Papua New Guinea 8,000 doses of AstraZeneca’s COVID-19 vaccine last week after warning of a worsening humanitarian crisis. It has sent almost 8,500 vaccine doses to immunize frontline workers in its former colony and is considering distributing more once it begins to ramp up local production of the AstraZeneca shot.    Nikkei Asia Web Archived: web.archive.org/web/20210405011612/https://asia.nikkei.com/Spotlight/Coronavirus/Australia-vaccine-diplomacy-tested-as-COVID-slams-Papua-New-Guinea
notes_H3: The NCC measures do not list any comprehensive demands for contact tracing. Additionally, according to the situation report dated 12 April released by PNG National Department of Health and World Health Organization,     "Due to logistical difficulties, lengthy test turnaround time, public holidays, clinic shutdowns, and low testing capacity in PNG, there have been delays in swabbing, testing, and reporting of results, thus the number of cases reported in the last week is an underrepresentation of the situation that is occurring."    See the NCC's Measures, archived on Dropbox, at https://www.dropbox.com/s/xpqofo1aa2qcpj9/PNG-20210412-NCCMeasures.pdf  See the Situation Report by PNG National Department of Health and World Health Organization, archived on Dropbox, at https://www.dropbox.com/s/4h54j58m1mzv6vo/PNG-20210412-COVID19HealthSituationReport68.pdf
notes_C5: See Measure No. 11 of the National Pandemic Act 2020, updated 20th Jan 2021:    "2. Taxis may operate so long as the driver and all passengers are wearing a mask or face covering in a manner which covers their mouth, nose and chin.    3. All persons on public transport including the driver and passengers must at all times while on the public transportation wear a mask or face covering in compliance with the requirements in Measure 10." name: Poland
notes_H1: Health authority launches a 24/7 coronavirus hotline and a broader public information campaign: https://gis.gov.pl/aktualnosci/calodobowa-infolinia-nfz-o-koronawirusie/
notes_H2: Testing is widely available for those showing symptoms. Drive-through centers aroudn the country can perform the test for symptomatic individuals, although an appointment arranged by phone is needed.     https://web.archive.org/web/20200610224903/https://ug.edu.pl/news/en/295/first-covid-19-walk-thru-mobile-testing-center-poland-opened-university-gdansk
notes_C7: Restrictions return to previous levels following a ban of movement from December 31, 2020 to January 1, 2021, from 19:00 to 6:00.  https://web.archive.org/web/20210101210448/https://www.gov.pl/web/koronawirus/przedluzamy-etap-odpowiedzialnosci-i-wprowadzamy-dodatkowe-ograniczenia
notes_C1: For safety reasons, all students in Poland - including grades 1-3 - will learn remotely. We also recommend working online throughout the country - wherever possible.  https://web.archive.org/web/20210322231434/https://www.gov.pl/web/koronawirus/od-20-marca-w-calej-polsce-obowiazuja-rozszerzone-zasady-bezpieczenstwa
notes_H6: ***Recoded from 3G to 2G; while masks are required in many public spaces, they are not required at others (see list of exemptions below)     Covering the mouth and nose in public spaces is obligatory throughout the entire country!    It is mandatory to cover your mouth and nose in such places as:    -on streets, roads and in town squares, within cemeteries, promenades, boulevards, vehicle parking areas, forest car parks,  -in buses, trams and trains,  -in shops, malls, banks, markets and post offices  -in cinemas and theatres,  -at physician’s offices, in outpatient clinics and hospitals, in massage and tattoo parlours  -in churches, at schools and universities,  -In government offices (when going there to take care of certain matters) and other civic centres.    Where is it not mandatory to cover your mouth and nose? In forests, parks, green squares, botanical gardens, historic gardens, family community gardens and on beaches as well as while travelling by private car.    Important!  Exemption from the obligation to cover the mouth and nose is limited only to persons who have a medical certificate or a document confirming:    -a pervasive developmental disorder,  -a mental disorder,  -moderate, severe or profound intellectual disability,  -difficulties in uncovering the mouth or nose on their own.    http://web.archive.org/web/20210127093533/https://www.gov.pl/web/coronavirus/temporary-limitations
notes_E2: According to the announcement of the Polish government:  - 90% reduction rents for tenants of premises and the so-called islands in shopping malls, as long as these facilities are prohibited from operating normally;  - exemption from charging contractual penalties for - related to the epidemic - delays in the execution of tenders;  - enabling municipalities to refrain from charging real estate tax on companies that have lost their liquidity due to the coronavirus epidemic.  Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20200507081400/https://www.gov.pl/web/koronawirus/tarcza
notes_E1: Note: New 2020 budget - Wage subsidies for employees of affected businesses and self-employed persons. Businesses, regardless of their size, may apply for a three-month subsidy in the event of work stoppages or reduced working time. This subsidy covers social insurance contributions, and it ranges from 50 to 90 percent of the minimum wage for each employee, depending on recorded decrease in turnover in 2020. The subsidy includes furloughed employees. See: [web archive unavailable, accessed 28th September 2020]
notes_C3: https://web.archive.org/web/20201027185141/https://www.gov.pl/web/koronawirus/aktualne-zasady-i-ograniczenia
notes_C6: The following restrictions will come into effect on Saturday, October 24:     - The entire territory of Poland will become a 'red' zone;     - Restaurant activity will be limited for two weeks to serving only takeaway food;    - Grades four to eight in elementary schools will switch to remote learning;     - Secondary schools and higher learning institutions will switch to remote learning.    - Between the hours of 8:00 a.m. and 4:00 p.m., children under the age of 16 will be allowed to leave their homes only in the company of an adult;    - Spectators will be banned from sporting events;    - There will be a 25-percent cap on audiences at all cultural events;    - Swimming pools, aquaparks and fitness clubs will be closed;    - Sanatoria will be closed;    - The number of people at retail premises of up to 100 square metres will be capped at five per checkout;     - The number of customers in retail premises above 100 square metres will be limited to one person per 15 square metres;    - Public transport will be limited to 50 percent of seating capacity or 30 percent of total capacity;    - Gatherings of more than five people will be banned, except for people living together in one home;    - Persons aged 70 and above are to encouraged to stay at home, apart from performing their professional activities, meeting their essential daily needs and participating in religious ceremonies.  https://web.archive.org/web/20201027185141/https://www.gov.pl/web/koronawirus/aktualne-zasady-i-ograniczenia
notes_C8: Poland has reopened all its EU borders for the first time in nearly three months.  https://web.archive.org/web/20200623114912/https://www.euronews.com/2020/06/13/coronavirus-poland-reopens-all-its-eu-borders-for-first-time-in-nearly-three-months
notes_H8: Senior, stay home! We call for limiting the movement of seniors - especially people over 70 years of age.   https://web.archive.org/web/20201104172405/https://www.gov.pl/web/koronawirus/aktualne-zasady-i-ograniczenia
notes_C2: ***Recoded from 2G to 3G. As of March 27, no evidence of any nonessential business able to remain open. Source confirming restaurants closed: http://web.archive.org/web/20210321085147if_/https://www.reuters.com/article/us-health-coronavirus-poland-restriction-idUSKBN2A13JD    See previous coding note:   Large-format furniture and construction stores with an area of ??more than 2,000 m2 will be closed.  Shopping centers and malls - as at present - remain closed, with the exception of: grocery stores, pharmacies and drugstores, press salons, bookstores.  From March 27, the ban will also cover hairdressing, beauty and cosmetic salons all over Poland.  https://web.archive.org/web/20210330142225/https://www.gov.pl/web/koronawirus/od-27-marca-zmiany-w-zasadach-bezpieczenstwa
notes_C4: https://web.archive.org/web/20201027185141/https://www.gov.pl/web/koronawirus/aktualne-zasady-i-ograniczenia
notes_H7: "According to earlier announcements, only those older than 60 — as well as people at heightened medical risk plus selected professions — are currently eligible. The system was due to be opened to those 50 and older step-by-step over April, followed by a broader availability in May."     As of April 1, 3 groups being vaccinated: elderly, vulnerable, and key workers.     http://web.archive.org/web/20210403195256/https://www.politico.eu/article/vaccine-chaos-erupts-in-poland/
notes_H3: Poland introduces an app to support contact tracing efforts in April 2020. Unable to find sufficient evidence of comprehensive contact tracing to warrant a 2 code.    https://web.archive.org/web/20201126151616/https://eandt.theiet.org/content/articles/2020/06/poland-switches-to-privacy-conscious-contact-tracing-app/

notes_H2: San Juan Airport Now Offering PCR Testing For All Passengers  The Luis Muñoz Marín International Airport in San Juan, Puerto Rico has is now offering PCR molecular COVID-19 tests for all passengers within the airport.     Done in partnership with CMT Group, this will comply with island entry requirements, as well as provide easy access to testing for those leaving the destination. While Puerto Rico is exempt from the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention’s (CDC) negative COVID-19 test requirement for re-entry into the U.S., travelers who still wish to get tested, will have the ability to do so without having to leave the airport.     Beyond facilitating testing, this offering will also allow for early detection of positive cases and serve as a preventative measure, furthering the Island’s commitment to the safety of visitors and residents, said Discover Puerto Rico.  https://web.archive.org/web/20210218230937/https://www.travelagentcentral.com/caribbean/san-juan-airport-now-offering-pcr-testing-for-all-passengers
notes_C7: No evident policy change. Some internal transport services are reserved for locals only. Ferry service to Vieques remains available to residents only.  https://web.archive.org/web/20201116183439/https://www.discoverpuertorico.com/info/travel-guidelines
notes_C1: Puerto Rico reopens public schools amid COVID-19 fears  Public schools across Puerto Rico are reopening for the first time in nearly a year despite the pandemic, with officials reporting scarce attendance amid COVID-19 concerns  https://web.archive.org/web/20210324064817/https://abcnews.go.com/International/wireStory/puerto-rico-reopens-public-schools-amid-covid-19-76362414
notes_H6: Gov. Wanda Vázquez issued a directive on May 26 that requires face-covering “at all times” in public places and has extended it several times since. The current order is in effect through at least Jan. 7, 2021.    https://web.archive.org/web/20201126103809/https://www.garda.com/crisis24/news-alerts/344486/us-puerto-rico-authorities-to-ease-covid-19-measures-from-may-26    https://web.archive.org/web/20210102141611/https://www.aarp.org/health/healthy-living/info-2020/states-mask-mandates-coronavirus.html
notes_E2: Since March 16: “Payment plans moratorium. Taxpayers economically affected by COVID-19 and the closure order will not be required to follow the terms of a payment plan between the period March 16, 2020, and April 30, 2020. The PRTD will not be imposing interest and penalties for non-compliance with the payment plans. If there is a notice for interest and penalties, the taxpayer may submit a request to eliminate such charges.”  http://web.archive.org/web/20200501022500/https://home.kpmg/xx/en/home/insights/2020/04/puerto-rico-tax-developments-in-response-to-covid-19.html  Since March 23: “From Monday, March 23 through June 30, 2020, no income tax shall be withheld on payments for services rendered as required under Section 1062.03 of the PR IRC related to services rendered by residents of Puerto Rico carried out. This exemption will apply regardless of whether the recipient has a total or partial release of this withholding tax. AD 20-10 clarifies that this withholding exemption does not exempt the recipient from any income tax on the amounts received and the withholding agent of the reporting requirements for the amounts paid”. Here's the link:  http://web.archive.org/web/20200501020455/https://www.hlb.global/puerto-rico-tax-and-financial-measures-associated-with-covid-19/  Sine March 23: “No penalties will be imposed for missing or insufficient estimated tax payments, which are required by individuals and corporations for tax year 2020; the penalties will not be imposed if the first and second installment payments are timely made in equal amounts by the due dates of the next two estimated installments, together with the corresponding estimated income tax payments due. Withholding agents are not required to do the 10% income tax withholding at source on payments for services performed, but the service provider may choose to have the withholding continue; the waiver from the withholding is temporary during the period from 23 March 2020 to 30 June 2020.” Here's the link:  http://web.archive.org/web/20200501022937/https://www.ey.com/en_gl/tax-alerts/puerto-rico-s-treasury-department-announces-additional-extensions-for-various-returns-and-payments-and-provides-special-cash-flow-tax-relief-measures-because-of-covid-19  “"The Electric Power Authorities (PREPA) and the Aqueduct and Sewer Authority (AAA) cannot suspend the electricity and water service while the executive orders for the emergency are in force by COVID-19.”  http://web.archive.org/web/20200501023705/https://www.efe.com/efe/usa/puerto-rico/normativa-prohibe-el-corte-de-la-luz-y-agua-durante-emergencia-covid-19/50000110-4218441
notes_E1: "Direct payments (“recovery rebates”) to low- and middle-income families. Because Puerto Rico maintains its own tax system,[10] Puerto Rico’s Treasury Department — rather than the U.S. Treasury — will distribute the payments under a plan that the U.S. Treasury approved on May 1.[11] (Puerto Rico will use the same eligibility criteria as the federal government, providing payments of $1,200 for most adults and $500 for children under age 17, with these payments phasing out at higher income levels"     https://web.archive.org/web/20200803155143/https://www.cbpp.org/research/economy/long-in-recession-puerto-rico-needs-more-than-just-covid-19-relief-to-overcome-its
notes_C3: "Section 13 of the Executive Order provides that proposals for virtual concerts and theater activities may be submitted for the approval and authorization of the Governor’s Chief of Staff.     Mass gatherings where the crowding of persons is encouraged are unauthorized by the Executive Order. "    Starting on July 17th, and within permissible curfew hours, only individual sports and recreational training that do not entail physical contact are allowed. Competitive activities of any kind, professional or non-professional, are not allowed during the effectiveness of the Executive Order.    https://web.archive.org/web/20200725085640/http://www.mcvpr.com/newsroom-publications-Executive-Order-EO-2020-054    https://web.archive.org/web/20200725085640/http://www.mcvpr.com/newsroom-publications-Executive-Order-EO-2020-054
notes_C6: As part of the Executive Order 2020-062 (20 August), citizens are allowed to leave their houses to practice exercise and outdoor activities from Monday to Saturday (in non-curfew hours). On Sundays, people are required to stay at home.    * Official decree (see 2020-062, page 33)  http://web.archive.org/web/20200831194511/https://www.estado.pr.gov/en/executive-orders/    * Other sources  http://web.archive.org/web/20200831201234/https://www.elpais.cr/2020/08/19/decreto-de-gobernadora-de-puerto-rico-cierra-playas-por-covid-13/
notes_C8: Since March 15, President Trump announced the prohibition of tourists from certain countries of Europe. Since March 17, officials at the airports were controlling passegers (measuring temperature): http://web.archive.org/web/20200803143744/https://periodismoinvestigativo.com/2020/04/pasajeros-llegan-a-puerto-rico-desde-las-zonas-de-mayor-contagio-por-coronavirus-en-estados-unidos/ http://web.archive.org/web/20200803143756/https://www.elnuevodia.com/noticias/locales/notas/todo-pasajero-que-ingrese-a-puerto-rico-sera-sometido-a-una-prueba-rapida-de-coronavirus/ The Governor of Puerto Rico requested the Federal Government to suspend domestic and international flights, but the request has not been answered: http://web.archive.org/web/20200803143805/https://www.elnuevodia.com/negocios/economia/notas/aun-no-responde-la-faa-a-solicitud-de-restringir-llegada-de-vuelos/ http://web.archive.org/web/20200803143821/https://www.efe.com/efe/usa/puerto-rico/puerto-rico-pide-autoridad-federal-prohibir-vuelos-de-zonas-alta-prevalencia-covid/50000110-4216708
notes_H8: Since February 8 to March 14, the new order OE-2021-014 declares that visits from Friends and family to care homes are prohibited. (http://web.archive.org/web/20210214032239/http://www.lexjuris.com/Ordenes/OE-2021-014.pdf)
notes_C2: As part of the Executive Order 2020-062 (20 August), the Governor announced a the start of a 24-hour lockdown every Sunday until 11 September. During these days, only pharmacies, grocery stores, gas stations, and hardware stores will be allowed to open.  * Official decree (see 2020-062, page 37) http://web.archive.org/web/20200831194511/https://www.estado.pr.gov/en/executive-orders/  * Other sources http://web.archive.org/web/20200831184222/https://cnnespanol.cnn.com/video/puerto-rico-decreta-cuarentena-total-los-domingos/

The new guidelines will take effect June 16 and run through July 1."
