name: Portugal
notes_H1: https://twitter.com/DGSaude/status/1221389443623505920    From 26th january on the social medias from Portuguese government have been posting about COVID-19, the symptons and cases when people have to inform the government about returning from a trip.
notes_H2: https://www.americanprogress.org/issues/security/news/2020/04/10/482998/migrant-model-follow-portugals-response-coronavirus/  https://www.themayor.eu/en/porto-opens-first-coronavirus-drive-thru-testing-centre-in-portugal
notes_C7: On April 1st, the Prime Minister announced that the ban of travel between municipalities will come to an end after Easter on Monday, April 5th and that in the next two weeks, no restrictions on internal movement, on weekdays or weekends, are expected.    Source: https://archive.vn/nYQRD
notes_C1: "Effective March 15, 2021, the Government of Portugal will implement the following Deconfinement Measures for the entire country (...)    Schools: In-person classes open for pre-school, primary school 1st to 4th grade (1º ciclo), and daycare centers. ATLs and study centers open only for children and students participating in educational activities."    Source: http://web.archive.org/web/20210316142405/https://pt.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_H6: Portugal's parliament on Friday passed a bill which imposed the mandatory use of a mask on the street and public spaces in an effort to contain the spread of the coronavirus.    The order was passed a day after authorities reported 3,270 new coronavirus cases, the highest single-day increase since the beginning of the pandemic. It will be in effect for at least 70 days.    The use of a mask is compulsory for all people "over ten years old to access, circulate or stay in public spaces and roads whenever the physical distance recommended by health authorities are impossible", according to the bill.    The obligation between "people from the same household, when they are not in the proximity of third parties" can be waived or by means of a "medical certificate" that the clinical condition or cognitive impairment does not allow the use of masks.    It is also not mandatory to wear a mask when "it is incompatible with the nature of the activities that people are carrying out."    Those who violate the order face fines of between 100 euros ($118) and 500 euros ($590). Other items such as visors will not be acceptable as substitutes.    The order will be reassessed following the expiry of the mandated period with a renewal a possibility."    These rules will be applied from Wednesday, October 28."    Sources: http://web.archive.org/web/20201028100351/https://newsaf.cgtn.com/news/2020-10-24/Portugal-s-Parliament-approves-mandatory-use-of-masks-in-outdoor-areas-UPMSI69oJy/index.html  http://web.archive.org/web/20201028100922/https://sicnoticias.pt/especiais/coronavirus/2020-10-27-A-partir-de-quarta-feira-vai-ter-de-usar-mascara-na-rua
notes_E2: "in November last year the Government (...) approved the ban on the suspension of essential services such water, electricity or gas during the first half of 2021, for those who are unemployed, have had a reduction in household income equal to or greater than 20%, or have been infected by Covid-19."  Source: http://web.archive.org/web/20210323145814/https://www.dinheirovivo.pt/geral/covid-19-pagamento-faseado-de-energia-limitado-a-faturas-ate-30-de-junho-13409907.html    The Portuguese government has approved a moratorium on bank loan repayments for families and companies affected by the coronavirus outbreak and a recent extension until end-September 2021.   Source: http://web.archive.org/web/20210112062127/https://www.imf.org/en/Topics/imf-and-covid19/Policy-Responses-to-COVID-19     December 18 - The Parliament came to an agreement and decided that landlords will not be able to terminate lease agreements, even if the tenancy period has expired, unless there is an agreement with the tenant or the latter fails to pay any rent. This suspension will remain in place until at least June 30, 2021. This exceptional regime, was implemented early in the pandemic, in March 2020. At first, the suspension was determined until September 30th, after which the deadline was extended until the end of the year.    Source: https://archive.vn/7dJwA
notes_E1: Government implements an extraordinary income support scheme to workers who need to stay home to take care of dependants and to those who had lost their income due to reduction in economic activity. This is caped at 50% of the income or the minimum wage for informal workers (700 euros per month).    Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20200509072543/http://www.seg-social.pt/apoio-extraordinario-a-reducao-da-atividade-economica-de-trabalhador-independente  "É criado um apoio financeiro excepcional aos trabalhadores por conta de outrem que tenham de ficar em casa a acompanhar os filhos até 12 anos, no valor de 66% da remuneração base (33% a cargo do empregador, 33% a cargo da Segurança Social). Para os trabalhadores independentes, é criado um apoio financeiro excepcional aos que tenham de ficar em casa a acompanhar os filhos até 12 anos, no valor de 1/3 da remuneração média, bem como um apoio extraordinário à redução da atividade económica de trabalhador independente e diferimento do pagamento de contribuições"
notes_C3: No guidance found. But it seems that public events are not taking place.
notes_C6: "The diploma that regulates the next deconfinement phase has been published in Diário da República. It starts on Monday (April 5). The measures had already been announced by the Government.    The general duty of home retreat is maintained, as is teleworking whenever possible. However more activities and establishments will be able to start operating. This is the case of terraces, which will be able to reopen, with some restrictions. Restaurants and similar establishments must close at 10:30 pm on weekdays and at 1:00 pm on Saturdays, Sundays and holidays."    Note (subject to interpretation): Downgraded to 1 because even though the general duty of home retreat remains in place it seems more adequate given the relaxation measures that came into force and the current situation of the country - e.g. reopening of restaurants and terraces, reopening of museums and other cultural establishments, stores up to 200m2 (with street entrances), resumption of face-to-face classes for middle school students etc.    Source: http://web.archive.org/web/20210403232403if_/https://www.jornaldenegocios.pt/economia/coronavirus/detalhe/diploma-ja-foi-publicado-dever-geral-de-recolhimento-e-teletrabalho-continuam-mas-a-partir-de-segunda-ha-novas-regras
notes_C8: https://www.publico.pt/2020/03/10/economia/noticia/governo-suspende-voos-territorio-italiano-causa-coronavirus-1907157    Portugal suspends flights to Italy.     Bans flights from and to Spain.
notes_H8: "Mainland Portugal is currently in a ‘state of emergency.’ The Portuguese government has put in place a series of measures to control the spread of the virus, including a national lockdown.    You are instructed to stay at home, except: to buy food and other essential items, to go to work exceptionally, if your professional activity is not compatible with working from home, to go to a hospital, health centre or dental clinic, to go to a veterinary clinic or walk a pet, to carry out caring or similar duties, to take short periods of exercise outdoors (individually, not in groups)."    Source: http://web.archive.org/web/20210226224854/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/portugal/coronavirus    January 14- "Visits to nursing homes and activities at day care centers will be allowed in the new period of state of emergency starting at 12:00 am on January 15th, in an attempt to contain the advancement of the covid-19 pandemic. (...)". Workers, visitors, elderly living in these centers and others might be tested if the institutions find necessary. (on January 18, it was announced that day care centers for the elderly would close - see next source)    Source: https://archive.vn/AKRrq    January 18-"The Council of Ministers approved a decree that proceeds to a set of amendments regarding the measures that regulate the extension of the state of emergency (...) it is necessary to clarify the restrictive measures applied and to adopt additional measures with the aim of reversing the accelerated growth of the pandemic    (...) "closure of senior universities and day centers for the elderly"    (No additional measures for nursing homes were found).    Source: https://archive.vn/DhokN    Note: Subject to interpretation since day centers for the elderly are closed and the general duty to stay at home remains but nursing homes allow patients to receive visits.
notes_C2: ""Effective March 15, 2021, the Government of Portugal will implement the following Deconfinement Measures for the entire country (...)    - Local Trade: Non-food retail and services must close at 9.00 pm on weekdays, and at 1.00 pm on weekends and holidays. Shop door sales, Fairs and Markets open to sell non- food products in accordance with municipality authorization.  - Grocery Stores and Supermarkets must close at 9.00 pm during weekdays, and may remain open on weekends until 7.00 pm.  - Restaurants, Bars and Cafes: Limited to take-away and home delivery only. Restaurants in shopping centers are closed. Take away of drinks permitted.  - Alcoholic Beverages can only be sold until 8.00 pm in all establishments, including supermarkets.  - Hairdressers, Manicurists, and Barbers open by appointment only.  - Bookstores, Libraries, Gardens and Open-air Leisure Spaces open to the public."    Source: http://web.archive.org/web/20210314164727/https://pt.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_C4: On September 15, Portugal has entered into a state of contingency "in what the Prime Minister António Costa calls a “new phase”, and with that comes new measures to avoid the spread of the virus. Among the first measures adopted by the government, announced this Thursday, "are the reduction of the limit of people in gatherings as well as the number of people seated per table in restaurants.    After a Council of Ministers meeting, António Costa announced to the country what will change in the coming days. The main measures announced are:    Gatherings limited to ten people;  Commercial establishments are not allowed to open before 10 am, with exceptions;  Establishments must close between 8 pm and 11 pm, and the time must be set by the mayors of the respective municipalities;  In the catering areas of shopping centres no more than four people can sit at a table.  Ban on the sale of alcoholic beverages at petrol stations and, from 8 pm onwards, in all establishments (except meals)."    Source: http://web.archive.org/web/20201018213856/https://econews.pt/2020/09/10/portugals-state-of-contigency-is-coming-prime-minister-reveals-new-measures/  http://web.archive.org/web/20201018213429/https://www.sns.gov.pt/noticias/2020/09/10/covid-19-situacao-de-contingencia/
notes_H7: Phase 1 From December 2020: Health professionals involved in patient care, Professionals in the armed forces, security forces and critical services, Professionals and residents in Residential Structures for the Elderly (ERPI) and similar institutions, Professionals and users of the National Integrated, Continuing Care Network (RNCCI).    From February 2021 : People aged =50 years, with at least one of the following pathologies: Cardiac insufficiency Coronary heart disease, Renal insufficiency (Glomerular Filtration Rate <60ml / min)  (COPD) or chronic respiratory disease under ventilatory support and / or long-term oxygen therapy.  People aged 80 and over.    The Prime Minister said "this week we started the second part of the first phase, now addressing everyone over 50 years old who have a set of associated diseases and to the entire population over 80 years old, and also to all those who provide essential services to the country, namely those who work in the security forces and services "    Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20210206180604/https://covid19estamoson.gov.pt/vacinacao-covid19/  https://web.archive.org/web/20210206180731/https://www.portugal.gov.pt/pt/gc22/comunicacao/noticia?i=comeca-vacinacao-das-forcas-de-seguranca-armadas-e-de-trabalhadores-de-servicos-essenciais
notes_H3: The Prime Minister announced that "At the moment, fortunately, there are no overdue epidemiological inquiries, and all the delays that existed have been recovered. We can even reduce the number of people involved in tracking activities, namely from the Armed Forces military".      Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20210309231920/https://www.rtp.pt/madeira/politica/nao-ha-inqueritos-epidemiologicos-atrasados_55370
notes_C5: Limits in the number of passengers in public transport to 1/3 of capacity  Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20200509093853/https://www.portugal.gov.pt/download-ficheiros/ficheiro.aspx?v=3f8e87a6-3cf1-4d0c-b5ee-72225a73cd4f     "O estabelecimento da redução do número máximo de passageiros por transporte para um terço do número máximo de lugares disponíveis, por forma a garantir a distância adequada entre os utentes dos transportes"

name: Paraguay
notes_H1: Since March 23 the Ministry of Health published campaign materials about COVID::  https://www.mitic.gov.py/noticias/coronavirus-covid19-materiales-de-comunicacion-para-empresas-y-organizaciones   See videos published by the Ministry of Health  here:  https://www.facebook.com/ministeriodesaludparaguay/videos/
notes_H2: Testing of those who are symptomatic (defined as possessing present three or more symptoms related to the disease: fever, cough, nasal congestion, sore throat, shortness of breath, headache, nausea or vomiting, loss of smell and taste, extreme fatigue or tiredness, or diarrhoea).	  Also welcome to be tested are close contacts of a positive case, regardless of whether they have symptoms.    Source: https://archive.vn/B3rJQ
notes_C7: From 5 October, the government’s announcement ending the ‘social’ and ‘smart’ quarantine phases comes into force. The government has introduced new flexible quarantine measures on a nationwide level.  Inter-departmental circulation is allowed without restrictions.  https://web.archive.org/web/20201019214004/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/paraguay/staying-during-coronavirus
notes_C1: The Government has decided to impose new restrictive measures. It seeks to mitigate the impact of the disease across several departments of the country and the spreading of the Brazilian variant p1 of SARS-CoV-2, with 2 positive results already confirmed. In this regard, "classes in educational institutions will be virtual."    http://web.archive.org/web/20210326142654/https://www.mspbs.gov.py/portal/22867/medidas-restrictivas-para-semana-santa.html  http://web.archive.org/web/20210326154128/https://www.mspbs.gov.py/dependencias/portal/adjunto/03ae8f-DECRETO5053e34be3jq.PDF
notes_H6: Beginning 27 Nov 2020, masks are required indoors or outdoors, in public or in private, when 1.5 metre distance cannot be maintained.     https://web.archive.org/web/20201129225824/https://www.mspbs.gov.py/portal/22236/en-vigencia-ley-de-uso-obligatorio-de-mascarilla.html
notes_E2: No evidence of a policy change.
notes_E1: Ñangareko is a program of monetary transfers of G. 500.000 for the purchase of food and hygiene products. The target population were people with needs (workers or not) and those who did not benefit from other social programs such as Tekopora and pensions for the elderly. The population that started receiving the transfers since March 31. Until April 26, 328.045 individuals were notified of their inclusion in the programme. The monetary assistance was been transferred to 224.001 families.  With the programme the government is replacing less than 50% of lost salary of workers. Here’s the links of the news reports that explain the programme:   http://web.archive.org/web/20200504191513/https://www.lanacion.com.py/pais/2020/03/30/manana-inicia-transferencia-del-programa-nangareko/  http://web.archive.org/web/20200504183917/https://www.abc.com.py/edicion-impresa/suplementos/economico/2020/04/26/asistencia-social-y-la-experiencia-en-el-uso-de-medios-de-pago-electronicos-en-programas-nangareko-y-pytyvo/
notes_C3: From March 27th until April 4th, public events are permitted with up to 100 people provided that a distance of 2 metres is maintained by guests.  source: https://archive.vn/p3s7k
notes_C6: In nationwide Phase 2: "The existing isolation order for all persons in Paraguay to remain in their homes except for necessary travel to obtain food, medicine or cleaning supplies is otherwise still in effect."    https://web.archive.org/web/20200626105822/https://py.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information-2/
notes_C8: Those entering Paraguay must present a negative COVID-19 PCR test completed within 3 days of entering the country (antibody tests not accepted). The mandatory quarantine for travelers ended on November 16.   source:  https://web.archive.org/web/20201221212445/https://py.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information-2/
notes_H8: No evidence of a policy change. The Ministry of Health recommends specific measures for individuals over 60 years old and those with co-morbidities. There is also a daily curfew in place. As such, this was coded as a 2.  source:  https://archive.vn/sJvcB
notes_C2: From March 27th until April 4th:  "Public sector operations must follow a staggered schedule with up to 50 percent staff capacity.    Restaurants and other food establishments may operate during non-curfew hours. However, they may only seat diners who have reservations, and all diners are required to show the establishment their identification cards and give their personal information so that they can be logged for contact-tracing purposes.    Home delivery and call center services, as well as pharmacies, may operate 24 hours.    All businesses and individuals are required to adhere to strict social distancing protocols and enhanced sanitization measures.    source: https://archive.vn/p3s7k
notes_C4: From March 27th until April 4th:  "Social events in public and private spaces are permitted with up to 100 people, provided attendees practice social distancing of at least 2 meters (6 feet). Social events in private homes are limited to 12 people.  Up to four people may engage in outdoor physical activities together. Sports may also be played in groups of up to four people, although persons younger than 18 or older than 60 are prohibited from sports activities."  source: https://archive.vn/p3s7k
notes_H7: A, B, C. Individuals over age 80 are eligible to be vaccinated as of April 10th. Individuals over age 60 with mobility disabilities and those who are bedridden are also eligible for vaccines. Vaccines are also available for key workers. The AstraZeneca and Covaxin vaccines are available to elderly persons.   sources:  https://archive.vn/7GYhM  https://archive.vn/czMNN
notes_H3: As informed previously, the government has kept doing limited contact tracing.
notes_C5: The Government has decided to impose new restrictive measures over the whole territory. It seeks to mitigate the impact of the disease across several departments of the country and the spreading of the Brazilian variant p1 of SARS-CoV-2, with 2 positive results already confirmed. In this regard, there is no short, medium or long-distance public transport. Only metropolitan area transport is working, limited to seated passengers.    http://web.archive.org/web/20210326142654/https://www.mspbs.gov.py/portal/22867/medidas-restrictivas-para-semana-santa.html  http://web.archive.org/web/20210326154128/https://www.mspbs.gov.py/dependencias/portal/adjunto/03ae8f-DECRETO5053e34be3jq.PDF

name: Palestine
notes_H1: Through government announcements.  https://archive.vn/60TFV
notes_H2: Gaza Strip: Since 1  December,  although testing  for  people displaying COVID-19  type  symptoms continues, those who  have been in contact with confirmed positive cases are only tested if they are above 50 yearsof age, and for younger people,only if they have known underlying health conditions    Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20210118165002/https://reliefweb.int/sites/reliefweb.int/files/resources/sitrep_25-17-30_dec_2020.pdf
notes_C7: On March 13, 2021 the Palestinian government announced that movement and movement between all governorates of the homeland is prohibited, as of Monday, with the exception of medical staff.  https://archive.vn/PFJrq  https://archive.vn/HgUpG
notes_C1: On March 13, 2021 the Palestinian Authority extend the closing of all schools and universities  except of high school students (Tawjihi).    https://archive.vn/PFJrq  https://archive.vn/HgUpG  https://archive.vn/Cylao
notes_H6: Facemasks and social distancing are mandatory in public; violators may be fined. Please see: https://web.archive.org/web/20210405162051/https://www.garda.com/crisis24/news-alerts/438971/palestinian-territories-authorities-lift-covid-19-related-nightly-and-weekend-curfews-in-the-gaza-strip-beginning-feb-4-update-43
notes_E2: https://reliefweb.int/sites/reliefweb.int/files/resources/sitrep_21_covid_19.pdf
notes_C3: On March 13, 2021 the Palestinian government updated some measurements regarding to events.  It is prohibited in any case to hold weddings or revive parties of all kinds and types, or to hold funeral homes, festivals, gatherings or events for any reason and in any form throughout the nation . There was also a comprehensive closure of all governorates, as of Monday morning March 15-2021, for a period of five days.  https://archive.vn/PFJrq  https://archive.vn/HgUpG
notes_C6: On March 21, 2020 the Palestinian government announced that the movement and movement of citizens and transportation of all kinds are prohibited in cities, towns, villages and camps every day from seven in the evening until six in the morning. Curfew start form 19:00 pm to 06:00 am.     https://archive.vn/60TFV  https://archive.vn/PkPSt
notes_C8: Entering via Israel: Israel is in full lockdown from 8 January 2021. During this time international travel is prohibited with some exceptions.  The Israeli authorities have announced that with effect from 23 December, foreign nationals will not be permitted to enter unless they are citizens of Israel, with some limited exemptions. If you’re eligible for entry, you will need to complete an entry form. All travellers will be required to quarantine for 14 days. This may be shortened to 10 days upon the completion of two negative coronavirus tests (one upon arrival and one after 9 days). The minimum time required between the two tests is at least 24 hours.  Restrictions also apply at land crossings between Israel and Jordan, and between the Occupied Palestinian Territories and Jordan    Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20210118163854/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/the-occupied-palestinian-territories/entry-requirements    Source: UK foreign office
notes_H8: A full lockdown will be imposed in Palestine every Friday and Saturday and that lockdown will also be imposed every day of the week between 7 in the evening and 6 the next morning for the next two weeks, starting January 3rd.  Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20210118162351/https://english.wafa.ps/Pages/Details/122703
notes_C2: Palestinian authorities released  some new restrictions on March 20, 2021. Shops will open with the tightening of preventive measures, restaurants operate at a rate of emergency at a rate of 30% and according to divergence procedures, while cafes operate according to delivery services only, and penalties will be tightened in the event that the prevention measures and safety measures stipulated in accordance with the protocols of the Ministry of Health are violated. The closure continues on Friday and Saturday of every week, with the exception of pharmacies and bakeries .  This decision takes effect from Sunday, March 21-2021 , and ends by the end of Saturday, corresponding to 3-4-2021.    https://archive.vn/60TFV  https://archive.vn/PkPSt  https://archive.vn/w1T04
notes_C4: On March 13, 2021 the Palestinian government updated some measurements regarding to events.  It is prohibited in any case to hold weddings or revive parties of all kinds and types, or to hold funeral homes, festivals, gatherings or events for any reason and in any form throughout the nation . There was also a comprehensive closure of all governorates, as of Monday morning March 15-2021, for a period of five days.  https://archive.vn/PFJrq  https://archive.vn/HgUpG
notes_H7: The Palestinian government will follow the plan of WHO for targeted people to priorities them for the vaccine (key workers, clinically vulnerable group, elderly).   The vaccine is Pfizer and Astrasnica.    https://archive.vn/PBw9l  https://archive.vn/rtP5L
notes_H3: There is not much data gathered on follow-up. Please see: https://web.archive.org/web/20210405164351/https://english.wafa.ps/Pages/Details/123897
notes_C5: On March 21,2021 the Palestinian government announced that movement and movement of citizens and transportation of all kinds are prohibited in cities, towns, villages and camps every day from seven in the evening until six in the morning. The closure continues on Friday and Saturday of every week, with the exception of pharmacies and bakeries.    https://archive.vn/60TFV  https://archive.vn/PkPSt

name: Qatar
notes_H1: https://web.archive.org/web/20200528231507/https://twitter.com/MOPHQatar/status/1243993841935491074
notes_H2: No change in policy  https://archive.ph/3oXI6
notes_C7: No restrictions on internal movement.  https://web.archive.org/web/20210405163048/https://www.gco.gov.qa/en/preventative-measures/
notes_C1: ‘Ministry of Education and Higher Education decided to move to the distance learning model for all students in public and private schools, preschools and universities, and suspend the in-person attendance starting Sunday, April 4th.’     https://web.archive.org/web/20210405155549/https://www.edu.gov.qa/en/MediaCenter/Pages/MediaCenter/NewsDetails.aspx?itemid=287
notes_H6: All citizens and residents to continue wearing masks when leaving the house for any reason, unless the person is alone while driving a vehicle.   /web/20210209174445/https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2021/2/3/qatar-imposes-new-restriction-amid-fears-of-second-covid-wave
notes_E2: No change found  Duty relief  Customs duty exemption for food, medical equipment (COVID-19):the General Authority of Customs in addressing the effects of the coronavirus (COVID-19) pandemic has issued a directive exempting food and medical equipment from customs duties for a period of six months  The exemption from customs duty applies for 905 different items listed in the customs clearance system. These included basic food items and a number of medical devices  https://web.archive.org/web/20210322234308/https://home.kpmg/xx/en/home/insights/2020/04/qatar-government-and-institution-measures-in-response-to-covid.html
notes_E1: „No change found  Employers continue to pay basic salaries and other allowances, such as food and housing, as per their contract in sectors, activities and services whose businesses have not stopped due to the precautionary measures to combat the spread of the Coronavirus (COVID-19).”  https://web.archive.org/web/20210322234308/https://home.kpmg/xx/en/home/insights/2020/04/qatar-government-and-institution-measures-in-response-to-covid.html
notes_C3: "Qatar bans gatherings, deploy patrols to contain coronavirus"  https://web.archive.org/web/20200406200517/https://uk.reuters.com/article/us-health-coronavirus-qatar/qatar-bans-gatherings-deploy-patrols-to-contain-coronavirus-idUKKBN2180VZ
notes_C6: Effective April 9, 2021, social gatherings and visits in closed places are suspended. Permitted are gatherings at a maximum of 5 fully-vaccinated people in open spaces. No wedding ceremony is allowed.  ‘Continuing mosques for daily and Friday prayers for those over 12.’   https://web.archive.org/web/20210411221303/https://www.gco.gov.qa/en/preventative-measures/
notes_C8: https://web.archive.org/save/https://qa.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information-11/
notes_H8: ‘The elderly are the most vulnerable to COVID-19 and have been advised to avoid going out unless absolutely necessary. People should still visit elderly people if necessary, but exercise caution and follow proper hygiene principles.’  https://web.archive.org/web/20210405163048/https://www.gco.gov.qa/en/preventative-measures/
notes_C2: Effective April 9, 2021, ‘reducing employee numbers in public and private sector workplace to 50 %, excluding the military, security, and health sectors.’  https://web.archive.org/web/20210411221303/https://www.gco.gov.qa/en/preventative-measures/
notes_C4: Social gatherings and visits in closed places are suspended. Permitted are gatherings at a maximum of 5 people in open spaces. No wedding ceremony is allowed. Effective from March 26, 2021 the capacity of restaurants can not exceed 15 % for all indoors. The training of sports teams in closed and open spaces is not allowed. The capacity of commercial complexes is reduced to 30 %. Closing of playgrounds in public parks. Gatherings of family members are restricted to the same house or two people as maximum. Mosques remain open.  https://web.archive.org/web/20210405163048/https://www.gco.gov.qa/en/preventative-measures/
notes_H7: As of March 30, 2021, the ministry of public health has announced to lower the age threshold for vaccine eligibility to 40 years of age. More than 765,000 doses have been already administered to older people, those with chronic conditions, healthcare worker and other key essential workers.  https://web.archive.org/web/20210405160302/https://www.moph.gov.qa/english/mediacenter/News/Pages/NewsDetails.aspx?ItemId=352
notes_H3: Those who shared accommmodations with the patients, or had contact with them, have been quarantined and are being tested to ensure they are free from infection  https://web.archive.org/web/20200528231023/https://www.moph.gov.qa/english/mediacenter/News/Pages/NewsDetails.aspx?ItemId=95
notes_C5: Effective from March 26, 2021 the number of people transported by buses is to be half of the bus. Capacity in Metro services should not exceed 30 % on weekdays and 20 % on Fridays and Saturdays. No more than four people to be in the vehicle, including the driver.  https://web.archive.org/web/20210405163048/https://www.gco.gov.qa/en/preventative-measures/

name: Romania
notes_H1: Starting on 25/02/2020, an online information campaign was launched on the official Government of Romania Facebook page on the "Prevention and limitation of eventual infection with coronavirus". New, updated information has since been provided daily on the facebook page (https://web.archive.org/web/20200812130651/https://www.facebook.com/guv.ro)  On the 24/02/2020, this campaign was announced: "The information campaign of the population regarding the infection with COVID-19 will be extended, as well as the individual and collective prevention measures which should be taken and a daily newscast will be drafted regarding the development at international level and possible additional measures taken by the Romanian authorities" (https://web.archive.org/web/20200812130808/https://www.nineoclock.ro/2020/02/24/pm-designate-orban-urges-romanians-to-learn-about-coronavirus-from-official-sources-only/)
notes_H2: 1. Symptomatic persons, including medical staff according to the case definition;   2. Symptomatic close contacts of confirmed cases;   3. Asymptomatic patients before the transplant procedure and donors of hematopoietic organs, tissues and stem cells before donation; patients with transplants of hematopoietic organs, tissues and stem cells undergoing immunosuppressive therapy, before each hospitalization during the post-transplant monitoring period - 2 tests at 24-hour intervals;   4. Asymptomatic patients with immunosuppression in the context of the disease or drug-induced hospitalization - 2 tests at 24-hour intervals;   5. Asymptomatic cancer patients undergoing chemotherapy and / or radiotherapy - twice a month;   6. Asymptomatic cancer patients before surgery or invasive interventions;   7. Symptomatic haemodialysis patients;   8. Asymptomatic haemodialysis patients contacts with a confirmed case, 2 tests at 6-7 days interval between them; during this period they will be dialyzed in separate sessions from the rest of the patients;   9. Symptomatic institutionalized individuals;   10. Asymptomatic pregnant women in quarantine/home isolation or close contact with a confirmed case;   11. Staff of residential centres/long-term care facilities – twice a month;   12. Asymptomatic healthcare personnel who have been in direct contact with a confirmed case, in the 6th or 7th day since the last contact.   https://web.archive.org/web/20200608103644/https://www.cnscbt.ro/index.php/1697-definitii-de-caz-si-algoritm-de-testare-pentru-covid-19-actualizare-28-04-2020-1/file
notes_C7: According to the Decision 35/10.02.2021, the alert status on the Romanian territory is extended. It is in place a ban for traffic persons outside the home between 23:00 and 5:00 (exception for travel in professional interest, for medical assistance). Additionally, the Ministry of Interior published the list of quarantined localities.  Link: Link: https://archive.fo/4mnCH and https://archive.fo/wip/a09tG
notes_C1: Romania began to reopen schools on 8 February, three months after the Government closed schools throughout the country to limit the spread of the COVID-19 pandemic.    There are 3 scenarios for reopening schools based on the epidemiological situation in each locality:    The green scenario, which applies to towns with low incidence rates of COVID-19, allows all children to return to school.    The yellow scenario, which applies to cities with moderate incidence rates, only kindergarten children and primary school (I-IV grades) pupils return to school, plus those in the eighth and twelfth grades, who have to prepare for the national exams.    The red scenario, which applies in localities with incidence rates of over 3 per 1,000 inhabitants (over a 14-day period), only kindergarten and primary school children return to school.    Students who can’t return to school, either due to the yellow or red scenarios, will continue online courses, which have been going on for most of the first semester.    Currently, the cumulative incidence of cases in the last 14 days is over 3 per 1,000 occupants in Timis and Maramures counties, therefore, these counties are in the red scenario.     https://web.archive.org/web/20210219211716/https://www.romaniajournal.ro/society-people/education/physical-classes-in-schools-resumed-as-of-february-8/    https://web.archive.org/web/20210219211543/https://www.edu.ro/sites/default/files/ordin%20comun%20nr.%203.235_93_4.02.2021.pdf    https://archive.fo/85fHU
notes_H6: According to the Decision 52/5.11.2020 (extended through Decision 58/10.12.2020) of The National Emergency Committee, it is in place the obligation to wear a protective mask, to cover the nose and mouth, for all persons who have reached the age of 5, in all open and closed public spaces, regardless the value of the cumulative incidence rate of cases in the last 14 days (as it previously of this decision was).   Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20201120195835/https://s.iw.ro/gateway/g/ZmlsZVNvdXJjZT1odHRwJTNBJTJGJTJG/c3RvcmFnZTA2dHJhbnNjb2Rlci5yY3Mt/cmRzLnJvJTJGc3RvcmFnZSUyRjIwMjAl/MkYxMSUyRjA2JTJGMTI0ODQ3NV8xMjQ4/NDc1X0hvdGFyYXJlLUNOU1UtNTItZGlu/LTA1XzExXzIwMjAtdjE5LTEucGRmJmhh/c2g9NjkxN2E0NDIwOTQ4MGQ1NjJiYzMxZmNjYjczZjY2NjI=.pdf, https://web.archive.org/web/20201212161456/https://www.gov.ro/fisiere/pagini_fisiere/Hotarare_CNSU_nr._58_din_10.12.2020.pdf and https://archive.fo/4mnCH
notes_E2: On 22nd of October, the government approved the application of the simplified alternative procedure for granting payment rescheduling for a maximum of 12 months. Beneficiaries of the simplified staggering facility are all taxpayers. According to Emergency Ordinance 69/14.05.2020, the authorities have adopted fiscal measures to help taxpayers overcome the problems caused by the COVID-19 pandemic (granting bonuses, extension of the deadline for submitting the Single Declaration, tax facilities for incentives and bonuses granted by the employer from the salary fund for the period of emergency to employees whose activity involves risk of infection with SARS-CoV-2, bonuses regarding the annual building tax and the monthly building tax, cancellation of ancillary payment obligations.  Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20210315184933/https://archive.fo/OJIQT and https://web.archive.org/web/20210315185046/https://archive.fo/hVM21
notes_E1: A Government Emergency Ordinance (GEO 30/2020) has been published, outlining social protection measures during the state of emergency due to COVID-19. The measures introduced by GEO 30/2020 come into force on 21 March 2020.  'The Labor Code provides that employers can decide unilaterally to suspend individual employment agreements of their employees and place the employees in technical unemployment. The employer is required to ensure from its own funds the payment of a minimum allowance of 75% of the employee’s base salary. However, if the employers meet one of the following criteria, during the state of emergency, the technical unemployment allowance can be supported by the Unemployment Insurance Budget up to the limit of 75% of the average gross salary provided for under the law for the social insurance budget for 2020'.  http://web.archive.org/web/20200502180616/https://home.kpmg/ro/en/home/insights/2020/03/social-protection-measures-during-the-state-of-emergency.html  https://web.archive.org/web/20200812125709/https://www.imf.org/en/Topics/imf-and-covid19/Policy-Responses-to-COVID-19
notes_C3: According to the Decision no.293/10.03.21, the organization and outdoor performance of shows, concerts, public and private festivals, or other cultural events are allowed only with the participation of up to 300 spectators with seats, at a distance of at least 2 meters from each other, as well as wearing a protective mask. Activities are prohibited in counties / localities where the cumulative incidence in the last 14 days of cases is higher than 1.5 / 1,000 inhabitants.  Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20210322062833/https://archive.fo/TWKy02JTJGMTI0ODQ3NV8xMjQ4/NDc1X0hvdGFyYXJlLUNOU1UtNTItZGlu/LTA1XzExXzIwMjAtdjE5LTEucGRmJmhh/c2g9NjkxN2E0NDIwOTQ4MGQ1NjJiYzMxZmNjYjczZjY2NjI=.pdf
notes_C6: Throughout Romania, it is forbidden for people to be outside the home between 23.00 - 05.00, with the following exceptions:    Travel in the professional interest, including between home / household and the place / places where the professional activity takes place and back.    Travel for medical care that cannot be postponed or performed remotely, as well as for the purchase of medicines.    Travel outside the locality of persons who are in transit or make journeys whose time interval overlaps with the prohibition period such as those made by plane, train, coach or other means of passenger transport and which can be proved by ticket or any another way to pay for the trip.    Travel for justified reasons, such as caring for / accompanying the child, assisting the elderly, sick or disabled or the death of a family member.    In order to justify moving away from home during this period, citizens must have on them the declaration on their own responsibility, the certificate from the employer or the service card (the last two can only be used to justify moving for professional purposes).    https://web.archive.org/web/20210219211825/https://stirioficiale.ro/conduita
notes_C8: There are screening procedures implemented at the “Henri Coanda” International Airport (three thermal scanners and a joint action plan with the Border Police and the Public Health Directorate to collect questionnaires from travelers arriving in the country and to distribute information about local measures and restrictions) The National Institute of Public Health published a new list of states with high epidemiological risk. The decisions no.6/04.02.2021 and 9/11.02.2021 of National Committee for Emergency Situations contain the required conditions for the passengers coming in Romania from countries with high epidemiological risk.   Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20210226145023/http://www.cnscbt.ro/index.php/liste-zone-afectate-covid-19, https://web.archive.org/web/20210228162247/https://stirioficiale.ro/hotarari/hotararea-nr-9-din-11-02-2021-cnsu and https://web.archive.org/web/20210219215935/https://ro.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_H8: Throughout Romania, it is forbidden for people to be outside the home between 23.00 - 05.00, with the following exceptions:    Travel in the professional interest, including between home / household and the place / places where the professional activity takes place and back.    Travel for medical care that cannot be postponed or performed remotely, as well as for the purchase of medicines.    Travel outside the locality of persons who are in transit or make journeys whose time interval overlaps with the prohibition period such as those made by plane, train, coach or other means of passenger transport and which can be proved by ticket or any another way to pay for the trip.    Travel for justified reasons, such as caring for / accompanying the child, assisting the elderly, sick or disabled or the death of a family member.    In order to justify moving away from home during this period, citizens must have on them the declaration on their own responsibility, the certificate from the employer or the service card (the last two can only be used to justify moving for professional purposes).    https://web.archive.org/web/20210219211825/https://stirioficiale.ro/conduita
notes_C2: According to the Decision no.293/10.03.21, the organization and development of activity in cinemas, performance institutions and / or concerts are allowed with the participation of the public up to 50% of the maximum capacity of the space, if the incidence accumulated in the last 14 days of cases in the county / locality is less than or equal to 1.5 / 1,000 inhabitants. Also, the activity of restaurants and cafes inside hotels, boarding houses or other accommodation units is allowed without exceeding 50% of the maximum capacity of the space and in the time interval 6.00-22.00, in the counties / localities where the cumulative incidence of cases in the last 14 days is less than or equal to 1.5 / 1,000 inhabitants, not exceeding 30% of the maximum capacity of the space.  Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20210322062833/https://archive.fo/TWKy02JTJGMTI0ODQ3NV8xMjQ4/NDc1X0hvdGFyYXJlLUNOU1UtNTItZGlu/LTA1XzExXzIwMjAtdjE5LTEucGRmJmhh/c2g9NjkxN2E0NDIwOTQ4MGQ1NjJiYzMxZmNjYjczZjY2NjI=.pdf
notes_C4: Social events such as weddings and funerals are limited to 10 guests.  Link: https://archive.fo/kYCaw
notes_H7: On 15th of March, the third stage of the vaccination program for the general population began. Also, on 15th of March, the National Coordinating Committee for Vaccination Activities against COVID-19 decided to continue the vaccination campaign in Romania will all vaccines against COVID-19, following the analysis of the adverse reaction reports registered in Romania and the recommendations of the European Medicines Agency.   Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20210322055714/https://vaccinare-covid.gov.ro/peste-47-000-de-persoane-programate-si-peste-350-000-de-persoane-pe-lista-de-asteptare-pentru-etapa-a-iii-a/  and  https://web.archive.org/web/20210322054356/https://stirioficiale.ro/informatii/precizari-privind-vaccinarea-cu-vaccinul-produs-de-compania-oxford-astrazeneca-15-03-2020
notes_H3: An official document regarding contact tracing and testing of contacts of COVID-19 confirmed patient was released by National Center for Surveillance and Control of Transmissible Diseases on 23rd of July 2020. On 28th of October, the Ministry of Health published updated the flow of information used in reporting SARS CoV-2 virus infection data.  According to this document, the Directorates of Public Health (DSP) have the obligation to identify and confirm, following the epidemiological investigation, direct contacts of each person tested positive.   Link: https://archive.fo/thRdi and https://archive.fo/FUhtr
notes_C5: According to the Decision 52/5.11.2020 of The National Emergency Committee, it is in place the obligation to wear a protective mask, to cover the nose and mouth, for all persons who have reached the age of 5, in all open and closed public spaces. Also, to avoid the congestion of public transport, it is proposed to all public institutions and all economic operators to organize work schedule (where telework is not possible) into at least two groups to start/finish the activity at a difference of at least two hours.  Link: https://s.iw.ro/gateway/g/ZmlsZVNvdXJjZT1odHRwJTNBJTJGJTJG/c3RvcmFnZTA2dHJhbnNjb2Rlci5yY3Mt/cmRzLnJvJTJGc3RvcmFnZSUyRjIwMjAl/MkYxMSUyRjA2JTJGMTI0ODQ3NV8xMjQ4/NDc1X0hvdGFyYXJlLUNOU1UtNTItZGlu/LTA1XzExXzIwMjAtdjE5LTEucGRmJmhh/c2g9NjkxN2E0NDIwOTQ4MGQ1NjJiYzMxZmNjYjczZjY2NjI=.pdf

name: Russia
notes_H1: Prime Minister announces a plan to roll out a public information campaign about the coronavirus progression in the near future. (http://web.archive.org/web/20200505222301/https://www.kommersant.ru/doc/4290524)
notes_H2: Testing is widely available in Russia, both through government healthcare providers and private clinics.  Testing is free at government healthcare providers for those suspected of having coronavirus.  Link: https://archive.vn/4ShjR
notes_C7: Are there restrictions on intercity or interstate travel? No  Link: https://archive.vn/MxaXR
notes_C1: Schools and universities are back to off-line learning nation-wide.    http://web.archive.org/web/20210308121653/https://www.imf.org/en/Topics/imf-and-covid19/Policy-Responses-to-COVID-19
notes_H6: The code should be changed to 2G.  On October 28th, the government of the Russian Federation reinstated a requirement to wear masks in crowded public areas, including public transportation, taxis, parking lots, and elevators. This order applies to the entire country.    http://web.archive.org/web/20210221214744/https://ru.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_E2: Due to the coronavirus in 2020, various exemptions were introduced for Russian citizens, including a ban on penalty for communal debts and a moratorium on the verification of metering devices. From January 2021, all these exemptions for households are lifted.   Link: https://archive.vn/3YHi3
notes_E1: According to the Decree ? 2393 from 31 December 2020, the government extended the maximum amount of unemployment benefits until the end of 2021 due to COVID-19. The maximum allowance will remain at 12,130 rubles. In the first three months, an unemployed citizen will be paid 75 percent of lost salary, and the second three months – 60 percent of lost salary.   It should be mentioned that in March 2020 the maximum amount of unemployment benefits was increased from 8,000 rubles to 12,130 rubles. Initially, this was a temporary government measure to support unemployed citizens during COVID-19. However, at the end of 2020, the government decided to keep the maximum allowance in 2021 at the same level as before.   Links: https://archive.vn/NOmKP https://archive.vn/w7MzJ https://archive.vn/FLNJD
notes_C3: The U.S embassy on Russia indicates "some jurisdictions place limitations on large gatherings and mass events". However, no specific policies were found associated with this indicator.    http://web.archive.org/web/20200831224047/https://ru.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_C6: There is no curfew in place.  Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20210330190555/https://ru.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_C8: From at least 17 November, the Government of the Russian Federation banned the entry of foreign nationals, including American citizens, with a few exceptions.    https://web.archive.org/web/20201122205355/https://ru.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_H8: People over 65 in Moscow are recommended to stay at home from March 8.  Links: https://archive.vn/taDOh https://archive.vn/XyiV1
notes_C2: Moscow and Saint Petersburg have lifted a number of restrictions. Currently, in Saint Petersburg theaters, museums, and other cultural venues may not exceed the 50-percent capacity. Earlier, the limit was 25 percent.   Links: https://archive.vn/H4TXW https://archive.vn/SOe9e https://archive.vn/JZYIB
notes_C4: Some jurisdictions place limitations on large gatherings and mass events. See: https://ru.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/ [accessed 12th October 2020, web archive unavailable, webpage last updated 6th October 2020]
notes_H7: Russia’s vaccine Sputnik V has been available since 18th of January without appointment. The vaccines “EpiVacCorona” and “Kovivak” are also available. “Ad5-nCoV” from CanSino Biologics Inc. (China) is allowed by the Ministry of Health of Russian Federation to participate in the phase III study assessment of the effectiveness and immunogenicity.   Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20210404160929/https://www.dw.com/en/russia-free-mass-coronavirus-vaccinations-and-an-ice-pop-to-boot/a-56532772  and https://web.archive.org/web/20210327232107/https://%D0%B2%D0%B0%D0%BA%D1%86%D0%B8%D0%BD%D0%B0.%D1%81%D1%82%D0%BE%D0%BF%D0%BA%D0%BE%D1%80%D0%BE%D0%BD%D0%B0%D0%B2%D0%B8%D1%80%D1%83%D1%81.%D1%80%D1%84/
notes_H3: The Ministry of Digital Development of the Russian Federation announced on 25th of November launch of the application “Gosulgi. Covid Tracker” to track contacts with coronavirus patients all around Russia.   Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20210404185151/https://www.ewdn.com/2020/11/25/russian-government-launches-covid-contact-tracing-app/
notes_C5: No measures found relative to closing transports on the RF's coronavirus official website nor in the news, other than masks are mandatory in some cities.

name: Rwanda
notes_H1: The Rwandan government hastened safety measures against coronavirus and were consistent in reminding Rwanda citizens to be more vigilant on preventing novel coronavirus.   https://web.archive.org/web/20200430191424/https://www.afro.who.int/news/rwanda-hastens-safety-measures-against-novel-coronavirus   https://web.archive.org/web/20200430185258/https://www.primature.gov.rw/index.php?id=40  https://web.archive.org/web/20201120191729/https://www.newvision.co.ug/news/1516513/coronavirus-rwanda-closes-churches-schools
notes_H2: Testing available at accredited test centers (for a charge)    https://web.archive.org/web/20210304095728/https://rw.usembassy.gov/health-alert-covid-19-information/
notes_C7: ?Travel between Kigali and other provinces and districts is not permitted, except for essential services and tourism (tourists must possess a negative COVID-19 test result).  Travelers, including drivers, traveling to tourism entities within Kigali and other provinces and districts are required to complete and submit movement requests through the Tourism Movement Facilitation Form found here. Travelers are also required to send copies of negative COVID-19 test results to visitrwanda@rbd.rwat least 24 hours prior to the trip.  http://web.archive.org/web/20210315130931/https://rw.usembassy.gov/health-alert-covid-19-information/
notes_C1: From 23-Feb-21 - All schools (public and private), including universities, will resume.      https://web.archive.org/web/20210304095728/https://rw.usembassy.gov/health-alert-covid-19-information/
notes_H6: Masks/face coverings are required in public.  https://web.archive.org/web/20210304095728/https://rw.usembassy.gov/health-alert-covid-19-information/
notes_E2: 18/03 announced  National Bank of Rwanda announced easing of loan repayment conditions for borrowers affected by the Covid-19: banks are exceptionally allowed to restructure outstanding loans of borrowers temporarily facing cash flow challenges due to Covid-19: https://web.archive.org/web/20200507084813/https://www.cnbcafrica.com/east-africa/2020/03/23/central-bank-of-rwanda-takes-measures-to-mitigate-the-economic-impact-of-covid-19/    The Rwandan Ministry of Finance and Economic Planning has announced a series of tax exemptions as part of efforts to support different sectors of the economy to recover from the effects of COVID 19 pandemic. Pay As You Earn (PAYE) will be waived for a period of six months from April to September for teachers in private schools earning up to 150,000 Rwandan francs net salary (about 161 U.S. dollars), a statement issued by the ministry said. The waiver will also apply for a period of three months from April to June for employees of companies operating in the tourism and hotel sector who earn up to 150,000 Rwandan francs net salary, the statement said. PAYE waiver lasts till September for teachers, and till June for everyone else. The government also exempted masks made in Rwanda to prevent COVID-19 spread from paying Value Added Tax (VAT).  https://web.archive.org/web/20200825035927/http://www.xinhuanet.com/english/2020-05/10/c_139045597.htm
notes_E1: Full IMF statement: As of November 4, 2020 "Tax deferral and relief measures include the following: (i) suspension of down payments on outstanding tax for amicable settlement, (ii)softening of enforcement for tax arrears collection, (iii) extension of the deadline for filing and paying CIT, (iv) fast-tracking of VAT refunds to SMEs, (v) CIT and PIT payments based on current year transactions, (vi) PIT exemption for private school teachers and tourism and hotel employees earning less than RWF 150,000/month, and (vi) VAT exemption for locally produced masks."    Main impact on indicator is cash transfers to casual workers  https://web.archive.org/web/20200904183810/https://www.imf.org/en/Topics/imf-and-covid19/Policy-Responses-to-COVID-19  PIT exemption for private school teachers and tourism and hotel employees earning less than RWF 150,000/month - as per the update on 10th Sept 2020  https://web.archive.org/web/20200914124848/https://www.imf.org/en/Topics/imf-and-covid19/Policy-Responses-to-COVID-19
notes_C3: Religious gatherings limited to max. 30% capacity. Restaurants, cafes and essential business to operate with max. 30% capacity/occupancy, markets and malls with up to 50% capacity.     https://web.archive.org/web/20210304095728/https://rw.usembassy.gov/health-alert-covid-19-information/
notes_C6: Stay-at-home orders have been eased, although a night-time curfew remains in effect.  http://web.archive.org/web/20210210002042/https://www.aa.com.tr/en/africa/rwanda-eases-covid-19-lockdown-in-capital/2137274
notes_C8: Everyone will be tested on arrival and must quarantine in a designated hotel for 24 hours pending the result. If staying longer than seven days, thereafter seven days quarantine at home.   https://web.archive.org/web/20210218085810/https://www.wko.at/service/aussenwirtschaft/coronavirus-situation-in-kosovo.html
notes_H8: The vaccination is expected to be done in phases. In the first phase, the vaccine will go to front-line workers in healthcare including but not limited to those working in treatment centres and Intensive Care Units (ICUs). This phase will also see the vaccination of people above 65   https://web.archive.org/web/20210128052530/https://www.newtimes.co.rw/news/unpacking-rwanda-plan-distribute-covid-19-vaccine
notes_C2: Business must close by 18:00. Restaurants can offer take away service until 20:00.      https://web.archive.org/web/20210304095728/https://rw.usembassy.gov/health-alert-covid-19-information/
notes_C4: All social gatherings and events including religious weddings ceremonies, receptions, meetings and conferences are prohibited.  Funeral gatherings should not exceed 15 persons. Bars, places of worship, and gaming activities are all closed.  https://web.archive.org/web/20210202141756/https://www.gov.rw/fileadmin/user_upload/gov_user_upload/Publications/Cabinet_Resolutions/Statement_on_Cabinet_Resolutions_of_18_January_2021.pdf
notes_H7: A - Key workers via Covax  & C - Elderly groups - it doesn't say which type.   The vaccination is expected to be done in phases. In the first phase, the vaccine will go to front-line workers in healthcare including but not limited to those working in treatment centres and Intensive Care Units (ICUs). This phase will also see the vaccination of people above 65 and those whose immunity is weak and is likely to easily be compromised like those with cancer, diabetes, HIV and other serious diseases.  https://web.archive.org/web/20210223001542/https://www.pmnewsnigeria.com/2021/02/15/rwanda-begins-covid-19-vaccination-for-health-workers-others/   https://web.archive.org/web/20210128052530/https://www.newtimes.co.rw/news/unpacking-rwanda-plan-distribute-covid-19-vaccine
notes_H3: Rwanda confirmed its first case of coronavirus, an Indian citizen who arrived in the East African nation from Mumbai on March 8, according to the Health Ministry. Since then the World Health Organisation (WHO) has confirmed that the tracing of all contacts in Rwanda has been conducted for further management.       https://web.archive.org/web/20200430194341/https://uk.reuters.com/article/us-health-coronavirus-rwanda/rwanda-confirms-first-case-of-coronavirus-health-ministry-idUKKBN2110G0     https://web.archive.org/web/20200430194919/https://www.afro.who.int/countries/842/news?page=3
notes_C5: It appears that restrictions on public transport have been eased.  http://web.archive.org/web/20210210002042/https://www.aa.com.tr/en/africa/rwanda-eases-covid-19-lockdown-in-capital/2137274

name: Saudi Arabia
notes_H1: The Ministry of Health conducts campaigns that target citizens and residents (in Arabic, English, Hindy, Tagalog, among others) reporting the number of cases and recommending people how to take preventative measures. https://web.archive.org/web/20200608033137/https://twitter.com/SaudiMOH/status/1244341052196163585
notes_H2: "The ministry highlighted that the new phase will not include COVID-19 examination inside houses or by visiting residences. Instead, the ministry will provide different outlets and options to conduct the tests. It will establish drive-through centers for testing people inside their cars in several cities while also offering testing services at primary health care centers, and allow citizens and residents to book appointments to collect their own test samples through an online application."  https://web.archive.org/web/20200608034049/https://www.arabnews.com/node/1677726/saudi-arabia
notes_C7: "There are currently no curfew or movement restrictions in effect within the country (...)"    Sources: http://web.archive.org/web/20200819124650/https://sa.usembassy.gov/u-s-citizen-services/covid-19-information/
notes_C1: The Ministry of Education determined schools and universities would close to stop the spread of the virus. https://web.archive.org/web/20200608023056/https://www.arabnews.com/node/1638606/saudi-arabia
notes_H6: On 30 May, face masks become mandatory in public places. Non-compliance is fined with up to SR1,000 ($266).     Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20200831214012/https://www.arabnews.com/node/1686821/saudi-arabia
notes_E2: Eligible people (social insurance beneficiaries, orphans and the disabled) were waived from paying rent for 3 months. https://web.archive.org/web/20200414205607/http://saudigazette.com.sa/article/591775/SAUDI-ARABIA/Social-insurance-beneficiaries-orphans-and-disabled-exempted-from-paying-rent-for-3-months
notes_E1: Saudi Government has announced to pay 60% of the salaries of Saudi employees working in the Private sector for a period of three months with a ceiling of USD 2.39 billion. The Compensation will be paid in accordance with the conditions stipulated in the unemployment insurance system (SANID)  https://web.archive.org/web/20201221220947/https://home.kpmg/xx/en/home/insights/2020/04/saudi-arabia-government-and-institution-measures-in-response-to-covid.html
notes_C3: No mention of public events, but given that gatherings over 50 are still prohibited, I think this should still be coded as a 2G.  "Saudi Arabia has allowed social events — including wedding receptions and other celebrations — to be held from Thursday, with up to 50 people, ensuring guests must wear face masks and abide by the social distancing protocol."  Source  https://web.archive.org/web/20200729161532/https://gulfnews.com/world/gulf/saudi/saudi-arabia-allows-social-events-weddings-with-up-to-50-people-1.1593635688372
notes_C6: Cannot find any government guidance that recommends to people to stay at home, including the source used for the previous 1G coding.
notes_C8: The Saudi authorities require anyone who is travelling from a country where the new strain of COVID-19 has spread to spend at least 14 days outside the affected country before entering the Kingdom https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/saudi-arabia
notes_H8: "????The Ministry of Health (MOH) pointed out that older persons come among the most vulnerable groups to Novel Coronavirus (COVID-19) complications.        Through an infographic published on its Twitter page, MOH has advised household workers, who care for older persons, to adhere to a number of precautionary measures. They include wearing face masks while accompanying the elderly, washing hands before and after contact with them, maintaining physical distancing if there is no need to, not sharing personal tools with them, wearing face masks and gloves while providing personal hygiene for them, as well as disposing of their waste properly?."     http://web.archive.org/web/20210218114441/https://www.moh.gov.sa/en/Ministry/MediaCenter/News/Pages/News-2020-07-15-003.aspx
notes_C2: Authorities in Saudi Arabia will allow the resumption of indoor dining in restaurants and cafes, in addition to allowing cinemas, malls, and gyms to reopen on March 7. Establishments that remain open must implement enhanced COVID-19 sanitization procedures, perform temperature checks of employees and patrons, and comply with social distancing guidelines.  https://web.archive.org/web/20210329220134/https://www.garda.com/crisis24/news-alerts/451796/saudi-arabia-authorities-to-lift-some-domestic-restrictions-nationwide-beginning-march-7-update-54

notes_H7: RIYADH: Almost 300,000 people have received the COVID-19 vaccine in Saudi Arabia, the health ministry said on Sunday.  “The vaccine is the key and the powerful weapon that will make us healthy,” ministry spokesperson Dr. Mohammed Al-Abd Al-Aly said.  He said citizens and residents who have a valid national identity number or residence number are eligible to receive the vaccine through the “Sehaty” app.   /web/20210209002245/https://www.arabnews.com/node/1794306/saudi-arabia
notes_H3: In February, the Saudi Center for Disease Prevention and control released a comprehensive set of Coronavirus Health Guidelines. The guidelines instruct the public health team or rapid response team to conduct a number of measures for a patient that has the virus, including filling out a contact tracing form (Appendix  3 in the guidelines) https://www.moh.gov.sa/CCC/healthp/regulations/Documents/Coronavirus%20Disease%202019%20Guidelines%20v1.1..pdf

name: Senegal
notes_H1: The president calls on religious authorities to support the government with adopted measures.   https://web.archive.org/web/20200518002240/http://www.sante.gouv.sn/Actualites/covid-19-les-decisions-de-son-execellence-monsieur-macky-sall-president-de-la-republique
notes_H2: "Individuals in Senegal may obtain COVID-19 testing at the following locations. The cost is FCFA 40,000 per test."    https://web.archive.org/web/20210111200501/https://sn.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_C7: The motorways between the international airport and Thiès and between the airport and Mbour are closed between 8pm and 6am.    The Government of Senegal has advised that the airport will remain open and existing flight schedules will not change. People can still travel to the airport during curfew if they are passengers arriving and departing or the driver (no other people accompanying passengers are allowed). All of these people must carry a copy of their passport and plane ticket, which will allow for movement to the airport or to their accommodation. If you are arriving into Senegal at the airport in curfew hours, you should contact the person or taxi company you have arranged to collect you in advance to make sure they can still access the airport and have all the necessary paperwork.    There is currently no restriction on travel between regions, and authorisation is not needed to travel between regions. Internal flights have also restarted. Masks must be worn at all times in public areas and when travelling, including in a private car if there are two or more people in the car.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210125055820/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/senegal/coronavirus
notes_C1: Schools reopened in Senegal on November 12th. Students are required to wear masks, and distancing is encouraged.     https://web.archive.org/web/20201221221105/http://nouvelhorizon.sn/index.php/2020/11/12/le-fait-du-jour-rentree-des-classes-sous-le-signe-du-racket-des-ecoles-privees/    https://web.archive.org/web/20201221222443/https://www.facebook.com/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.facebook.com%2Fsnmen%2Fposts%2F2906065296280444    https://web.archive.org/web/20201221222738/https://www.facebook.com/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.facebook.com%2Fsnmen%2Fposts%2F2931551557065151
notes_H6: Masks must be worn in all public areas throughout Senegal, including in supermarkets, on public transport (which is still operating with reduced capacity), in taxis, and when on public streets.  https://web.archive.org/save/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/senegal/coronavirus
notes_E2: Previous note referred to this note    "One million households receive food aid (FCFA 69 billion) and utility payments for (for water and electricity) for poorer customers were suspended for a 2-month period (FCFA 18,5 billion)."    But this 2 month period has elapsed    https://web.archive.org/web/20201221143702/https://www.imf.org/en/Topics/imf-and-covid19/Policy-Responses-to-COVID-19

notes_H7: Note: Senegal has received vaccines Sinopharm vaccines from China (also expects vaccines from COVAX and Russia potentially). See: https://www.africanews.com/2021/02/23/senegal-begins-covid-19-vaccination-with-doses-from-china-s-sinopharm// [web archive unavailable]  The Government of Senegal has launched an online platform for individuals who reside in Senegal to register their interest in receiving the COVID vaccine. https://web.archive.org/web/20210227221356/https://sn.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/  Also: Senegal's vaccination strategy is focused on two stages: The first will include health personnel, the elderly, those with co-morbidities. Stage two will involve the vaccination of an estimated 80% of the population, by the end of 2022. See https://www.weforum.org/agenda/2021/02/senegal-covid-response-macky-sall/ [web archive unavailable]

name: Singapore
notes_H1: https://www.moh.gov.sg/news-highlights/details/precautionary-measures-in-response-to-severe-pneumonia-cases-in-wuhan-china
notes_H2: "“As Singapore has made good progress to support a further resumption of activities, the Multi-Ministry Taskforce (MTF) will start Phase 3 of re-opening from 28 Dec 2020.  Update on pre-conditions for moving into Phase 3  To move into Phase 3, we needed:  (…) Sufficient testing capabilities for early detection and public health action: Singapore ramped up Polymerase Chain Reaction (PCR) test capacity significantly to be able to run over 50,000 tests a day. Antigen rapid tests were also introduced for larger and higher-risk events.”    Source: http://web.archive.org/web/20201231155002/https://www.gov.sg/article/moving-into-phase-3-of-re-opening-on-28-dec-2020
notes_C7: From June 19, Singapore has entered Phase Two of its COVID19 policy, where most sectors of the economy and most schools have reopened and public transport is operating. In a small city-state like Singapore, this effectively means internal movement is no longer restricted.     https://archive.vn/qVq8N
notes_C1: "Students will return to school from June 2 over two phases as part of the easing of the coronavirus circuit breaker measures that are expected to end on June 1.    Here are some of the adjustments planned for schools and pre-schools that the Government announced on Tuesday (May 19).    1. Phase 1 of resuming school: First few weeks from June 2    For primary and secondary schools:  -Primary 6, Secondary 4 and Secondary 5 students will attend school on weekdays.    - The rest of the upper levels (Primary 4 and 5, or Secondary 3) will alternate weekly with the lower levels (Primary 1, 2, and 3, or Secondary 1 and 2) to be back in school for one week, then switch to home-based learning the next week.    For junior colleges (JCs) and Millennia Institute (MI):  - Up to half of the students will return to school. JCs and MI will prioritise JC2 and Pre-University 3 students, with some rotation of students from the other levels.    For special education (Sped) schools:  - Students' return will be staggered from June 2. All students will be back in school by June 8.    For institutes of higher learning (IHLs):  - Polytechnic students will return primarily for practical and laboratory sessions. Lessons and tutorials will remain online.  - Institute of Technical Education students will rotate weekly between online and on-campus lessons. They will return primarily for practical and lab sessions.    For pre-schools:  - Kindergarten 1 and Kindergarten 2 children may return from June 2.  - Nursery 1 and Nursery 2 children may return from June 8.  - Infant care and playgroup children may return from June 10.  - Early intervention centres to reopen in phases from June 2, starting with in-person intervention for children with higher needs."    Note: According to the codebook childcare is captured in C2 and hybrid teaching (in-class and online teaching), since schools are not fully closed, should be coded as 1G.    Source: http://web.archive.org/web/20201207122250/https://www.straitstimes.com/singapore/schools-to-open-in-phases-from-june-2-after-covid-19-circuit-breaker-how-this-will-work
notes_H6: From April 14, masks became mandatory at all times once leaving the house. https://web.archive.org/web/20200902003543/https://www.channelnewsasia.com/news/singapore/covid19-wearing-masks-compulsory-lawrence-wong-12640828
notes_E2: "The Act covers contracts for rentals in the industrial and commercial sectors, construction and supply contracts, as well as certain secured loan facilities granted by a bank or a finance company to small and medium-sized enterprises.  Contracts for events such as weddings or conferences, as well as in tourism, such as cruise and hotel bookings, are also covered."  http://web.archive.org/web/20201210010413/https://www.straitstimes.com/singapore/how-to-seek-contractual-relief-for-yourself-or-your-business-under-the-covid-19-temporary
notes_E1: On 26 May, the government announced the Fortitude Budget. The Job Support Scheme (JSS) will be extended for 1 more month to cover wages in August 2020. For firms that cannot resume operations immediately after the circuit breaker, the Government will continue to provide wage support at 75% until August 2020, or when they are allowed to re-open (whichever is earlier). There will also be increased support for some affected sectors (eg. aerospace sector, retail, marine and offshore) - an increase from the previous 25% to either 50% or 75%.    Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20200712075233/https://www.gov.sg/article/a-summary-of-the-fortitude-budget-2020
notes_C3: Starting from 1 October 2020, STB will start accepting applications for Event Organisers and Event Venues to pilot MICE events of up to 5 zones of 50 attendees (250 pax) with attendees to be divided into cohorts of 20.    https://web.archive.org/web/20201021161056/https://www.imda.gov.sg/news-and-events/Media-Room/Media-Releases/2020/Advisories-on-COVID-19-Situation
notes_C6: People are encouraged to work from home wherever possible, and social distancing measures must be complied with, but there are no curfews or requirements in place.    https://archive.vn/qVq8N
notes_C8: http://web.archive.org/web/20210116174339/https://www.gov.sg/article/how-is-singapore-limiting-the-spread-of-covid-19
notes_H8: "Singapore moves to phase two of its reopening this Friday (June 19), as a range of restrictions will be eased (...)   - Face-to-face visits at nursing homes can also resume with precautionary measures in place. - All healthcare services and services for seniors, including traditional Chinese medicine (TCM), aesthetic services, eldercare services and senior activity centres, will gradually be allowed to reopen. - At all times, people should continue to adhere to safe distancing guidelines and keep a distance of 1m from others when they are out, the Ministry of Health (MOH) said."  Source: http://web.archive.org/web/20201231165045/https://www.straitstimes.com/singapore/coronavirus-spore-to-start-phase-2-reopening-on-june-19-dining-in-public-social-gatherings  "Although visitors have been allowed, measures are in place to reduce the risk of transmission. MOH on Wednesday released guidelines for nursing home visits, limiting them to half an hour, and each resident to one visitor a day. Residents are allowed up to two designated visitors.  The ministry also encouraged nursing homes to schedule appointments for visiting, and to take additional precautions such as a dedicated visitation area."  http://web.archive.org/web/20210117191828/https://www.straitstimes.com/singapore/health/coronavirus-nursing-homes-adjust-to-ban-on-visitors
notes_C2: Quote: ""We are asking the various companies to put in place the various measures and they will start to prepare now...As soon as they are ready by 12 May, they can resume work," Minister of Trade and Industry Chan Chun Sing said at a virtual press conference on Sunday." "We will not be able to open some of the social entertainment outlets, but we are focused on our manufacturing capacities and production capabilities," he said.  http://web.archive.org/web/20210117171016/https://english.kyodonews.net/news/2020/05/bf158de5d991-singapore-to-ease-lockdown-let-businesses-reopen-from-may-12.html
notes_C4: ***Recoded from 2G to 4G; was previously coded in relation to public event size rather than private gatherings     See previous coding note:   "As Singapore has made good progress to support a further resumption of activities, the Multi-Ministry Taskforce (MTF) will start Phase 3 of re-opening from 28 Dec 2020. (…)    - Group size for gatherings will be increased from 5 to 8 persons: 	Up to 8 persons for social gatherings and household visitors at any point in time”  - Total of 10 persons for marriage soleminsations + up to 8 visitors allowed”  -worship services allowed up to 250 people    Source: http://web.archive.org/web/20201231155002/https://www.gov.sg/article/moving-into-phase-3-of-re-opening-on-28-dec-2020
notes_H7: A; C   Policy update: "The first day of COVID-19 vaccination for our seniors aged 70 years old and above commenced on 27 January with two pilots at the Ang Mo Kio and Tanjong Pagar towns, which is home to a larger number of our elderly." Source: http://web.archive.org/web/20210130223217/https://www.moh.gov.sg/news-highlights/details/update-on-covid-19-vaccination-programme  ***updated to include properly archived link and groups
notes_H3: In update to public, Singapore MOH lays out strategy once case is confirmed:"Once a case is confirmed, contact tracing will be initiated, and we will implement strict isolation, quarantine, and infection control and prevention measures to prevent further transmission." Since this is clear indication of a contract tracing policy in place, coded as start date; https://web.archive.org/web/20200527191250/https://www.moh.gov.sg/news-highlights/details/moh-steps-up-precautionary-measures-in-response-to-increase-in-cases-of-novel-coronavirus-pneumonia-in-wuhan

name: Sierra Leone
notes_H1: Since April 2, the government activated the Public Health Emergency Operations Center and developed a national COVID-19 preparedness plan, which focuses primarily on strengthening surveillance at the three official points of entry, improving case management, and conducting effective campaigns at the national, subnational and community levels. See: https://web.archive.org/save/https://www.worldbank.org/en/news/press-release/2020/04/02/sierra-leone-to-receive-75-million-for-covid-19-response
notes_H2: Sierra Leone has managed to expand the number of testings to 1,000 per day (against 100 when the virus first entered the country in March 2020). See: https://web.archive.org/web/20210322170743/https://statehouse.gov.sl/sierra-leones-president-julius-maada-bio-engages-development-partners-diplomatic-community-on-covid-19-vaccination-rollout-strategies/
notes_C7: After re-introducing restrictions on internal movements on January 25th for a two-week period, all measures regarding internal movements are lifted. See: https://web.archive.org/web/20210322103045/https://www.imf.org/en/Topics/imf-and-covid19/Policy-Responses-to-COVID-19
notes_C1: (Oct 5) Schools began reopening on October 5th, following the plan set out by the Ministry of Education in the months prior. In addition to opening, they have revamped the guidelines for how schools operate.     https://web.archive.org/web/20201013204135if_/https://www.facebook.com/Ministry-of-Basic-and-Senior-Secondary-Education-SL-1410711375879238/photos/pcb.2807386509545044/2807386456211716    https://web.archive.org/web/20201013203922if_/https://www.facebook.com/Ministry-of-Basic-and-Senior-Secondary-Education-SL-1410711375879238    https://web.archive.org/web/20201013202834/https://twitter.com/PresidentBio/status/1313156601780502530    New School Outlines:  https://web.archive.org/web/20201013205427/https://mbsse.gov.sl/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/MBSSE-Summary-Guidelines.pdf    (Oct 24) No changes since re-opening on Oct 5 with masks, temperature checks, and distancing measures.     Guidelines: https://archive.fo/SplHg  Reopening announcement on Facebook: https://archive.fo/MhRqJ
notes_H6: Appears that masks were mandated by, at the earliest, April 22, with subsequent sources at the end of April/early May validating that. Recoded to reflect this.     https://web.archive.org/web/20201013191906/http://www.ayvnewspaper.com/index.php/2020/04/22/govt-makes-wear-face-mask-compulsory/    https://undp.medium.com/beating-covid-19-with-solidarity-ad5f8d4599cb    https://web.archive.org/web/20201013194524/https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2020/8/17/which-countries-have-made-wearing-face-masks-compulsory
notes_E2: No policy found   https://web.archive.org/web/20200830161445/https://www.imf.org/en/Topics/imf-and-covid19/Policy-Responses-to-COVID-19
notes_C3: Large public gatherings of over 100 people (e.g. concerts, sporting events) are prohibited.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210322142559/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/sierra-leone/coronavirus
notes_C6: Curfew lifted - "Government does not deem it necessary at this time to extend the State of Public Health Emergency. Accordingly, the curfew is lifted in its entirety.
