However, all other COVID-19 protocols and public health regulations and directives remain firmly in place".    https://web.archive.org/web/20210404142913/http://dhse.gov.sl/wp-content/uploads/2021/03/Public-Notice-Curfew-Lifted.pdf
notes_C8: Lungi International Airport opened on 22nd July. Passengers entering Sierra Leone have to have a negative covid-19 PCR test from 72 hours before entry.   "Health officials will collect temperature, basic health screening data, and seat number on  arrival. All passengers shall be subjected to a mandatory COVID-19 test upon arrival."    https://web.archive.org/web/20200806141739/https://www.afro.who.int/sites/default/files/2020-07/Sierra%20Leone%20Travel%20Advisory%20July%202020.pdf    https://web.archive.org/web/20200806141727/https://www.thesierraleonetelegraph.com/sierra-leones-lungi-international-airport-reopens-wednesday-22-july-says-president-bio/    https://web.archive.org/web/20200806141538/https://statehouse.gov.sl/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/Statement-by-His-Excellency-Dr-Julius-Maada-Bio-President-of-the-Republic-of-Sierra-Leone-at-the-Fourth-Press-Conference-on-Covid-19.-Freetown-State-House-23-June-2020.pdf
notes_H8: No evidence of a policy change. Elderly people over 70 are just prioritized for the phase 1 of vaccination.    http://web.archive.org/web/20210404141641/http://dhse.gov.sl/wp-content/uploads/2021/03/PUBLIC-NOTICE-COVID-19-VACCINES-ROLLOUT.pdf
notes_C2: On January 25, authorities slammed a ban on nightclub activities, and all restaurants and bars were banned from operating during weekends.  Link: https://archive.vn/FPbYI
notes_C4: No evidence of a policy change.     https://web.archive.org/web/20210322142559/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/sierra-leone/coronavirus
notes_H7: Vaccination campaign was extended to groups A, B, C with a priority for "Healthcare Workers, Political Leaders, Social Workers, Teachers and lecturers, Military, Police, Customs and Immigrations workers including Sea Ports and Airports, Prison Officers, Fire Force Officers, People over 70". See: https://web.archive.org/web/20210322170743/https://statehouse.gov.sl/sierra-leones-president-julius-maada-bio-engages-development-partners-diplomatic-community-on-covid-19-vaccination-rollout-strategies/
notes_H3: No further mention of contact tracing except for the previous UNICEF report: https://web.archive.org/web/20210103115057/https://reliefweb.int/report/sierra-leone/unicef-sierra-leone-covid-19-situation-report-no-11-1-30-november-2020#main
notes_C5: As of a recent update on the US embassy website, the government has imposed restrictions on the number of passengers traveling by public transportation. See: https://web.archive.org/web/20201123092033/https://lr.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/

name: El Salvador
notes_H1: Social Media awareness campaign started. [https://web.archive.org/web/20200514123506/https://www.facebook.com/salud.sv/photos/a.999439960078450/2894128407276253/?type=3&theater=] https://www.facebook.com/salud.sv/photos/a.999439960078450/2894128407276253/?type=3&theater
notes_H2: Diagnostic booths carry out COVID-19 tests on citizens.  "Some 40 COVID-19 detection tests were carried out in one of the two Diagnostic Booths that traveled to the Government Center, on the outskirts of the Legislative Assembly, this Friday, April 24. [...] The examination is free for the entire population, which could detect a greater number of positive cases. 'We are ready as long as the pandemic lasts. We hope to reach more remote places to make more samples,' added Rodríguez."    [https://web.archive.org/web/20200514140439/https://www.elsalvador.com/noticias/nacional/covid-19-prueba-pandemia-cabina-salud/708854/2020/]
notes_C7: Possible movement restrictions of indeterminate duration in and out of municipalities with high positivity rates might be in place. Outside these municipalities there are no restrictions. "The Salvadoran Ministry of Health can place municipalities under special quarantine with little or no prior notice when a high number of COVID-19 cases is detected."    Source: http://web.archive.org/web/20201010100434/https://sv.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_C1: On March 11,  the president of El Salvador ordered the suspension of schools for 21 days: https://web.archive.org/web/20200514111857/https://www.mined.gob.sv/noticias/item/1015483-el-ministerio-de-educacion-informa-a-la-poblacion-en-general.html  On March 21, the Executive Branch ordered national quarantine for the following 30 days with very few exceptions. The decree may be found here: https://web.archive.org/web/20200514112011/https://www.diariooficial.gob.sv/diarios/do-2020/03-marzo/21-03-2020.pdf  On April 10, guidelines on remote teaching were issued by the Ministry of Education: https://web.archive.org/web/20200514112030/http://www.mined.gob.sv/jdownloads/Circulares%20Institucionales/Circulares%202020/CIRCULAR%209-2020.pdf
notes_H6: Anyone exiting their house must wear facial coverings    https://web.archive.org/web/20210207035443/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/el-salvador/coronavirus
notes_E2: 3-month deferral of utility payments; 3-month extension for income tax payments for taxpayers operating in the tourism sector;  taxpayers operating in the electricity and telecommunication provision sectors, and all taxpayers with a tax obligation below US$ 10,000; 3-month exemption from the special tourism tax for companies operating in the tourism industry. https://web.archive.org/web/20200516104204/https://www.imf.org/en/Topics/imf-and-covid19/Policy-Responses-to-COVID-19
notes_E1: Since April 1, the government has granted a one-time US$ 300 subsidy to certain households with necessities to purchase food. The support replaces less than 50% of the lost salary. The support is not limited to formal workers. Here’s the links:  http://web.archive.org/web/20200429213135/https://www.presidencia.gob.sv/presidente-nayib-bukele-confirma-la-entrega-del-subsidio-de-300-a-750000-familias/  http://web.archive.org/save/https://recursos.elsalvador.com/documentos/2020/04/ABANSA.pdf
notes_C3: 19th September 2020 onward, PHASE 4: El Salvador APPROACHING THE NEW NORMALITY (Saturday, September 19 to Saturday, October 3, 2020), Shows and public sporting events open.    https://web.archive.org/web/20200929044116/https://www.lexology.com/library/detail.aspx?g=a3c98387-9415-4a9f-9452-c91e1223adb6
notes_C6: No concrete measures could be found.   Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20210320184103/https://sv.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_C8: Travellers having visited the UK or South Africa in the past 30 days are banned from entering the country, unless they are of Salvadoran citizenship   https://web.archive.org/web/20210208224147/https://sv.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_H8: The elderly should not work and should remain at home.   https://web.archive.org/web/20210208232451/https://covid19.gob.sv/medidas-y-acciones-ante-el-covid-19/
notes_C2: The "new normality" is in place in El Salvador since August 24, and it involves the reopening of restaurants, malls and public transportation. Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20200908050613/https://www.infobae.com/america/agencias/2020/08/25/tras-estricta-cuarentena-el-salvador-se-acerca-a-normalidad/
notes_C4: Gatherings are discouraged, no formal changes found   https://web.archive.org/web/20210207035443/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/el-salvador/coronavirus
notes_H7: With the new shipment of vaccines, El Salvador will have enough vaccines to vaccinate ll senior citizens and people with chronic illnesses, as well as medical staff, emergency services and armed forces personnel, law enforcement officials, teachers and journalists  https://web.archive.org/web/20210329005859/https://www.wionews.com/world/el-salvador-acquires-two-million-covid-19-vaccines-from-china-373840
notes_H3: no indication of contact tracing anywhere.
notes_C5: Public transportation is operating and available to the public. Taxis and other private transportation companies are also operating normally. The Government of El-Salvador recommends wearing a mask at all times.    Source: http://web.archive.org/web/20201010100434/https://sv.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/

name: San Marino
notes_H1: Covid-19 hotline active since February 25. Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20200226181438/https://www.sanmarinortv.sm/news/italia-c7/coronavirus-anziani-vittime-del-virus-e-degli-sciacalli-e-r-attiva-numero-verde-a184161 // Official information also available in  http://web.archive.org/web/20200606125109/http://www.iss.sm/on-line/home.html
notes_H2: voluntary testing is suspended to give priority to contact tracing  https://web.archive.org/web/20210110184644/http://www.iss.sm/on-line/home/documento49121874.html
notes_C7: internal movement is possible with some restrictions  https://web.archive.org/web/20210110184644/http://www.iss.sm/on-line/home/documento49121874.html
notes_C1: schools reopen after christmas break, high schools still on virtual learning  https://web.archive.org/web/20210110184644/http://www.iss.sm/on-line/home/documento49121874.html
notes_H6: Policy:  It is compulsory to wear the mask properly, both outdoors and indoors, except when being alone or together with cohabitants.   Source:   https://web.archive.org/web/20210322151737/http://www.esteri.sm/on-line/en/home/right-banners/information-covid-19.html
notes_E2: The key measures approved by the government include: i) suspension of payment deadlines for government tax and non-tax obligations, utility bills, and other dues to provide liquidity to the private sector; ii) temporary freeze of all non-essential government spending and reduction in public sector wage bill to redirect spending to the health sector; and iii) extension of supplemental wage scheme to support workers displaced by COVID-19 containment measures; iv) deferral of income tax payment; v)minimum guaranteed income for poorer households; vi) other measures to support businesses, including tax credits, tax payments postponement and rescheduling. Source:  http://web.archive.org/web/20200729163904/https://www.imf.org/en/Topics/imf-and-covid19/Policy-Responses-to-COVID-19
notes_E1: "Viene introdotto, "dal 1° marzo 2020 e fino alla data di cessazione della emergenza sanitaria", il reddito minimo garantito per le famiglie, "già costituiti alla data del 1° marzo 2020, anche se composti da una persona sola, che si trovano in stato di difficoltà economica e con insufficienti mezzi di sostentamento". L'importo erogato alle famiglie bisognose sarà di 580 euro mensili per ogni nucleo familiare, maggiorato di 150 euro per il coniuge o per il convivente more uxorio o per il contraente l’unione civile, e di 50 euro per ogni altro convivente del nucleo familiare." Source: http://web.archive.org/web/20200606125817/http://www.libertas.sm/notizie/2020/04/22/san-marino-coronavirus-decreto-a-favore-di-imprese-operatori-lavoratori-e-famiglie.html
notes_C3: Theatres and cinemas remain open, and religious ceremonies, including weddings and funerals are allowed.  https://web.archive.org/web/20210222091520/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/san-marino/coronavirus
notes_C6: "Please note that a curfew is currently in force in the Republic of San Marino from 10 p.m. to 5 a.m. Internal travel within San Marino territory are allowed from 5 a.m. to 10 p.m. It is compulsory to wear the mask properly, both outdoors and indoors, except when being alone or together with cohabitants. The above obligation shall not apply to children under the age of six, people with forms of disability that are not compatible with the continuous use of the mask and people interacting with them. Plexiglass face shields and fabric masks are not allowed."    https://web.archive.org/web/20210314134809/http://www.esteri.sm/on-line/en/home/right-banners/information-covid-19.html
notes_C8: Entryinto the Republic of San Marino, for those who come from countries other than Italy and Vatican City, or who have stayed outside these two countries in the previous 14 days, is allowed against the presentation of a special certificate certifying the negativity to the coronavirus, through molecular buffer subposition in the 48 hours before entering the territory, or of a special certificate of anti-SARS-CoV-2 vaccination.  https://web.archive.org/web/20210201155314/http://www.esteri.sm/on-line/home/link/informazioni-per-chi-viaggia.html  https://web.archive.org/web/20210222091520/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/san-marino/coronavirus
notes_H8: since a curfew is in place at certain times of the day this applies to elderly people as well so coding as Narrow
notes_C2: "All visitors must comply with social distancing and sanitisation regulations. You will also be required to wear a face mask on public transport, in all indoor public spaces, and in outdoor spaces where it is not possible to maintain 1 metre social distancing.    Bars and restaurants remain open, but must close between the hours of midnight and 4:30am. Only six people may sit together at a table and it is not allowed to consume food standing at the bar.    Theatres and cinemas remain open, and religious ceremonies, including weddings and funerals are allowed."    https://web.archive.org/web/20210314135206/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/san-marino/coronavirus
notes_C4: max 6 persons for private gatherings
notes_H7: A, C  https://web.archive.org/web/20210304025916/https://www.politico.eu/article/from-russia-with-love-san-marino-starts-vaccinating-with-sputnik-jab/  https://web.archive.org/web/20210302221416/https://www.euractiv.com/section/global-europe/news/san-marino-turns-to-russias-sputnik-v-coronavirus-vaccine/  Pfizer(15%) and Sputnik(85%)  https://web.archive.org/web/20210405122319/https://www.washingtonpost.com/world/interactive/2021/sanmarino-covid-vaccine-sputnik/
notes_H3: "In San Marino there is an event-based surveillance system in place and the country has the ability to quickly enhance current surveillance (this enhancement is in place for Covid-19) and the specific case and contact definitions and other criteria for investigation have been added to the system." Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20200507173122/https://www.covid19healthsystem.org/countries/sanmarino/livinghit.aspx?Section=1.3%20Isolation%20and%20quarantine&Type=Chapter
notes_C5: Public transportation has been restablished on May 4. Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20200517044419/https://www.sanmarinortv.sm/news/comunicati-c9/start-romagna-da-lunedi-via-alla-fase-2-del-trasporto-pubblico-locale-in-romagna-a187741

name: Somalia
notes_H1: The Somali health minister on Monday has warned that the COVID-19 situation in the Horn of African country is "dire" and called for strict adherence to health measures in fighting the disease.    Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20210308161949/https://www.aa.com.tr/en/africa/somali-government-warns-covid-19-situation-is-dire/2160417
notes_H2: No Update in Policy   http://web.archive.org/web/20210322132246/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/somalia/coronavirus
notes_C7: No information to suggest a change in policy.
notes_C1: "Somalia Monday [22/02/21] closed all schools and universities for two weeks as COVID-19 infections rise in the Horn of Africa nation."    Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20210228123108/https://www.aa.com.tr/en/latest-on-coronavirus-outbreak/covid-19-schools-shut-for-2-weeks-in-somalia/2153590
notes_H6: Somalia on Monday [1st March] made the face masks mandatory after rise in COVID-19 cases amid a deadlier second wave.  Omar Mohamud Mohamed Filish, mayor of Mogadishu, the largest and most populated city in the country, announced the use of face masks in all public places mandatory amid the rising numbers of coronavirus cases and deaths.    Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20210308152335/https://www.aa.com.tr/en/africa/somalia-deadlier-2nd-wave-makes-face-masks-mandatory/2160893
notes_E2: No Evidence of Policy Change.   https://archive.vn/A0Avx
notes_C3: No indication of policy change.   http://web.archive.org/web/20210322120805/https://www.aa.com.tr/en/latest-on-coronavirus-outbreak/covid-19-schools-shut-for-2-weeks-in-somalia/2153590  http://web.archive.org/web/20210322114336/https://sunatimes.com/articles/6221/Thousands-died-Covid-19-in-Somalia-and-deteriorating
notes_C6: No Evidence of any measures found.    http://web.archive.org/web/20210322120805/https://www.aa.com.tr/en/latest-on-coronavirus-outbreak/covid-19-schools-shut-for-2-weeks-in-somalia/2153590  http://web.archive.org/web/20210322132246/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/somalia/coronavirus  http://web.archive.org/web/20210322132246/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/somalia/coronavirus
notes_C8: COVID-19 tests are required for incoming passengers. Travelers who do not carry a COVID-19 negative test certificate taken within 96 hours must quarantine for 14 days after arrival in Somalia.  https://archive.vn/v7LZw
notes_H8: No policy identified.
notes_C2: Hotels, restaurants, bars, and businesses are generally open but subject to strict hygiene and social distancing measures.  https://archive.vn/SZnnl
notes_C4: "The government has banned public gatherings citing the pandemic"  Can't find information on the number of people. Take this to mean gatherings in this size range are banned.    Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20210228121759/https://www.independent.co.uk/news/as-somalias-covid19-cases-surge-a-variant-is-suspected-somalia-covid-patients-people-coronavirus-b1807811.html
notes_H7: On 16, March Somalia launched COVID-19 vaccinations with the inoculation of the health minister, who received the jab publicly to reassure the nation about its safety.  http://web.archive.org/web/20210322114104/https://apnews.com/article/health-coronavirus-pandemic-africa-somalia-mogadishu-70e212ea29773a745b51c18e5de251b6
notes_H3: According to the US embassy website, Somali authorities have established a quarantine unit at Aden Adde International Airport (AAIA) in Mogadishu to isolate passengers who demonstrate symptoms of coronavirus.  http://web.archive.org/web/20200829182419/https://so.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/

name: Serbia
notes_H1: Government launches Coronavirus website: https://covid19.rs/
notes_H2: Citizens can schedule tests via official website.   http://web.archive.org/web/20210406190108/https://rs.usembassy.gov/serbia-covid-19-information/
notes_C7: Proposed to change coding to 0 - no evidence of limitation of internal movement found.    http://web.archive.org/web/20210315131251/https://rs.usembassy.gov/serbia-covid-19-information/
notes_C1: All levels of schools are closed while teaching resumes online until further notice.   http://web.archive.org/web/20210406185018/https://en.unesco.org/covid19/educationresponse
notes_H6: "The use of face coverings is required in all indoor locations, as well as outdoors when required physical distancing is not possible, for example waiting in line to enter stores or at bus stops.  Face coverings are recommended elsewhere outdoors."    http://web.archive.org/web/20200921080116/https://rs.usembassy.gov/serbia-covid-19-information/
notes_E2: The Minister of Finance announced the deferral of payment of payroll taxes and contributions for all private companies during the state of emergency, and for a minimum of three months, deferral of payment of income tax for the second quarter of 2020 and exemption from VAT for all those who donate and deal with donations. Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20200501000306/https://www.srbija.gov.rs/vest/en/152964/state-sets-aside-51b-to-mitigate-coronavirus-economic-blow.php
notes_E1: The Government of the Republic of Serbia launched the second aid package on 30 July. 'This package includes the payment of 60 percent of the minimum wage twice , as well as the postponement of taxes and contributions on wages for one month, and it is worth 66 billion dinars [c.667 million US$].' The benefits will be paid in two times, one by 10 August and another in September.    http://web.archive.org/web/20200806165949/https://www.srbija.gov.rs/vest/480712/usvojen-pravni-okvir-za-sprovodjenje-drugog-paketa-ekonomskih-mera.php
notes_C3: From 1st July, sports and entertainment events banned. https://web.archive.org/web/20200903125436/https://www.imf.org/en/Topics/imf-and-covid19/Policy-Responses-to-COVID-19
notes_C6: From 24 November, the Serbian government adopted new measures to suppress the epidemic caused by the COVID-19 infectious disease, whose implementation will begin on 24 November 2020. Including, but not limited to:  Strict control of the implementation of home isolation, house quarantine (self-isolation), as well as all other anti-epidemic measures in force.    https://web.archive.org/web/20201219200700/https://www.srbija.gov.rs/vest/en/163819/government-passes-new-anti-coronavirus-measures.php
notes_C8: I propose to code 1 - a negative PCR test is required for most foreginers (those non-vaccinated).   The exeptions are:  - people entering from North Macedonia, Albania, Hungary and Bulgaria, who do not require a negative PCR test before entering Serbia (according to US embassy website also Bosnia and Herzegovina, and Montenegro are in this category)  - foreign citizens with temporary or permanent residence in Serbia, who may enter without a negative PCR test and quarantine for 10 days.      http://web.archive.org/web/20210412184749/https://www.srbija.gov.rs/vest/en/170506/regime-of-entry-into-serbia-has-not-been-changed.php  http://web.archive.org/web/20210412173001/https://rs.usembassy.gov/serbia-covid-19-information/
notes_H8: From the 19 December US Embassy update:  - Visits to elder-care homes are limited to 15 minutes.    https://web.archive.org/web/20201219180525/https://rs.usembassy.gov/serbia-covid-19-information/
notes_C2: On July 1 in response to a new wave of infections, the government introduced new measures including limiting hours of operation for restaurants and bars; and closure of swimming pools, spa and wellness centres.   https://web.archive.org/web/20200903125436/https://www.imf.org/en/Topics/imf-and-covid19/Policy-Responses-to-COVID-19
notes_C4: No major changes    6-Nov - Ban on gathering of more than five persons introduced - the number of persons that can gather in an open and closed space reduced from 30 to five.    Link 1 - https://archive.fo/vfyta  Link 2 - https://web.archive.org/web/20201116224059/https://www.srbija.gov.rs/vest/en/163210/ban-on-gathering-of-more-than-five-persons-introduced.php
notes_H7: Sputnik V, Pfizer-BioNTech and Sinovac are used.  All people can registered for vaccination but not coded 5 since since the country does not have currently enough vaccines  (had 1,170,000 doses). Contracts have been signed for more than 6.5 million vaccines, and on February 1 and 2 more contracts will be signed according to the Prime minister, which will bring the total number of purchased vaccines to 11 million.    http://web.archive.org/web/20210201210655/https://www.srbija.gov.rs/vest/en/167043/serbia-has-vaccinated-438000-people.php
notes_H3: Predrag Kon (head of the Infectious Diseases Unit of the City Institute of Public Health and government spokesperson on epidemiology): "some parts of the health care system will be severely burdened simply because it is necessary to trace all those contacts. In this case, fortunately, because of his self-isolation and his independent decision to quarantine, we do not have such a huge number [of cases]"  -> This indicates the presence of comprehensive contact tracing for the first contact.  https://web.archive.org/web/20200407232501/https://balkaninsight.com/2020/03/06/serbia-confirms-first-case-of-coronavirus/
notes_C5: Intercity, urban and suburban bus and rail services have resumed as of 17/5.http://web.archive.org/web/20200521212855/https://rs.usembassy.gov/serbia-covid-19-information/

name: South Sudan
notes_H1: President Salva Kiir Addresses the Nation on COVID-19 (sharing prevention strategies with the public) Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20200601142549/https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Wm_x0scA4KI https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Wm_x0scA4KI
notes_H2: COVID-19 testing is available for those with symptoms in South Sudan, however it is limited due to a shortage of testing kits. Travelers arriving in South Sudan will receive a test if they exhibit active signs of COVID-19 infection. COVID-19 testing is available through the South Sudan Rapid Response Team by calling 6666 or by presenting to a health facility.  COVID-19 testing is available but limited for outbound international travelers who need a negative COVID-19 certificate for arrival to their destination. The John Garang Infectious Disease Unit in Juba has 250 tests for travelers available per day. Testing is available 7 days a week, 9:00 a.m.-2:00 p.m. Tests require pre-registration the day before the test is to be administered; pre-registration is done in person at 7am at the testing facility. Results are available 1-2 days after testing. Testing is free of charge.    https://web.archive.org/web/20201209215506/https://ss.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_C7: Travel in South Sudan  An official government curfew is in force across South Sudan from 10pm to 6am. There are also some restrictions on public transport and inter-state movements. Passengers are required to wear face masks.    Source: http://web.archive.org/web/20210322111929/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/south-sudan/coronavirus
notes_C1: Public places and services  Hotels are open to the public. Shops, restaurants and businesses are open but subject to strict social distancing, even if it is not consistently observed. Public rallies are not allowed, schools are partially closed, and public gatherings for funerals are limited to a maximum of 50 people.    Source: http://web.archive.org/web/20210111140748/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/south-sudan/coronavirus
notes_H6: Officials in South Sudan have issued orders to extend the ongoing partial lockdown through at least April 3 to curb the spread of COVID-19. Existing restrictions remain unchanged under the new directives. The following notable measures are in place through April 3:    Individuals must wear facemasks in public places. Penalties will apply for noncompliance.    All social and religious gatherings are banned until further notice.    All schools will remain closed, except classes scheduled for examinations.    Private and public sectors to make provisions allowing nonessential staff to stay home on paid leave or have staff on alternate shifts.    Public transport will operate at a maximum of 50-percent capacity.    Restaurants and cafes are open but are subject to strict hygiene and social distancing measures.    Bars and nightclubs will remain closed.    International TravelDomestic and international flights are operational. Incoming international travelers arriving at Juba International Airport (JUB) require South Sudan's National Taskforce permission before entering the country. Permitted travelers must present a negative COVID-19 test result from a screening taken within 96 hours before arriving in South Sudan. All incoming travelers are subject to a 14-day quarantine or self-isolation. Travelers and airline operators must adhere to preventive measures, including wearing protective facemasks and social distancing. All aircraft must undergo disinfection after arrival.    The nation's land borders have reopened; however, cross-border movement remains mostly limited due to neighboring countries' restrictions.    Authorities could reimpose, extend, further ease, or otherwise amend any restrictions with little-to-no notice depending on disease activity.      Source: http://web.archive.org/web/20210322113137/https://www.garda.com/crisis24/news-alerts/451216/south-sudan-authorities-extend-covid-19-related-partial-lockdown-through-april-3-update-10
notes_E1: 28 April policy change is incorrect as it reflects a World Bank policy. Therefore changing this indicator to 0.
notes_C3: There is a ban on these type of social gatherings including churches and mosques. Please see: https://web.archive.org/web/20210207234320/https://twitter.com/SouthSudanGov/status/1357052509458731009/photo/1
notes_C6: According to the government, non-essential workers should be give provision to stay at home by employers or work on a shift basis. Please see: https://web.archive.org/web/20210207234320/https://twitter.com/SouthSudanGov/status/1357052509458731009/photo/1
notes_C8: "All passengers, excepted as stated in the following bullet point, must possess a certified negative polymerise chain reaction (PCR) test certificate dated within 96 hours of arrival. Persons 6 years old and younger are exempt."    "Effective immediately, the Sudanese Civil Aviation Authority passengers who originate from or transit through the UK, South Africa, and the Netherlands must possess a certified negative polymerise chain reaction test certificated dated within 72 hours of arrival.  These passengers are subject to a mandatory 14-day home quarantine."    https://web.archive.org/web/20210118162213/https://sd.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_H8: none mentioned on sites
notes_C2: According to a tweet by the government, all businesses that require the presence of large crowds are closed like shisha parlors, clubs and nightclubs etc. Both public and private sector need to make provisions for non-essential workers to remain at home on paid leave or work rotational shifts. Please see: https://web.archive.org/web/20210207234320/https://twitter.com/SouthSudanGov/status/1357052509458731009/photo/1
notes_C4: According to the government, all social gatherings are banned including the churches and mosques. Please see:   https://web.archive.org/web/20210207234320/https://twitter.com/SouthSudanGov/status/1357052509458731009/photo/1
notes_H7: A, C:  https://archive.vn/FfNPW   The first phase of the vaccination is conducted in Central Equatoria State targeting health care workers as well as persons aged 65 years and older
notes_H3: There is contact tracing but it is limited.    Source: http://web.archive.org/web/20210322122509/https://moh.gov.ss/single_daily_report.php?report=March+20th+Update.pdf
notes_C5: According to the government, public transportation is reduced to half capacity for bus and taxi. For the Raksha; two passengers and the bodaboda to cargo transport or strictly one passenger as long as there is a mask. Please see: https://web.archive.org/web/20210207234320/https://twitter.com/SouthSudanGov/status/1357052509458731009/photo/1

name: Suriname
notes_H1: On Saturday, March 14, 2020, the government held a press conference that extensively discussed the latest state of affairs regarding the outbreak of the COVID 19 virus in our country. Every day at 6 p.m., the community can count on the latest news.  /web/20200510055526/https://covid-19.sr/corona-in-suriname/
notes_H2: From Suriname's epidemiologist speaking on 27 July:  "Doctor Ori says it is aiming to conduct mobile COVID-19 tests again this week. The RGD now also has mobile test units in eleven places. “The procedure there is somewhat different. The opportunity to step there and have yourself tested is not available now.”  http://archive.fo/10aH1    This indicates that testing is limited to symptomatic individuals, and therefore meets a coding of 2
notes_C7: There are no restrictions on intercity or interstate travel.    Source: http://web.archive.org/web/20200923123510/https://sr.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information
notes_C1: Schools remain closed since 1st April due to Easter Holiday anticipation. This closure is planned until 11th April.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210404080146/http://education.gov.sr/media/1333/bekendmaking-paasvakantie.pdf    https://web.archive.org/web/20210403230608/http://education.gov.sr/media/1329/bekendmaking-hervatting-onderwijsproces.pdf
notes_H6: It is mandatory to wear a face mask outside.  https://sr.usembassy.gov/health-alert-u-s-embassy-paramaribo-suriname-31/
notes_E2: On 9 April 2020, Suriname’s Minister of Finance issued an announcement with tax measures to alleviate the cash flow challenges faced by corporations and individuals due to COVID-19. The tax measures include:  1:Extension of tax return filing dates  2Based on the applicable Suriname tax legislation, any amount due and payable upon the filing of the preliminary tax returns for the year 2020, could be paid in four equal instalments on 15 April, 15 July, 15 October and 31 December 2020.  3:Taxpayers who are experiencing cash flow challenges because of COVID-19 can submit a substantiated request to the Tax Collector of Direct Taxes to qualify for a deferred payment arrangement  3:The statutory filing and payment due date for the turnover tax returns is the 16th of each month. Whereas, wage tax returns should be filed and any tax due should be paid by the 7th business day following the previous month. The tax authorities will be lenient with these filing and payment dates for the taxable periods of March, April, May and June 2020, provided the taxpayer submits a request for the postponement of the filing of the returns and payment of any wage tax or turnover tax due on these returns.  Link Lin:https://web.archive.org/web/20200611111255/https://www.ey.com/en_gl/tax-alerts/suriname-announces-tax-measures-to-mitigate-impact-of-covid-19
notes_E1: "Persons who have lost their jobs as a result of the COVID-19 pandemic are eligible for benefits or loans through the COVID-19 Emergency Fund to meet their most urgent needs." Persons fired by their employer, persons who have no / less work and income, persons who demonstrably have income problems as a result of COVID-19, persons where the company where they work is closed or partially closed due to COVID-19 measures and the turnover of the company has decreased significantly are all entitled to receive SRD 1.500 (USD 105.98) after approval by the Dismissal Committee.    https://archive.vn/7qalK  https://web.archive.org/web/20210404090105/https://covid-19.sr/uitkering-aan-werklozen-gestart/
notes_C3: he Government of Suriname has announced that it is instituting a “total” lockdown that will last from 1800 on Thursday, June 4, until 0600 hours on Friday, June 12. This means that all residents of the country should stay at home except for short trips for essential needs.  Linkhttps://web.archive.org/web/20200611101527/https://www.osac.gov/Content/Report/feb64421-b9e6-477b-9a97-18e1807ac1d7
notes_C6: A daily curfew, from 8pm to 5am, is still in place. It will remain in place until further announcement by the Government of Suriname.    Sources: http://web.archive.org/web/20200923123510/https://sr.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information  http://web.archive.org/web/20200923123650/https://sr.usembassy.gov/health-alert-u-s-embassy-paramaribo-suriname-35/
notes_C8: All international borders remain closed.   source: https://archive.vn/CivJf  "All commercial passenger flights are banned from entry, with only cargo flights and specially permitted repatriation flights allowed. Domestic flights are also restricted to cargo transport, repatriations, and emergency flights."  source:https://archive.vn/DlaJW
notes_H8: Curfew in place from 8 pm until 5 am daily. No additional measures for protecting the elderly or in long term care homes.  Source:  http://web.archive.org/web/20200923123510/https://sr.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_C2: Total lockdown ended on September 14.    Source: http://web.archive.org/web/20200923125829/https://sr.usembassy.gov/health-alert-u-s-embassy-paramaribo-suriname-37/
notes_C4: "Gathering: maximum 10 people. This also applies to funeral services"  https://web.archive.org/web/20210111204403/http://health.gov.sr/actueel/2020/overheid-verscherpt-covid-19-maatregelen/
notes_H7: A, B, C (AstraZeneca)  Ministry of Health article suggests that "senior citizens, frail older people and people over 40 with underlying conditions" are being vaccinated.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210321214149/http://health.gov.sr/actueel/2021/azp-en-bedrijven-voeren-covid-19-vaccinatiecampagne-uit/
notes_H3: You should immediately call number 178. Then the investigation process starts.  • Test material is taken from the patient (preferably at home) and then the material is tested to AZP and CL.  • If a person does not need extra care, home quarantine takes place for 14 days (possibly with surveillance), provided the test is positive.  • If a patient has complaints, that patient is taken to AZP (Paramaribo) or MMC (Nickerie). These clinics have trained personnel (SARI) in taking samples for the lab. And the patient is transferred to the quarantine unit.  • Housemates of the suspect case must also stay home under surveillance during the incubation period.  • Treatment must be done according to protocol.   /web/20200510170255/https://covid-19.sr/covid-19/
notes_C5: Public transportation is operating and taxis and buses are available.    Source: http://web.archive.org/web/20200923123510/https://sr.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information

name: Slovak Republic
notes_H1: Government started to regularly inform the public about the developments concerning coronavirus, based on the Facebook account of the Cabinet of PM https://www.facebook.com/UradVladySR/ In addition to the regular updates by the Ministry of Health since 27 January 2020 https://www.health.gov.sk/Clanky?stranka=8 http://web.archive.org/web/20200520114315/https://www.health.gov.sk/Clanky?stranka=8
notes_H2: "Once travelers register with the Regional Office of Public Health upon entry, they will receive information about where to get tested after their fifth day of home quarantine. The Slovak government pays for COVID-19 testing in these cases. Once they receive negative test results, free movement in Slovakia is permitted.  Private testing is also available at www.lab.online.sk or www.medirex.sk in various locations throughout the country. If not ordered by the Regional Public Health Authority or a medical provider, the fee for testing is paid by the traveler. The standard cost is €50-€60."    https://web.archive.org/web/20200914173717/https://sk.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_C7: On Wednesday, 17 March, 2021, the government extended the state of emergency for a further 40 days until April 28, 2021, with effect from March 20. At the same time, on the basis of the recommendations of the Pandemic Commission, it modified the exceptions to the curfew.  Main changes:  From Saturday 20 March there is a ban on traveling abroad for recreation, both individual and group.  Exceptions to the curfew included pathways for medical and pharmaceutical undergraduates to teach.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210327183934/https://www.minv.sk/?tlacove-spravy=&sprava=aktualizovane-pravidla-a-vynimky-zo-zakazu-vychadzania-ucinne-od-soboty-20-marca  https://web.archive.org/web/20210327183038/https://www.health.gov.sk/Clanok?cpvod-19-17-03-2021-nudzovy-stav-zakony  https://web.archive.org/web/20210327180107/https://sk.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_C1: From 08 February, some schools decided to physically re-open, while others decided to stay with distance education.     https://web.archive.org/web/20210213192819/https://bratislavskykraj.sk/v-malackach-sa-skoly-otvarat-nebudu-pokracuju-v-distancnom-vzdelavani/  https://web.archive.org/web/20210213192940/https://bratislavskykraj.sk/prezencne-vyucovanie-sa-obnovilo-na-styroch-zupnych-skolach/
notes_H6: The code was changed to 4T since the requirements on wearing a mask differ between the Warning II (pink) zone and Warning III (red)/Warning IV (black) zones. Slovak regions are in Warning II to Warning IV zones.     http://web.archive.org/web/20210301135619/https://sk.usembassy.gov/wp-content/uploads/sites/193/Feb-5-Traffic-Light-System.pdf
notes_E2: The government announced the possibility to defer mortgage and loan repayments by 1 to 9 months for sole proprietors, small and medium-sized companies  medium-sized companies. In addition it also announced an automatic postponement of the deadline for filing a tax return until the end of the month following the end of the pandemic period.    https://web.archive.org/web/20200518210520/https://korona.gov.sk/pomoc-zamestnancom/
notes_E1: According to the Budapest Business Journal, the Prime Minister announced 1.5 billion Euros per month to refund 80% of salaries received by people employed in facilities that have been obliged to close. Compensation will also be offered to the self-employed and employees depending on the drop in revenues of the affected businesses.    https://web.archive.org/web/20200518201927/https://bbj.hu/region/slovak-govt-drafts-first-aid-economic-package-due-to-coronavirus_180667
notes_C3: "A ban is imposed on organising mass sporting, cultural, entertainment, social events, or events of other nature with more than 50 attendees at one time. If the number of persons at the above events performing on the organiser’s behalf exceeds 50 persons (performers, athletes, sports event organisers, etc.), a mass event will be held without live audience.    In parallel, it is prohibited to:    organise mass, cultural, entertainment, social gatherings or gatherings of other nature (discotheques, dance events, etc.) in catering establishments (restaurants, bars, nightclubs, bars, etc.) and in accommodation facilities. The restriction does not apply to the regular provision of catering services in food establishments,  organise large social gatherings (wedding  receptions, celebrations, dance balls, funeral feasts, green ribbon parties of students, etc.)."    http://web.archive.org/web/20201013192040/https://korona.gov.sk/en/platne-hygienicke-opatrenia-okt-en/
notes_C6: "Slovakia will shut most of its schools and require the population to stay home apart from work, essential shopping and nature trips, in a partial lockdown to slow the spread of the coronavirus"  https://web.archive.org/web/20201029225257if_/https://www.reuters.com/article/idUSKBN2772PF
notes_C8: "Should you enter the territory of the Slovak Republic as of 1 September, 7:00 a.m., and:    You have visited an EU country not mentioned on the list of less-risky countries:  You are obliged to self-isolate,  If you have symptoms you are obliged to get tested for COVID-19 on the fifth day of your self-isolation at the latest,  If you are asymptomatic, your self-isolation is completed after your 10- day self-isolation period is over,  Self-isolation is also mandatory for persons living with you in a common household.  You have visited a country which is not an EU member and is not mentioned on the list of less-risky countries:  You are obliged to self-isolate  You are obliged to get tested for COVID-19 on the fifth day of self-isolation at the latest  Self-isolation is also mandatory for persons living with you in a common household."    https://web.archive.org/web/20200914174304/https://korona.gov.sk/en/travelling-to-slovakia-and-covid19/
notes_H8: Partial lockdown in place nationwide. Most non-essential are disallowed.  "CURFEW EXCEPTIONS:  from 01:00 AM to 05:00 AM,  on way to testing,  on way to work or while accompanying children to school,  on visit to the nearest grocery store,  on visit to a pharmacy or doctor,  while taking care for a loved one,  while taking care of your own livestock,  while walking of pets up to 100 metres from the place of residence,  while on a funeral,  on visit to the post office, to the bank, to the insurance company,  on way to the dry cleaners  on way to the auto mechanic, to the gas station,  while staying in nature (in the district of residence),  upon arrival at the place of residence by 25 October 2020."    http://web.archive.org/web/20201101113201/https://www.visitbratislava.com/covid19-news/
notes_C2: "Following the nationwide testing and curfew, the pandemic commission decided on lifting some measures that were imposed to fight the coronavirus.      As a result, cinemas, theatres and churches were open on November 16, while some sports competitions were given a green light, although without spectators. On the other hand, restaurants, hotels and also schools remain closed for now."    Source: The Slovak Spectator, an independent English-language newspaper     http://web.archive.org/web/20201130220822/https://spectator.sme.sk/c/22536069/coronavirus-in-slovakia-measures-in-place-after-november-16.html
notes_C4: 1 January 2021     From January the 1st, under the partial lockdown restrictions, family units are not allowed to mix with others from outside of the household.   https://web.archive.org/web/20210118155140/https://sk.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/     Due to the rising number of COVID-19 cases people were no longer allowed to form bubbles after 1 January 2021. While the decree that sets out the rules for movement and gatherings since 1 January does not explicitly ban gatherings. The rules governing the movement of people are strict and make it nearly impossible for people to gather without breaking any of the movement restrictions.   https://web.archive.org/web/20210125115028/https://www.slov-lex.sk/pravne-predpisy/SK/ZZ/2020/453/20201231      At the same time, the limit for people attending christenings, funerals and weddings remains at 6, see:     https://web.archive.org/web/20210114175952/http://www.minv.sk/swift_data/source/verejna_sprava/vestnik_vlady_sr_rok_2021/ciastka_2_2021.pdf
notes_H7: Update immunization policy is in place from 18 January – currently health care professionals and other workers in health care facilities are eligible + newly also old people in nursing homes. People from critical infrastructure will be moved to the list of replacements, meaning they will receive the vaccination only if there is unused vaccine or someone fails to attend.    In the second phase:  residents of senior's homes and people over 65, patients with serious diagnoses, such as diabetes, oncological diseases, auto-immune diseases, cardiovascular issues and other chronic diseases     In the third phase: people in communities with a high risk of fast coronavirus spread like teachers, people living in marginalised Roma communities, homeless people and asylum seekers    In the fourth phase: members of the general public older than 18     https://web.archive.org/web/20210118213749/https://spectator.sme.sk/c/22574807/vaccination-strategy-to-change.html
notes_C5: Local public transport is running normally in Slovakia, but face masks are required.    There is not an exact policy change occurring on this day, however, I didn't find the exact date in which public transport went back to normal operations in the country.    http://web.archive.org/web/20200806183129/https://sk.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/

name: Slovenia
notes_H1: COVID-19 Website  Link: https://www.gov.si/en/topics/coronavirus-disease-covid-19/    Coronavirus: Preparedness and measures in Slovenia and COVID-19 Helpline  Link: https://www.gov.si/en/topics/coronavirus-disease-covid-19/koronavirus-preparedness-and-measures-in-slovenia/    Coronavirus: Preventing infections  Link: https://www.gov.si/en/topics/coronavirus-disease-covid-19/coronavirus-preventing-infections/    Coronavirus: Symptoms of infection and treatment  Link: https://www.gov.si/en/topics/coronavirus-disease-covid-19/coronavirus-symptoms-of-infection-and-treatment/    Government measures  Link: https://www.gov.si/en/topics/coronavirus-disease-covid-19/government-measures/    Recommendations for washing hands cough etiquette  Link: https://www.gov.si/assets/vlada/Koronavirus-zbirno-infografike-vlada/Infografike/Anglescina/Recommendations-for-washing-hands-Cough-etiquette.pdf    Quotation: So far Slovenia has prepared hospital isolation rooms and urged citizens to be particularly careful with hygiene. Many hospitals have prohibited or limited visitations in recent days. (4th March 2020)  Link: https://www.reuters.com/article/us-health-coronavirus-slovenia-idUSKBN20R33X    COVID-19 Press Conference: Official updates on the occurrence of the coronavirus infection (7 March 2020)  Link: gov.si/en/news/2020-03-07-official-updates-on-the-occurrence-of-the-coronavirus-infection/    Latest information about coronavirus (Covid-19) in Slovenia (9 March 2020)  Link: https://www.gov.si/en/news/2020-03-09-latest-information-about-coronavirus-covid-19-in-slovenia/    Quotation: The National Institute of Public Health (NIJZ) has drafted a leaflet with key information about the coronavirus, which will be distributed to all Slovenian households via the Post of Slovenia (10 March 2020)  Link: https://www.gov.si/en/news/2020-03-10-measures-to-contain-the-spread-of-coronavirus-are-in-force/
notes_H2: Testing is available for both foreign nationals and Slovenians.  No appointment is required for the rapid antigen tests (RAT), and they are available throughout the country, including Ljubljana airport.  For the PCR test, available at the Ljubljana Clinical Center, an appointment is required, but is usually available within a day.  For foreign nationals, cost for RAT is 25-30 euro; cost for PCR is 93 euro.  Results for both tests will be provided to you electronically within 24 hours.     Link: https://archive.vn/QeWgS
notes_C7: Between April 1 and 11, the Prime Minister and the special governmental advisory group announced that due to a deteriorating epidemiological situation in the Republic of Slovenia, the Ordinance reintroduces restrictions on movement i.e. restriction of movement between statistical regions and at night, and prohibition of gatherings of people. Persons crossing a regional boundary must carry with them proof of the exception they are subject to and a signed and a legible statement. See Government of the Republic of Slovenia news website, archived: https://web.archive.org/web/20210329195424/https://www.gov.si/en/news/2021-03-28-slovenia-in-lockdown-from-1-april-to-11-april-2021/
notes_C1: Between April 1 and 11, the Prime Minister and the special governmental advisory group announced that kindergartens, primary and secondary schools, and universities will be closed with lessons implemented remotely. See Government of the Republic of Slovenia news website, archived: http://web.archive.org/web/20210405175855/https://www.gov.si/en/topics/coronavirus-disease-covid-19/
notes_H6: Masks or other forms of protection covering the mouth and nose, and disinfection are mandatory:  in all closed public spaces,  on public transport,  in open public spaces where it is not possible to stay two metres from other people.    https://web.archive.org/web/20201022191348/https://www.gov.si/en/topics/coronavirus-disease-covid-19/
notes_E2: As part of an economic stimulus package of € 1 billion (2.2 percent of GDP) announced on March 9, the authorities have adopted some tax and spending measures, including (i) tax deferrals for up to 24 months or tax payments in installments in 24 months; (ii) wage subsidies for suspended workers due to pandemic-related closures and quarantined people as at July 22 and before.   Source: http://web.archive.org/web/20200730012123/https://www.imf.org/en/Topics/imf-and-covid19/Policy-Responses-to-COVID-19
notes_E1: https://web.archive.org/web/20201019095117/https://www.covid19healthsystem.org/countries/slovenia/livinghit.aspx?Section=6.+Measures+in+other+sectors&Type=Chapter
notes_C3: On 19 March, the Slovenian government issued an ordinance prohibiting the movement and gathering of people in public places and areas in the Republic of Slovenia and access to public places and areas the Republic of Slovenia until further notice. There are exceptions for those going to work, grocery shopping, or being outside with members of the same household but a safe distances (1.5 meters) from other people.  Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20200427180655/https://www.gov.si/en/news/2020-03-19-ordinance-on-the-temporary-prohibition-of-public-gathering-at-public-meetings-and-public-events-and-other-events-in-public-places-in-the-republic-of-slovenia/
notes_C6: On October 20th, the Government of Slovenia announced a daily curfew from 21:00 until 06:00.  source: https://archive.vn/F0PTu
notes_C8: https://web.archive.org/web/20201019094355/https://www.garda.com/crisis24/news-alerts/380571/slovenia-authorities-to-tighten-covid-19-restrictions-nationwide-from-september-19-update-12
notes_H8: Partial lockdown introduced:  "Restrictions of movement  Under the Ordinance, for the purpose of prevention of the spread of the infectious disease known as COVID-19, movement is restricted between 9.00 p.m. and 6.00 a.m., except in the following cases:   averting imminent danger to health, life or property, travel to and from work and the performance of urgent work-related tasks, access to and provision of emergency services."  http://web.archive.org/web/20210318150356/https://www.gov.si/en/news/2020-10-19-prohibition-of-gatherings-of-more-than-six-people-and-restriction-of-movement-between-9-00-p-m-and-6-00-a-m/
notes_C2: Between April 1 and 11, the Prime Minister and the special governmental advisory group announced a temporary prohibition on the sale of goods and services to consumers in the Republic of Slovenia. The Ministry of Economic Development and Technology did include exceptions for essential services. See Government of the Republic of Slovenia news website, archived: https://web.archive.org/web/20210329195424/https://www.gov.si/en/news/2021-03-28-slovenia-in-lockdown-from-1-april-to-11-april-2021/
notes_C4: Regardless of the type of region, events, such as weddings, anniversaries, religious ceremonies and other events or gatherings are no longer allowed anywhere in Slovenia. The ordinance adopted today also restricts the gathering of people, which means that as of today not more than 6 persons are allowed to meet; the only exception applies to members of the same household if such has more than 6 family members.      https://web.archive.org/web/20201022190747/https://www.gov.si/en/news/2020-10-19-restriction-of-movement-between-statistical-regions-and-movement-at-night-and-gatherings-limited-to-no-more-than-6-people/
notes_H7: Pfizer/BionTech & Moderna & AstraZeneca vaccines     The vaccination of people older than 80 continues throughout the country today, including in Ljubljana and Ajdovšcina.    Vaccination is free for all citizens, regardless of whether they are insured or not. Funds for the purchase of vaccines and costs for vaccination are provided in the budget of the Republic of Slovenia.    5 Feb -  Slovenia started vaccinating the elderly in care homes first, as care homes recorded frequent outbreaks and suffered the most fatalities. Apart from the elderly, nursing home and hospital staff are also being vaccinated in Slovenia at the moment.    The country has also recently received the first batch of a vaccine developed by AstraZeneca, which is, however, recommended for a younger population.       Link: https://archive.vn/cwvre  https://archive.vn/OFLYU  https://archive.vn/hH21B
notes_H3: Contact tracing becomes limited from 9 October- see  https://web.archive.org/web/20210205103845/https://www.nijz.si/sl/spremenjen-protokol-sledenja-stikom-okuzenih-z-novim-koronavirusom-sars-cov-2    Also confirmed following email conversation with researchers from covid-19.sledilnik.org
notes_C5: Public transportation is operating. Passengers are required to wear masks on board.  source: https://archive.vn/sWC0N

name: Sweden
notes_H1: FAQ about COVID-19 (Link): https://www.folkhalsomyndigheten.se/the-public-health-agency-of-sweden/communicable-disease-control/covid-19/  Protect yourself and others from the spread of infection in different languages (Link): https://www.folkhalsomyndigheten.se/smittskydd-beredskap/utbrott/aktuella-utbrott/covid-19/skydda-dig-och-andra/information-pa-olika-sprak/
notes_H2: The Government announced that it would provide free testing for anyone showing coronavirus symptoms, and conduct contact tracing for those who are infected.   https://archive.vn/wip/LpKn5
notes_C7: In force from 14 December, the Public Health Agency replaced its regional advice with national regulations and general advice, in light of the upcoming Christmas holidays. This means that previous regional advice that explicit recommended against internal travel is no longer in force. I have not changed the code (only from T to G), because the new nation-wide advice, though less explicit compared to the regional advice, still seeks to limit travel incl travel between regions, e.g. "think through whether planned trips are really necessary to carry out".     https://web.archive.org/web/20201214164556/https://www.folkhalsomyndigheten.se/smittskydd-beredskap/utbrott/aktuella-utbrott/covid-19/skydda-dig-och-andra/jul-och-andra-hogtider/
notes_C1: ***Recoded to reflect that schools are open, with districts able to set their own limits or recommendations on capacity, distancing, staggering, etc.   On 25 March, it was announced that the Swedish Public Health Agency's national recommendation for partial distance education for upper secondary schools, which expires after 1 April, will not be extended.  http://web.archive.org/web/20210326105759/https://www.folkhalsomyndigheten.se/nyheter-och-press/nyhetsarkiv/2021/mars/ingen-forlangning-av-rekommendation-om-fjarr--och-distansundervisning-pa-gymnasiet/    Previous coding note:   The national recommendation for upper secondary schools (gymnasieskolor) to partially conduct their education as distance education has been lifted since 1 April. School principals can still decide to conduct distance education if necessary based on the local condition, which is why this is coded with a Targeted flag.    http://web.archive.org/web/20210409192707/https://www.skolverket.se/regler-och-ansvar/coronaviruset-och-covid-19---regler-for-skolor-och-forskolor/coronaviruset---fragor-och-svar-utifran-skollagstiftningen    The regions of Dalarna and Kalmar län decided to extend the recommendation for partial distance education.  - Dalarna (up until week 15, 16 April ): http://web.archive.org/web/20210409193043/https://www.regiondalarna.se/press/nyheter-och-pressmeddelanden/smittskydd-dalarna-rekommendation-om-fortsatt-distansundervisning-i-dalarna/  - Kalmar län (until 30 April): http://web.archive.org/web/20210409192958/https://www.regionkalmar.se/nyhetslista/rekommendation-om-distansundervisning2/    In Västra Götaland, for gymnasieskolor, to teach students on site at least 20% of the time, but only allow 1/3 of students at a time (until 18 April): http://web.archive.org/web/20210409192800/https://www.vgregion.se/aktuellt/nyhetslista/regionala-rekommendationer-forlangs-till-18-april/
notes_H6: In the region of Västra Götaland, from 17 February, disposable masks have to be worn on public transport at all times, not just during rush hours, as well as in situations where close contact, e.g. for extended periods of time in an indoor environment, is unavoidable.  Although this is still a mere recommendation, it is a much stronger one than the mask recommendation elsewhere in the country (limited to rush hours on public transport), so I have coded it as 2T to reflect the policy change as a result of which in practice, in this region, people will be wearing masks much more often than before.   https://web.archive.org/web/20210217212115/https://www.vgregion.se/aktuellt/nyhetslista/nya-regionala-rekommendationer-i-vastra-gotaland/  ***Updated to add note that policy language seems stronger than a recommendation
notes_E2: No change:  http://web.archive.org/web/20210409194349/https://www.forsakringskassan.se/english/the-coronavirus-covid-19---applicable-regulations
notes_E1: Quotation: "To reduce the risk of the virus spreading in society, the qualifying day for sick pay will be discontinued between 11 March and 31 May, in that central government will pay sickness benefit for the first day of sickness.    Central government will temporarily assume responsibility for sick pay for two months."  Link: https://www.government.se/press-releases/2020/03/crisis-package-for-swedish-businesses-and-jobs/
notes_C3: "The Government is making use of the possibility in the Public Order Act (Chapter 2, Section 15) to prohibit public gatherings and events if this is necessary to combat an epidemic. The prohibition is issued in an ordinance.    The ordinance means that, as of Thursday 12 March and until further notice, it is forbidden in the whole of Sweden to hold public gatherings and events with more than 500 participants.    The Government will continuously examine the need for this ordinance and it will be revoked when the prohibition is no longer needed.    Public gatherings include demonstrations, lectures, gatherings for religious practice, theatre performances, cinema screenings and concerts.    Public events include sporting events, dance performances, markets and fairs.    For a gathering to be considered public, it is necessary for it to have been arranged for the public or for the public to have access to it, or that the gathering should be regarded as equivalent to such a gathering given the conditions that apply for access to it.    For an event to be considered public, it is necessary for it to have been arranged for the public or for the public to have access to it."    Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20200322142423/https://www.government.se/articles/2020/03/ordinance-on-a-prohibition-against-holding-public-gatherings-and-events/
notes_C6: FT. As of 25 Mar.  "Swedish authorities have banned public gatherings of more than 500 people, closed universities and higher education colleges, and advised workers to stay at home if possible."     Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20200523152613/https://www.ft.com/content/31de03b8-6dbc-11ea-89df-41bea055720b
notes_C8: "In response to the European Council’s and the European Commission’s call for travel restrictions, the Government decided on 17 March to temporarily stop non-essential travel to Sweden from all countries except those in the EEA and Switzerland so as to mitigate the effects of the outbreak of the COVID-19 virus and reduce the spread of the disease.  The decision takes effect on 19 March and will initially apply for 30 days. This is an exceptional measure that will not apply for longer than necessary."  Source: http://web.archive.org/web/20201112160008/https://www.government.se/press-releases/2020/03/temporary-ban-on-travel-to-sweden-due-to-covid-19/
notes_H8: ***Updated to further explain code shift - Överkalix municipality had a ban on visits from 24 February 2021 to 9 March 2021. Ban is up so switch from 3T to 2G https://web.archive.org/web/20210226210115/https://www.folkhalsomyndigheten.se/smittskydd-beredskap/utbrott/aktuella-utbrott/covid-19/information-till-varden/personal-inom-aldreomsorg/lokala-besoksforbud-pa-aldreboenden/lista-pa-kommuner/  The general recommendations for visitors of elderly homes include:  - Do not visit if you have symptoms of covid-19, even mild symptoms. - Before the visit - talk to the staff about what applies to the specific nursing home. - During the visit - wash your hands, and even if the person you are visiting is vaccinated, you need to keep your distance from other residents, and also from the staff. http://web.archive.org/web/20210312201038/https://www.folkhalsomyndigheten.se/publicerat-material/publikationsarkiv/f/forebygg-smittspridning-av-covid-19-vid-besok-pa-sarskilda-boenden-for-aldre/
notes_C2: On 24 Nov, a new ban on public gatherings of over 8 people came into effect. This does not apply to most workplaces, but does affect some sectors to the point where they are required to close, such as amusement parks, markets and fairs. For theaters and cinemas, the official rule is that seated audiences of up to 300 are allowed as long as social distancing measures are adhered to, although the reality on the ground is much stricter as the regions have issued non-binding recommendations which extend the 8-people limit to seated audiences.     https://web.archive.org/web/20201130190632/https://www.krisinformation.se/en/hazards-and-risks/disasters-and-incidents/2020/official-information-on-the-new-coronavirus/restriktioner-och-forbud    https://web.archive.org/web/20201130190831/https://www.thelocal.se/20201123/no-public-events-for-more-than-8-people-in-sweden-including-seated-events
notes_C4: On 24 Nov, a new ban on public gatherings over 8 people came into effect. For private gatherings, people are "strongly recommended" to follow the regulations for public gatherings.     https://web.archive.org/web/20201130190632/https://www.krisinformation.se/en/hazards-and-risks/disasters-and-incidents/2020/official-information-on-the-new-coronavirus/restriktioner-och-forbud
notes_H7: A, C:    The first vaccinations took place on 27 December. The Public Health Agency has recommended different phases for the vaccination, according to the need for protection of respective groups. During Phase 1, which started on 27 December, elderly living in care homes or receive home care under the Social Services Act, staff working directly with these people, and adults living with someone belonging to this risk group are eligible. Phase 2 is expected to start in February 2021.         https://web.archive.org/web/20210104161641/https://www.folkhalsomyndigheten.se/nyheter-och-press/nyhetsarkiv/2020/december/vaccinationerna-i-sverige-har-inletts/    https://web.archive.org/web/20210104162056/https://www.folkhalsomyndigheten.se/smittskydd-beredskap/utbrott/aktuella-utbrott/covid-19/vaccination-mot-covid-19/rekommendationer-for-vaccination-mot-covid-19/
notes_H3: Report from 23 March suggest that Public Health Agency thinks that contact tracing would no longer be as effective and have shifted resources to focus on risk groups. The official government website as on 05 April stated that contact tracing is the responsibility of the doctors treating covid-19, and news sources indicated that some form of tracing was ongoing. Sources: 1. https://web.archive.org/web/20200406132606/https://www.thelocal.se/20200320/fact-check-has-sweden-stopped-testing-people-for-the-coronavirus 2. https://web.archive.org/web/20200406132712/https://www.thelocal.se/20200313/what-you-need-to-know-about-the-coronavirus-outbreak-in-sweden-your-questions-answered 3. https://web.archive.org/web/20200406132847/https://www.folkhalsomyndigheten.se/the-public-health-agency-of-sweden/communicable-disease-control/covid-19/  Other news reports seems to suggest that contact tracing has since been stopped as it is no longer considered effective or practical. However, this could not be verified officially.  Source:https://web.archive.org/web/20200423094726/https://www.thelocal.se/20200421/the-swedish-words-weve-learned-during-the-coronavirus-outbreak
notes_C5: "On April 1, Swedish Public Health Agency expanded guidance for individuals and organizations to comply with Sweden’s Law on the Prevention of the Spread of Infectious Diseases:  - Public transport companies should limit the number of passengers and adapt their schedules to avoid crowds."  Source: http://web.archive.org/web/20201112192626/https://se.usembassy.gov/covid-19-coronavirus-information/

name: Eswatini
notes_H1: Swazi government has a dedicated spokesperson, advisories, public info/guidance on COVID-19. Since the government does actually start messaging on Coronavirus after this day (e.g. https://web.archive.org/web/20200302152522/https:/twitter.com/EswatiniGovern1/status/1234481721447452672), 2 is maintained as coding; https://web.archive.org/web/20200229191745/https:/twitter.com/EswatiniGovern1/status/1233771535556579330
notes_H2: The Ministry of Health wishes to emphasize that the definition of a suspect case has  changed due to the fact that Eswatini has an established local transmission. This means all flu-like illnesses must be considered suspect cases of Coronavirus infection hence the public is encouraged to seek health care as soon as they can. https://web.archive.org/web/20200611234729/http://www.gov.sz/images/CORONA/Health-statement-5-May-COVID19.pdf
notes_C7: Temperature checks at road blocks between different zones and cities. Coded as such in accordance to examples in the coding interpretation guide, considered a non-intrusive check. Announcement about amendments to previous regulations, but with no changes to this policy.     See statement by the acting prime minister on 18 March:   https://web.archive.org/web/20210318113907/http://www.gov.sz/images/CORONA/APM-Statement-18-March-2021.pdf
notes_C1: School open, but with a rotational and blended approach. Specific levels allowed to go to school on specific days and given assignments to do while at home.     See statement by the acting prime minister on 18 March:   https://web.archive.org/web/20210318113907/http://www.gov.sz/images/CORONA/APM-Statement-18-March-2021.pdf
notes_H6: It is compulsory to wear a mask everywhere, even when travelling alone in a vehicle. There is a requirement for 1.5 metres of social distance with others.  https://web.archive.org/web/20210322080913/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/eswatini/coronavirus
notes_E2: Payment arrangements for taxpayers facing cash flow problems, waiver of penalties and interest for old tax debts. The price of fuel reduced twice and planned increases in water/electricity prices postponed.    See IMF's tracker for policy responses (https://archive.vn/hgyyZ).
notes_E1: Government is also continuing with compensatory relief to workers who suffered loss of earnings as a result of being laid off due to the devastating effects of COVID-19.  https://web.archive.org/web/20210228231850/https://translate.googleapis.com/translate_static/css/translateelement.css
notes_C3: Festive season sports tournaments are prohibited  https://web.archive.org/web/20201222133514/http://www.gov.sz/images/CORONA/december-legal.pdf
notes_C6: Curfew from 11PM to 4AM in place. Announcement about amendments to previous regulations, but with no changes to this policy.     See statement by the acting prime minister on 18 March:   https://web.archive.org/web/20210318113907/http://www.gov.sz/images/CORONA/APM-Statement-18-March-2021.pdf
notes_C8: Specific conditions must be met in order to enter Eswatini:    A COVID-19 test must be performed no more than 72 hours before departure and you must be able to demonstrate a negative test result on entry  Upon arriving in Eswatini, you will be screened for COVID-19 symptoms and asked about your country of origin and any transit stops  If you do not present a negative COVID-19 result on entry, or if you display COVID-19 symptoms, you will be required to take a COVID-19 test on arrival at your own cost  You may be required to undergo a quarantine period not exceeding 14 days, or isolation as advised by the port health officers  https://web.archive.org/web/20210104091520/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/eswatini/entry-requirements
notes_H8: Is a curfew in place? Yes. Non essential traveling between 8PM and 4AM is prohibited.  Are there restrictions on intercity or interstate travel? Yes. There are roadblocks between cities where temperatures are checked.  https://web.archive.org/web/2021022200.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_C2: As of August 28th, the July 3rd PM statement is still the most recent on the SZ gov website. Per that statement, as of July 13 Casinos, cinemas, gyms, health and beauty spas and auctioneers have been allowed to open subject to hygienic measures.     In further research, I could not find any evidence that other businesses are still closed.     http://web.archive.org/web/20200716175048/http://www.gov.sz/images/CORONA/PM-statement-3-July-2020-final.pdf
notes_C4: Some gatherings allowed: religious gatherings allowed, community gatherings allowed but restricted to 100 people in open spaces, re-opening of low-contact sports. All other gatherings remain banned. These include memorial services, night services and vigils, kufukama and parties, among others. Strict health measures to be enforced at all times, including mask-wearing and social distancing.    See statement by the acting prime minister on 18 March:   https://web.archive.org/web/20210318113907/http://www.gov.sz/images/CORONA/APM-Statement-18-March-2021.pdf
notes_H7: Rollout of COVID vaccination campaign. Currently in phase 1 of the programme, targeting frontline health workers (group A). The vaccine administered is AstraZeneca.     See a new report from the WHO, Eswatini:   https://web.archive.org/web/20210406111502/https://www.afro.who.int/news/eswatini-launches-nationwide-covid-19-vaccination-campaign
notes_H3: After April 23, statements from the ministry of health omit "contact tracing was initiated" from any updates (still present on the April 22) and together with the rising case numbers, it is likely an indication that comprehensive contact tracing may no longer be in place, though some form of contact tracing seems to be still in place. Since the comprehensive rating was based on that specific evidence, H3 is downgraded to 1 from here on out;    https://web.archive.org/web/20200611234220/http://www.gov.sz/images/CORONA/Press-Statement-Health-23-April-2020.pdf
notes_C5: Public transport open at 100% capacity, with strict adherence to COVID-19 protocols enforced.    See statement by the acting prime minister on 18 March:   https://web.archive.org/web/20210318113907/http://www.gov.sz/images/CORONA/APM-Statement-18-March-2021.pdf

name: Seychelles
notes_H1: https://web.archive.org/save/https://data.humdata.org/dataset/acaps-covid19-government-measures-dataset, General recommendations for social distancing and hygienic practices.
notes_H2: The test for COVID-19 is available in Seychelles. All tests for the virus are conducted in the Public Health Lab of the Seychelles Hospital by qualified health professionals according to set international standards.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210222131137/http://www.health.gov.sc/index.php/covid-19/faqs/
notes_C7: Locals are encouraged to work from home where possible; otherwise, they should only limit their travel to workplace and home locations.  https://web.archive.org/web/20210201215332/https://www.garda.com/crisis24/news-alerts/434776/seychelles-authorities-maintaining-updated-covid-19-measures-as-of-jan-26-update-13
notes_C1: State schools resumed in-person teaching sessions for the 2021 academic year as from  Monday 15th March 2021 with restrictions on the number of students allowed per session.     https://web.archive.org/web/20210322214120/http://www.education.gov.sc/aboutus/Documents/Resumption%202021.pdf
notes_H6: The wearing of protective facemasks remains compulsory in public spaces.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210322221340/https://www.garda.com/crisis24/news-alerts/452866/seychelles-authorities-maintaining-updated-covid-19-measures-as-of-march-9-update-14
notes_E2: The CBS also announced that commercial banks, the Development Bank of Seychelles (DBS) and the Seychelles Credit Union have agreed to consider a moratorium of six months on the repayment of principal and interest on loans to assist businesses in impacted sectors.    https://web.archive.org/web/20200608135237/https://www.imf.org/en/Topics/imf-and-covid19/Policy-Responses-to-COVID-19  https://www.cbs.sc/Downloads/covid19/PolicyMeasures/Press%20Conference%20Presentation%20-%20Private%20Sector%20Relief%20Scheme.pdf (Not archivable)
notes_E1: A scheme set up to help businesses affected by the COVID-19 pandemic will cater only for businesses directly connected to tourism for the months of February and March. Businesses falling under the new affirmative list are self catering establishments, hotels, restaurants, administrative and support services such as airlines, yacht charters, Destination Management Companies, tour guides, travel agents, musicians and artists, entertainment and recreation and transportation.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210222123545/https://mof.egov.sc/fa4jrsubmissions
notes_C3: House parties or gatherings which include any people from outside the household are not permitted.    Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20210222114557/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/seychelles/coronavirus
notes_C6: New guideline on 1st Mar: http://web.archive.org/web/20210314142029/http://www.health.gov.sc/index.php/2021/03/02/health-authorities-review-national-measures/  Additional resource from media: http://web.archive.org/web/20210314142225/http://www.seychellesnewsagency.com/articles/14433/Restaurants+can+re-open%2C+curfew+pushed+back+as+Seychelles+eases+COVID-+rules
notes_C8: New guideline for visitors  http://web.archive.org/web/20210314144837/http://tourism.gov.sc/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/Seychelles-Visitor-Travel-Advisory-4-March-2021.pdf    With immediate effect all visitors from any part of the world who have been vaccinated and are able to show  proof that they have taken the complete dose of the vaccine (the two doses) and that two weeks have elapsed  after the second dose will be allowed to enter Seychelles. However, they must provide a valid certificate of  vaccination authenticated by the local public health authorities from their country of origin and must also have  a negative PCR test taken 72 hours prior to travel. They will also be allowed free movement throughout their  stay in Seychelles.
notes_H8: Effective January 3 until January 13, workers will now work from home except for those in essential services. There is also a ban on visits to hospitals and elderly people's homes to see relatives. See: http://www.seychellesnewsagency.com/articles/14124/Seychelles+again+increases+measures+as+COVID+cases+rise%253B+movements+restricted [web archive unavailable, accessed 11 January 2021]
notes_C2: Public restaurants and bars outside of hotels or guesthouses will be closed.  Public swimming pools and gyms will be closed.  All retail stores will be closed except those providing essential services, including grocery stores (which will close at 6pm on weekdays and 3pm at weekends) and hardware stores (open from 8am–12 noon).    Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20210222114557/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/seychelles/coronavirus
notes_C4: From 23 January, visits outside the immediate household are banned, social gatherings are not permitted.  Link: https://archive.vn/cVoJE
notes_H7: No policy change.   A, B, C: Sinopharm and AZ.    Vaccination began in January. After those on the front line were vaccinated, the elderly were given priority. The shots are given in hospitals, clinics, pharmacies and some businesses. Now all residents can get inoculated, except for those under 18 years with the target of reaching herd immunity in the near future.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210322233149/https://apnews.com/article/seychelles-herd-immunity-mid-march-eba7c404b4530e9cc15d2e5dd1df6f58    https://web.archive.org/web/20210329142318/https://www.scmp.com/lifestyle/travel-leisure/article/3124000/seychelles-days-away-herd-immunity-after-coronavirus
notes_H3: Contact tracing and testing by the Seychellois authorities will begin on Monday 15 March. Members of the public are reassured that public health officials have begun contact tracing, the process of identification of all persons who may have come into contact with an infected person and, to continue to follow the guidelines advocated by the Department of Health.     https://web.archive.org/save/http://www.health.gov.sc/index.php/2020/03/16/seychelles-records-first-cases-of-covid-19/    https://web.archive.org/web/20200408225720/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/seychelles/coronavirus
