notes_E2: The Cabinet of Ministers of Ukraine adopted Resolution No. 247 “On the Provision of Housing Subsidies”, which provided for simplification of the procedure for granting housing subsidies and introduced additional compensation for utility costs. This decision significantly strengthens the program of housing subsidies and social support for the least protected categories of citizens:  https://web.archive.org/web/20200817102229/https://cis-legislation.com/document.fwx?rgn=123781
notes_E1: The amount of payments for persons receiving the minimum unemployment benefit without taking into account wages and length of service has been raised from UAH 650 to UAH 1,000 for the quarantine period. The Decree applies from the beginning of the quarantine announcement, ie from March 12, and will be valid for 30 calendar days after the quarantine ends: https://web.archive.org/web/20200430222447/https://www.kmu.gov.ua/news/minimalnu-dopomogu-po-bezrobittyu-pidvishcheno-z-650-grn-do-1000-grn-minekonomiki
notes_C3: From February 26, a red level of epidemic danger will be introduced in Ivano-Frankivsk region while restrictive measures will be intensified. At the red level, it is envisaged to introduce strict quarantine restrictions that were in force during the January lockdown. Including:  The activities of catering establishments will be prohibited (except for targeted delivery and takeaway service);  The work of shopping malls and other entertainment establishments – cinemas, theaters, etc. is prohibited.  Educational institutions will not work (except kindergartens and elementary schools);  Non-food markets and shops, gyms, swimming pools and fitness centers will be closed.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210227181512/https://www.kmu.gov.ua/en/news/premyer-ministr-rishennya-komisiyi-teb-ta-ns-maye-ne-dopustiti-podalshogo-poshirennya-covid-19-v-ivano-frankivskij-oblasti  https://web.archive.org/web/20210227182431/https://www.kmu.gov.ua/en/tag/ohorona-zdorovya  https://web.archive.org/web/20210227180512/https://ua.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_C6: President Zelenskyy stated in an address "I strongly recommend that all people stay home, except for the need to buy food or pharmaceuticals." This is a development from three days earlier in which only those over 60 were advised to stay home.     https://web.archive.org/web/20200407160742/https://www.president.gov.ua/en/news/zvernennya-glavi-derzhavi-shodo-protidiyi-koronavirusu-60181
notes_C8: From 24 March 2021, all non-exempt foreign nationals must provide a proof of a negative PCR test, taken no more than 72 hours in advance of their arrival in Ukraine.    http://web.archive.org/web/20210329200604/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/ukraine/entry-requirements
notes_H8: "Visits to care homes for older people and people with disabilities are prohibited (unless you are a family member)"    Source:  https://web.archive.org/web/20210104212108/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/ukraine/coronavirus    "visits by outsiders (except for legal representatives, family members, relatives, subject to compliance with all anti-epidemic measures, not more than once a week) institutions and institutions of social protection, in which temporarily or permanently reside / stay elderly citizens, veterans war and labor, persons with disabilities, persons with persistent intellectual or mental disabilities, institutions and institutions providing social services to families / persons in difficult life circumstances, except institutions and institutions providing social services in an emergency (crisis) ;"    Source:  https://web.archive.org/web/20201216120435/https://www.kmu.gov.ua/npas/pro-vstanovlennya-karantinu-ta-zaprovadzhennya-obmezhuvalnih-protiepidemichnih-zahodiv-1236-091220
notes_C2: Adaptive quarantine measures remain in place until 30 April at the country level.    From 20 March to 09 April, Kyiv has introduced further restrictions (similar to the “red” level of quarantine), which include:    - Closure of cinemas, theaters, museums, and other cultural establishments  - Closure of shopping malls and stores except for grocery stores, pharmacies, pet stores, shops selling hygiene products and household chemicals  - No religious services, public and sport events  - Limitation of restaurant, cafes, and catering establishments’ operations to “takeaway” mode only  - Beauty salons will operate by appointment only  - Spring break starts early in schools, kindergartens will continue to operate as usual  - Public transportation will work as usual – but with max 50% of seat occupancy    https://web.archive.org/web/20210320185538/https://www.kmu.gov.ua/en/news/premyer-ministr-misceva-vlada-maye-vsi-povnovazhennya-dlya-posilennya-karantinnih-obmezhen  https://web.archive.org/web/20210320185733/https://covid19.gov.ua/karantynni-zakhody  https://web.archive.org/web/20210320185346/https://www.kmu.gov.ua/en/timeline?type=posts&tag=Healthcare  https://web.archive.org/web/20210320183515/https://ua.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_C4: Code changed on 26 January 2021.  From 19 December 2020, new restrictions will apply throughout Ukraine.   Acc. to these new restrictions it is forbidden:  - Carrying out mass events (performances, holiday concerts) in educational institutions with the participation of children from more than one group/class and in the presence of visitors.  - Carrying out festive events, banquets, master classes, public events in public catering establishments and entertainment facilities.  - Reception of visitors in museums, exhibitions, galleries if there are more than 1 visitor per 10m2.  - Operation of public catering establishments from 22:00 to 7:00 (except for delivery of takeaway orders). Payment transactions are prohibited after 22:00. During the night of December 31– January 1 the work of restaurants and cafes will be allowed until 01:00.  - Conducting religious events indoors upon condition that there will be present more than 1 person per 5 square meters; religious events open-air not keeping the requirement of maintaining physical distance 1.5 meters between those present.    Further it is forbidden:  • Staying in transport and public places without a mask, being outside without documents. • Unauthorized leave of the observation place. • Carrying out of mass cultural, sports, social, advertising and other actions in which more than 20 persons take part and not preserving physical distance 1.5 meters between participants (with some exceptions). • Operation of cinemas and cultural facilities with more than 50% occupancy per hall. • Carriage of more passengers in passenger transport than the number of seats (except metro). • Work of discos, night clubs and operation of public catering establishments with the organization of leisure. • Not abiding the demand to preserve a physical distance of 2 meters between the tables and to place a maximum number of 4 people at one table. • The work of business entities in which employees are not provided with masks, no markings are applied to the distance of 1.5 meters between customers, and visitors not properly wearing personal protective equipment. • Crossing the border for foreigners without an existing insurance policy (with some exceptions). • Activities of accommodation facilities (except hotels). • Visiting by a group of more than 20 persons of educational institutions, except for preschool, general secondary, out-of-school and specialized education institutions. • Visiting preschool, general secondary, out-of-school, sports and art education institutions when more than 50% of students and staff of the educational institution stay in self-isolation. • Carrying out planned hospitalization (with exceptions). • Operation of gyms, fitness centers and museums, if they allow more than 1 person per 20 m2. • Visiting places of temporary detention of persons, places of temporary stay of foreigners and stateless persons, accommodation places for refugees. • Crossing the checkpoints with the temporarily occupied territories of separate areas of Donetsk and Luhansk regions (ORDLO) and Crimea by foreigners without an existing insurance policy (with some exceptions). • Visits to social protection institutions with the stay of persons of certain categories (persons of senior age, war veterans, people with disabilities, mental disorders, etc.).
notes_H7: A,B: In the first stage of vaccinations, those eligible for vaccines include people with an ultra-high risk of infection and severe course of the coronavirus disease of COVID-19, as well as those whose work is critically important in the context of a pandemic. Residents of boarding schools, nursing homes and staff of these institutions; participants of the Joint Forces Operation in eastern Ukraine will also be vaccinated.    Vaccines approved for use: Sinovac, AstraZeneca, Pfizer    Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20210320184350/https://moz.gov.ua/article/news/moz-dozvoliv-do-vikoristannja-v-ukraini-sche-odnu-vakcinu-proti-covid-19  https://web.archive.org/web/20210411224049/https://vaccination.covid19.gov.ua/
notes_H3: On 7 May the Parliament passed a law providing for large scale free obligatory testing of those who have symptoms, have been in contact with infected patients or are in at-risk groups (e.g. medical workers, police).     Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20200608203532/https://www.oecd.org/eurasia/competitiveness-programme/eastern-partners/COVID-19-CRISIS-IN-UKRAINE.pdf
notes_C5: From April 5 to at least April 16, access to public transport in red zones is limited to key workers with special passenger passes only.    Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20210104212108/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/ukraine/coronavirus

name: Uruguay
notes_H1: Website with al relevant information on coronavirus and what the government is doing:  /web/20200430214429/https://www.gub.uy/sistema-nacional-emergencias/comunicacion/noticias/informacion-interes-actualizada-sobre-coronavirus-covid-19-uruguay
notes_H2: Recoded from 1, as testing has actually been incredibly strong.     "Testing is so aggressive that Uruguay is fourth worldwide after New Zealand, Australia and Thailand in the number of tests conducted per new confirmed case. Uruguay conducts 1,610 tests per new case. By comparison, the US and UK conduct only 52 and 21 tests respectively."     "Instead of seeking out only the contacts of confirmed cases, Uruguay sends out special teams to test random city blocks and critical job sectors such as construction workers, carrying out more than 57,000 tests so far – approximately 1.6% of its population of 3.5 million."     https://web.archive.org/web/20200806112817/https://www.theguardian.com/world/2020/jun/25/uruguay-and-paraguay-buck-latin-america-coronavirus-trend
notes_C7: "The number of passengers in the interdepartmental transport units will be enforced by a maximum of 50% at times of increased mobility. The loss that companies may eventually have will be subsidized. The measure applies from 21 December to 10 January. (16/12/2020)"    https://web.archive.org/web/20210330051214/https://www.presidencia.gub.uy/comunicacion/comunicacionnoticias/medidas-gobierno-transporte-emergencia-sanitaria-covid19#navegacion-contenido
notes_C1: Since March 23, 2021: "Face-to-face education will be suspended at all levels of education until inclusive Tourism Week. The post-presence return will be progressive, starting with initial education."    https://web.archive.org/web/20210330050115/https://www.presidencia.gub.uy/comunicacion/comunicacionnoticias/medidas-gobierno-educacion-emergencia-sanitaria-covid19#navegacion-contenido
notes_H6: Mandatory for users and staff to wear a face covering on public transport, along with other safety measures.    https://web.archive.org/web/20200831120003/https://www.impo.com.uy/bases/resoluciones-mtop/SN20200603001-20200
notes_E2: - The government has postponed maturities of tax payments and credit programs.  - VAT payments have been deferred to be paid in 6 installments without interest.  - Social Security Bank loan quotas for retirees and pensioners have been deferred   /web/20200430214936/https://www.gub.uy/medidas-emergencia-sanitaria
notes_E1: Reinstating former indicator value based on the following statement:    UTE extends, by decision of 4 February 2021, the benefits granted by the pandemic, until 31 March this year. (5/2/2021)    https://archive.vn/pCasz  https://archive.vn/NT6MS
notes_C3: "This Wednesday government authorities announced at a press conference the decision to apply sanctions, according to the powers granted by current regulations for pandemic contexts, such as fines, closures and criminal complaints to those who violate health provisions.    In recent weeks, several unauthorized mass parties have been detected, which the government considers are the greatest risk ahead and put the transitory health status of the country at risk, stressed the Secretary of the Presidency, Álvaro Delgado.    “The Executive Power through the Ministry of Public Health and according to the legal mandate of the Organic Law of Public Health must adopt, immediately, before the violation of the sanitary provisions, all the measures at its disposal to keep the country harmless or reduce the risks of the effects of the pandemic ”, explained the prosecutor Rodrigo Ferrés.    The fines may range from 37 thousand pesos to one million three hundred thousand. The Executive Power may close establishments and file police and prosecutorial complaints in cases of contempt.    The Minister of Health, Daniel Salinas, explained why the risk of a massive adult party is different than that of a children's party protocolized by the Ministry and other activities that have been devised opening in recent times, such as restaurants, hotels, some shows, and also the Rural del Prado."    (Since not all shows have been authorized I have coded this indicator as 2G)    Source: http://web.archive.org/web/20201018230001/https://radiouruguay.uy/fiestas-no-autorizadas-se-aplicaran-multas-sanciones-y-denuncias-penales/
notes_C6: According to the government news, the president said that the Government "defends tooth and nail" not to establish a mandatory confinement of the population. "The 'stay at home' is worn out, everyone knows what they can do," said Lacalle Pou. "If people can stay at home, let them stay, but it is not mandatory," which indicates recommended but not required stay-at-home measure.   Source:  http://web.archive.org/web/20201217232814/https://www.presidencia.gub.uy/comunicacion/comunicacionnoticias/conferencia-prensa-luis-lacalle-pou-medidas-diciembre-covid
notes_C8: From December 21 to January 10, 2021, border will be closed, entry to the country will be suspended, except for Uruguayans who have purchased their ticket on December 16, and the transport of cargo.  Source:  http://web.archive.org/web/20201221025342/https://www.presidencia.gub.uy/comunicacion/comunicacionnoticias/larranaga-garcia-torre-ejecutiva-conferencia  http://web.archive.org/web/20201217232814/https://www.presidencia.gub.uy/comunicacion/comunicacionnoticias/conferencia-prensa-luis-lacalle-pou-medidas-diciembre-covid   http://web.archive.org/web/20201229065720/https://uy.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/  http://web.archive.org/web/20201020201228/https://www.presidencia.gub.uy/comunicacion/comunicacionnoticias/medidas-gobierno-exterior-emergencia-sanitaria-covid19
notes_H8: Changing value to 2. Some new protection measures announced:    Direct and permanent control of users and employees of nursing homes, by a commission made up of public and private health providers. (04/26/2020)  https://web.archive.org/web/20201202223646/https://www.presidencia.gub.uy/comunicacion/comunicacionnoticias/medidas-gobierno-sanitaria-emergencia-sanitaria-covid19#navegacion-contenido    Coordination of the inspection of long-stay centers for the elderly by the Ministries of Public Health and Social Development. (04/26/2020)  https://web.archive.org/web/20201202223646/https://www.presidencia.gub.uy/comunicacion/comunicacionnoticias/medidas-gobierno-sanitaria-emergencia-sanitaria-covid19#navegacion-contenido
notes_C2: Since March 23, 2021: "Public offices will be closed until 12 April, with the exception of essential services.   Teleworking in the public sector will be strengthened, and this practice in the private sector is encouraged. Telework for those over 65 in the public sector will be mandatory.  A bill will be developed to ensure that workers have the time to be vaccinated, without wage involvement."    https://web.archive.org/web/20210330045950/https://www.presidencia.gub.uy/comunicacion/comunicacionnoticias/medidas-gobierno-trabajo-emergencia-sanitaria-covid19#navegacion-contenido
notes_C4: A battery of strict measures to prevent an increase in COVID-19 infections take effect on December 21, including “private meetings may not exceed ten people”.  Source:  http://web.archive.org/web/20201217232814/https://www.presidencia.gub.uy/comunicacion/comunicacionnoticias/conferencia-prensa-luis-lacalle-pou-medidas-diciembre-covid  http://web.archive.org/web/20201228231706/https://www.presidencia.gub.uy/comunicacion/comunicacionnoticias/medidas-gobierno-Sanitaria-emergencia-sanitaria-covid19
notes_H7: Government opens vaccination to people between 18 and 70 years old during Tourism Week.  Open group for vaccination, with a capacity for about 170,000 people, who will be vaccinated on March 29, 30 and 31 and April 1 and 2.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210412171739/https://www.gub.uy/ministerio-salud-publica/comunicacion/noticias/gobierno-abre-vacunacion-personas-entre-18-70-anos-durante-semana-turismo  https://web.archive.org/web/20210412171919/https://www.gub.uy/ministerio-salud-publica/comunicacion/noticias/periodo-especial-vacunacion-18-70-anos  https://web.archive.org/web/20210322084002/https://www.gub.uy/ministerio-salud-publica/comunicacion/noticias/comunicado-sobre-plan-vacunacion-contra-covid-19
notes_H3: The Ministry of Public Health announced it would trace individuals coming from high risk areas. https://www.elpais.com.uy/informacion/politica/delgado-hay-casos-sospechosos-departamentos-aislamiento.html (Archived version: https://web.archive.org/web/20200417034706/https://www.elpais.com.uy/informacion/politica/delgado-hay-casos-sospechosos-departamentos-aislamiento.html)
notes_C5: Public transportation is open with masks and social distancing measures. To prevent the spread of COVID-19, the measure of limiting passenger capacity in interdepartmental transport units to 50% began to take effect from December 21 through January 10, 2021.   Source:  http://web.archive.org/web/20201229064206/https://www.presidencia.gub.uy/comunicacion/comunicacionnoticias/mtop-transporte-distancia-olaizola-protocolo  http://web.archive.org/web/20201217232814/https://www.presidencia.gub.uy/comunicacion/comunicacionnoticias/conferencia-prensa-luis-lacalle-pou-medidas-diciembre-covid  http://web.archive.org/web/20201229064449/https://www.presidencia.gub.uy/comunicacion/comunicacionnoticias/medidas-gobierno-transporte-emergencia-sanitaria-covid19

name: United States
notes_H1: The President's Coronavirus Guidelines for America https://web.archive.org/web/20200322010504/https://www.whitehouse.gov/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/03.16.20_coronavirus-guidance_8.5x11_315PM.pdf
notes_H2: First drive-through testing site introduced in New York    https://web.archive.org/save/https://www.pbs.org/newshour/show/new-york-launches-drive-thru-testing-site-for-covid-19    https://web.archive.org/save/https://www.pbs.org/newshour/show/new-york-launches-drive-thru-testing-site-for-covid-19
notes_C7: Travel restrictions vary from state to state. Some states have removed all statewide travel restrictions. Some states still recommend quarantine upon arrival from another state. Some states offer exemptions to those who are vaccinated or have a recent negative COVID test.    For example, Rhode Island requires travellers to the state to fill out a COVID-19 Travel Screening Form and failure to comply with quarantine can result in a $500 fine.     Could not find evidence for any states fully restricting entry from other states, so code changed to 1G to reflect quarantine/testing requirements of some states and CDC recommendations for travel.    Link to CNN article on travel restrictions by state (last updated 27 March 2021):  https://web.archive.org/web/20210329160222/https://www.cnn.com/travel/article/us-state-travel-restrictions-covid-19/index.html    Link to CDC travel guidelines:  https://archive.vn/XOhXC    Link to RI travel screening webpage:  https://web.archive.org/web/20210328065422/https://covid.ri.gov/travel-screening
notes_C1: "Kentucky public schools had to offer at least two days of in-person instruction each week starting March 29. The requirement was the result of HB 208, which Governor Andy Beshear signed on March 4... Parents could still keep their children in fully remote learning.  Oregon public elementary schools had to reopen no later than March 29 for hybrid or full-time in-person instruction. Parents could still keep their children in fully remote instruction."    https://web.archive.org/web/20210414231916/https://ballotpedia.org/School_responses_to_the_coronavirus_%28COVID-19%29_pandemic_during_the_2020-2021_academic_year
notes_H6: Governor Wolf in Pennsylvania:    Expanding on the business safety order signed by Secretary of Health Dr. Rachel Levine in April that requires the wearing of masks in businesses, Governor Tom Wolf today announced a new order signed by Dr. Levine that takes the mask-wearing directive one step further.    With this order, signed under Dr. Levine’s authority under the Disease Prevention and Control Act, masks must be worn whenever anyone leaves home. The order takes effect immediately.    https://web.archive.org/web/20200923054840/https://www.governor.pa.gov/newsroom/gov-wolf-sec-of-health-signs-expanded-mask-wearing-order/
notes_E2: CARES Act, signed into law on 27 March 2020, implemented targeted debt relief based on Federal jurisdiction (e.g. eviction freezes for federal housing programs, mortgage forbearance for federally-backed mortgages, etc.). Primary source (U.S. House of Representatives, Financial Services Committee, archived link: https://web.archive.org/web/20200430040220/https://financialservices.house.gov/news/documentsingle.aspx?DocumentID=406472    Debt/contract relief also implemented at state level (e.g. eviction freezes, rent increase freezes, utility bill late charge waivers, etc.), but case-specific and not captured in this coding scheme.
notes_E1: Unemployment insurance in the U.S. is state-specific, but overseen by the U.S. Dept. of Labor. On average, unemployment insurance replaces ~50% of lost wages for a finite period of time. The CARES Act, signed into law on 27 March 2020, boosted unemployment benefits by supplementing state benefits with $600 per week, and expanding eligibility to individuals that normally don't qualify for unemployment insurance (e.g. gig workers & independent contractors). Secondary source, archived: https://web.archive.org/web/20200430034950/https://www.cbpp.org/research/economy/policy-basics-unemployment-insurance    The CARES Act also established a low-interest, forgivable loan program for small businesses to help keep employees on payroll. Primary source, U.S. Small Business Administration, archived: https://web.archive.org/web/20200430035544/https://www.sba.gov/funding-programs/loans/coronavirus-relief-options/paycheck-protection-program
notes_C3: Many states continue to ease COVID-19 restrictions on public gatherings and are gradually allowing many public event venues to open with a specified percentage of original capacity. Code changed to 1G to reflect this.    Link to Husch-Blackwell state-by-state COVID-19 policies:  https://web.archive.org/web/20210329165030/https://www.huschblackwell.com/state-by-state-covid-19-guidance  Link to AARP article on state-by-state restrictions:  https://archive.vn/dKWcn
notes_C6: As of March 4th, no generally applicable curfews are in force. In at least one state (South Dakota) the elderly and other vulnerable individuals are encouraged to stay at home.     Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20210308020436/https://www.aarp.org/politics-society/government-elections/info-2020/coronavirus-state-restrictions.html
notes_C8: As of March 2, foreign nationals who have travelled to Iran within the past 14 days are denied permission to enter the US.  https://web.archive.org/web/20200410104600/https://edition.cnn.com/travel/article/coronavirus-travel-restrictions/
notes_H8: On March 13, CMS issued guidance that advised nursing homes to restrict visitors, helping prevent introduction of the virus into these facilities. CMS released a Guidance for Infection Control and Prevention of Coronavirus Disease 2019 (COVID-19) in Nursing Homes.   “Facilities should restrict visitation of all visitors and non-essential health care personnel (“HCP”), except for certain compassionate care situations, such as an end-of-life situation.” In end-of-life situations, visitors should be limited to a specific room. LTC Facilities are expected to convey these restrictions to potential visitors and advise they defer visitation until further notice. CMS also noted that if a state were to further limit visitation to apply even in end-of-life situations, a LTC Facilities’ compliance with the state requirement would not result in a citation for noncompliance with CMS’s visitation requirements.  Source - https://archive.vn/AbZ50    Refer to link for the CMS Guidance document. http://web.archive.org/web/20201216063424/https://www.cms.gov/files/document/qso-20-14-nh-revised.pdf
notes_C2: Many states are allowing businesses to reopen at specified capacity restrictions and/or closing-time restrictions. However, because no states seem to be requiring specific sectors to remain completely closed, the code has been changed to 1G. If evidence to the contrary is found, please change code.    Link to Husch-Blackwell state-by-state COVID-19 policies:  https://web.archive.org/web/20210329165030/https://www.huschblackwell.com/state-by-state-covid-19-guidance  Link to AARP article on state-by-state restrictions:  https://archive.vn/dKWcn
notes_C4: Alabama, Idaho, Indiana, Missouri and South Dakota allow gatherings of any size, while other states have very strict measures in place. The most restrictive are New Mexico with max 5 people and Oregon with max 6 people from max 2 households.     Overview (last updated Nov 17): http://web.archive.org/web/20201123193939/https://www.northstarmeetingsgroup.com/News/Industry/Coronavirus-states-cities-reopening-COVID-19-new-cases  New Mexico: http://web.archive.org/web/20201123192402/https://cv.nmhealth.org/public-health-orders-and-executive-orders/frequently-asked-questions/  Oregon: http://web.archive.org/web/20201123193338/https://govstatus.egov.com/OR-OHA-COVID-19
notes_H7: As of March 30, it appears that all states have expanded eligibility for vaccination to at least 3 groups. For example, as of March 22, all clinically vulnerable groups (age 16+) are now eligible for a vaccine in Wisconsin (Pfizer, Moderna, Johnson & Johnson vaccines are all in use). All Arkansans age 16 or older are now eligible to receive the vaccine. Starting March 30th, Minnesotans over the age of 15 can receive vaccines.     A report published on March 29 states that a "CDC study provides strong evidence that mRNA COVID-19 vaccines are highly effective in preventing SARS-CoV-2 infections in real-world conditions among health care personnel, first responders, and other essential workers.  These groups are more likely than the general population to be exposed to the virus because of their occupations." For more information on the study, see this archived link: https://web.archive.org/web/20210414011134/https://www.cdc.gov/media/releases/2021/p0329-COVID-19-Vaccines.html    https://archive.fo/fvFSA     link: https://web.archive.org/web/20210405211600/https://www.healthy.arkansas.gov/programs-services/topics/covid-19-vaccination-plan    https://web.archive.org/web/20210322212232/https://www.wbay.com/2021/03/16/wisconsin-pushes-up-medical-condition-covid-19-vaccine-eligibility-to-march-22/
notes_H3: "Contact tracing was used in Seattle and parts of California early on in their coronavirus outbreaks, but as community spread took hold, many cities and states switched to a "mitigation" approach, like closing schools and other social distancing measures." https://web.archive.org/web/20200414010434/https://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2020/04/10/831200054/cdc-director-very-aggressive-contact-tracing-needed-for-u-s-to-return-to-normal
notes_C5: Across the country, public transport is operating but at reduced capacity.   http://web.archive.org/web/20201123194911/https://time.com/5869375/public-transit-coronavirus-covid/

name: Uzbekistan
notes_H1: Government launched an official website with up-to-date information on fighting Coronavirus: https://web.archive.org/save/https://coronavirus.uz/ru
notes_H2: Individuals who are showing COVID-19 symptoms will undergo testing at government facilities. Link: https://archive.vn/aY9NS
notes_C7: From 15 August onwards, restrictions on movement between regions are lifted. See local news agency Gazeta website, archived: https://web.archive.org/web/20201112100715/https://www.gazeta.uz/ru/2020/08/10/quarantine/
notes_C1: From 11 January, schools and universities are open across the country. The government requires schools and universities to provide health protection to students. Moreover, the government allows continuing online learning for those students who belong to risk groups and have chronic diseases.  Links: https://archive.vn/D52gP https://archive.vn/IgGjB https://archive.vn/9l68x
notes_H6: Masks must be worn in public.  source:  https://archive.vn/eZ6Zt
notes_E2: Government assistance (e.g. Anti-Crisis fund) provided (since 2020 and continuing on into 2021) for several different areas including individual loan repayments.    ______________________________________________  Quote from linked article 1:  "Liquidity support   On 14 April 2020, the Central Bank of the Republic of Uzbekistan (the “Central Bank”) has reduced the refinancing rate from 16% to 15% to stimulate liquidity support for the economy due to financial crisis caused by the coronavirus pandemic.     Under the Decree 5978, the Central Bank has:   allowed the extension of loan repayments by individuals and individual entrepreneurs due in the next six months of 2020 valued at UZS 4.7 trillion (equivalent of USD 470 million)."    and    "the deadline for payment of property tax and land tax for individuals is extended until 15 October 2020;    Individuals have been granted the right to an interest-free deferral (installment plan) of tax payments, accrued on income from personal real estate leased to individuals and commercial real estate leased to businesses affected during the quarantine period, until 1 April 2021;"    Web archived link 1:  http://archive.today/2021.03.02-051226/https://www.whitecase.com/publications/alert/covid-19-uzbekistan-government-financial-assistance-measures  _______________________________________________________________________________    Quote from linked article 2:  "The authorities also temporary reduced social contributions for individual entrepreneurs, postponed the payment of property and land taxes, extended a moratorium on tax audits, and delayed tax declarations for 2019 income taxes. The central government also asked local governments to reduce taxes by 30 percent and provide a 6-month grace period on paying property tax."    Web archived link 2:  http://archive.today/2021.03.02-051441/https://www.imf.org/en/Topics/imf-and-covid19/Policy-Responses-to-COVID-19%23U
notes_E1: On 21 January, the law "On employment of the population" came into force. Accordingly, citizens who lost their jobs in the past 12 months are paid unemployment benefits in the amount of 50 percent of the average monthly wage.   Links: https://archive.vn/AOl4u https://archive.vn/0rGtQ
notes_C3: The government allowed to hold concert and entertainment events from January 28. However, the halls can only be 50% full, and visitors must wear masks and follow social distancing.  Link: https://archive.vn/2isaA
notes_C6: No curfew right now across the country.   Link:  https://archive.vn/5bc9e
notes_C8: Uzbekistan has barred passengers from 8 countries (Denmark, Germany, Australia, Austria, Italy, the Netherlands, South Africa and the United Kingdom) from entering the country until January 10th. This policy was announced on December 22, I could not find information on when it was put in place.  source:  https://archive.fo/NMcmU
notes_H8: No changes found.  ________________________________  Quote (1):  "Persons aged over 65 are recommended to remain in self-isolation and not to visit public spaces."    Link (1):  http://archive.today/2021.03.29-033413/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/uzbekistan/coronavirus  ________________________________
notes_C2: The UK Embassy states that hotels, motels, and guest houses have reopened (but are subject to special health and safety rules) following the easing of restrictive measures. From 15 August, all shopping malls, clothing markets, restaurants, cafes, beauty salons, and larger shops, as well as gyms, swimming pools, private kindergartens, and education centers have reopened.  Link: https://archive.vn/hMl5w
notes_C4: Gatherings for more than 30 people are banned.   Link: https://archive.vn/phTyw
notes_H7: Vaccines: Vaxzevria (also known as Astra Zeneca) and the Uzbek-Chinese vaccine ZF-UZ-VAC2001  Uzbekistan government have approved vaccines and started vaccinations as of April 1st according to latest update. The first shipment of AstraZeneca vaccine have been received on March 17th with the aim to provide initial doses to individuals older than 65, medical personnel, people with chronic diseases, schoolteachers and kindergarten teachers, and law enforcement and military personnel as per the update,  "Has the government of Uzbekistan approved a COVID-19 vaccine for use? Yes  Are vaccines available in Uzbekistan for U. S. citizens to receive?  Yes, although supplies are still very limited.  Which vaccines are available in Uzbekistan?  Vaxzevria (also known as Astra Zeneca) and the Uzbek-Chinese vaccine ZF-UZ-VAC2001  According to Uzbek health authorities, the government’s initial vaccination campaign against COVID-19 began on April 1 with the first residents of Tashkent and regional capitals getting their shots.  The Health Ministry said on Telegram that people in district capitals and smaller settlements will start getting vaccinated on May 1, while vaccine doses will arrive in more remote areas in June.  The ministry said the British-Swedish Vaxzevria (formerly known as AstraZeneca) and the Chinese-Uzbek ZF-UZ-VAC 2001 vaccines are initially being used.  The initial rollout is for individuals older than 65, medical personnel, people with chronic diseases, schoolteachers and kindergarten teachers, and law enforcement and military personnel."    Archived article   http://web.archive.org/web/20210409031018/https://uz.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/  ______________________________________________________________________________________________________________________    A latest update also reported that the government started mass vaccination as per news, "An official statement says that "3,138 vaccination centers and 862 mobile medical brigades have been set up across the country for the vaccination campaign...[and] more than 4,000 doctors and more than 11,000 nurses are involved in the vaccination program."    Also, "The ministry said the British-Swedish Vaxzevria (formerly known as AstraZeneca) and the Chinese-Uzbek ZF-UZ-VAC 2001 vaccines are initially being used to guard against COVID-19 among the country's 32 million people.    The initial rollout is for individuals older than 65, medical personnel, people with chronic diseases, teachers of schools and kindergartens, and law enforcement and military personnel."  Archived Link   http://web.archive.org/web/20210410190425/https://www.rferl.org/a/uzbekistan-mass-vaccination-covid-19/31181553.html  _________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________    As per update, these vaccinations are conducted free of charge as per news, "Vaccination plan has been developed for the immunization of the country’s population, according to which 4.1 million people will be vaccinated in the first stage: people over 65 years old, medical workers, people with chronic diseases, teachers, kindergarten employees, law enforcement agencies. They will be vaccinated in state institutions and free of charge."    Archived Link  http://web.archive.org/web/20210411215518/https://www.asinta.com/news/uzbekistan-covid-19-employer-resources/
notes_H3: Evidence on active contact-tracing was conducted earlier on in 2020, although it is still being done, there is little evidence to show it is as robust as before. A mobile app was introduced with nothing more substantial to show comprehensive contact-tracing is still being done.  ___________________________  Quote (1):  "06-Apr-20: Testing strategy: all symptomatic cases, contacts and those under quarantine are being actively tested. Testing kits are being provided by WHO, the Russian Federation and China. The website of the Ministry of Health includes a section where the population can conduct a test to assess their need for testing."    Link (1):  http://web.archive.org/web/20210329043903/https://www.covid19healthsystem.org/countries/uzbekistan/livinghit.aspx?Section=1.5+Testing&Type=Chapter  _______________________  Quote (2):  "Health Capacity-Building  • On 17 February, WHO Regional Office organized another joint online global consultation on Contact Tracing for COVID-19. The meeting will focussed on ‘COVID-19 Surveillance: Contact tracing - EWARN’s Experience from Northwest Syria’."    Link (2):  http://web.archive.org/web/20210329042558/https://reliefweb.int/sites/reliefweb.int/files/resources/COVID19%20SitRep%20Uzbekistan%2018-02-2021_Final.pdf  _________________________  Quote (3):  "Uzbekistan to develop mobile app to trace contacts of confirmed Covid-19 cases"    Link (3):  http://web.archive.org/web/20210329044042/https://akipress.com/news:643455:Uzbekistan_to_develop_mobile_app_to_trace_contacts_of_confirmed_Covid-19_cases/  _________________________  Quote (4):  "28-09-2020: Efforts to improve testing capacity, isolation measures, treatment and contact tracing were being scaled up as part of a solid, whole-of-government approach. The country had set up designated COVID-19 triage and treatment centres, and organized hospital structures and administrative systems for patient care."    Link (4):  http://web.archive.org/web/20210329044417/https://www.euro.who.int/en/countries/uzbekistan/news/news/2020/9/uzbekistans-covid-19-response-focuses-on-core-public-health-measures-and-community-resilience
notes_C5: From 15 August onwards, public transport including buses, minibuses and metro reopens. Passengers are required to wear mask and ensure social distancing. See government telegram channel, https://web.archive.org/web/20201112083526/https://t.me/s/koronavirusinfouz/5657 AND news agency Gazeta article, archived https://web.archive.org/web/20201112083701/https://www.gazeta.uz/ru/2020/08/14/public-transport/

name: Venezuela
notes_H1: Stablishment of a national committee for corona, and public campaign to raise awareness https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=oq0b_OzXV7w
notes_H2: The "Guideline for management and treatment of Covid-19 patients and contacts" (24/4/20) states that PCR tests should be performed on: suspect cases, patients before hospital/quarantine discharge, a/symptomatic contacts of confirmed cases, people who enter the country and probable cases (See page 3). Priority should be given to severe cases, people with comorbidities, pregnant women and healthcare workers (See page 4).    https://drive.google.com/file/d/1yrv5ec-LAdelzvTIf1RIhstTIduxEp3C/view  See "ESQUEMA TERAPÉUTICO ESPECÍFICO PARA TRATAMIENTO DE PACIENTE" in https://web.archive.org/web/20200406095426/http://www.mpps.gob.ve/index.php/sistemas/descargas
notes_C7: "Authorities have announced social/community-wide quarantine and bans on inter-state travel with roadblocks in place.Inter-state travel requires a special permit or “salvoconducto” to be issued by the respective regional REDI or ZODI authorities."  https://web.archive.org/web/20200803083037/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/venezuela/coronavirus
notes_C1: All schools with classes suspended until no further notice https://www.caraotadigital.net/nacionales/delcy-rodriguez-anuncio-suspension-de-clases-tras-llegada-del-coronavirus-a-venezuela
notes_H6: “People have been instructed to wear face covering at all times when outside.” “Travel in Venezuela…The use of face covering is mandatory at all times, including when travelling via land in private vehicles.” Source: http://web.archive.org/web/20201102203502/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/venezuela/coronavirus
notes_E2: From March 22 and during the following six months banks must put the collection of credit payments on hold, telecommunications services would not be cut off, and rent payments for homes and businesses would be suspended (...) He [Nicolás Maduro] also banned companies from laying off employees through December 2020”  http://web.archive.org/web/20200504191924/https://www.reuters.com/article/us-health-coronavirus-venezuela-idUSKBN21A02V  Although the government has announced the implementation of the Comités Locales de Abastecimiento y Producción (CLAP), as a measure to counteract social necessities because of COVID-19, experts stated that the country has no capacity to finance it.  The government also announced that they will assume the payment of payrolls for small and medium-sized companies for six months. Also, those that are “paying a mortgage will have the possibility to stop paying the installments to the bank, but the bank must assume how to modify and adapt the debt.”  http://web.archive.org/web/20200504192146/https://www.elnacional.com/economia/medidas-economicas-populistas-anunciadas-por-maduro-podrian-enterrar-al-sector-privado/
notes_E1: The President of Venezuela, Nicolás Maduro, made on Tuesday, April 6, a series of advertisements to support the population, including workers of private and self-employed companies, and to encourage the creation and strengthening of micro-enterprises in the face of the second wave of Covid-19, the product of the presence in the country of the P.1 and P.2 variants of the coronavirus.    Income support measures include:  *The "Stay at Home" bonus for solidarity support for workers from private companies will be resumed from this week. It will be received by 2,100,000 workers.  *The "Radical Quarantine" bonus will be deposited for self-employed persons during April, which will receive 4,000,000 people. His first part has already been deposited today.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210407010217/https://albaciudad.org/2021/04/presidente-maduro-anuncio-bonos-descuentos-y-exenciones-como-medidas-ante-segunda-ola-de-covid-19/
notes_C3: Updating indicator back to general as previous targeted designation has no comment about why the change was made.    Public gatherings are prohibited.    https://web.archive.org/web/20201223014624/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/venezuela/coronavirus
notes_C6: "Only one member per family is allowed to go outside of their home to access supermarkets/pharmacies." all outings are banned but for essential purpose. https://web.archive.org/web/20200803083037/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/venezuela/coronavirus
notes_C8: Updating indicator as there is not a total border closure.    On January 18, the Venezuelan Civil Aviation Authority (INAC) announced that commercial flights are now limited to Mexico, Panama, the Dominican Republic, Turkey, and Bolivia.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210330193404/https://ve.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
notes_H8: Setting indicator in-line with C6 as no specific protections for elderly people are found.    Country remained on strict lockdown during this period.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210324132730/https://venezuelanalysis.com/news/15152
notes_C2: Venezuela is going back to its 7+7 plus method of containment:  https://web.archive.org/web/20210130055753/https://www.infobae.com/america/venezuela/2021/01/24/nicolas-maduro-presento-unas-gotas-milagrosas-que-neutralizan-al-100-coronavirus/
notes_C4: Although there is no specific number, President Maduro has insisted during the last week on the need to avoid all types of gatherings.   https://web.archive.org/web/20200516164834/http://mppre.gob.ve/2020/05/10/medidas-decretadas-frenar-avance-covid-19-pais-mantienen-vigentes/  https://web.archive.org/web/20200516155135/https://pandectasdigital.blogspot.com/2020/05/decreto-n-4198-de-fecha-12-de-mayo-de.html  The president addressed ministers and local leaders who have organised public events.   https://web.archive.org/watch?v=wPgGIirIO4M
notes_H7: A: Sputnik V  Venezuela started on Thursday vaccinations with their first 100,000 arrived dosis:  https://web.archive.org/web/20210221165735/https://rpp.pe/mundo/venezuela/venezuela-empieza-a-aplicar-vacuna-rusa-sputnik-v-a-su-personal-de-salud-noticia-1321727
notes_C5: Venezuela is increasing lockdown measures in a "radical quarantine" from January 4th to January 10th. Under this new policies all land terminals are closed.  https://web.archive.org/web/20210110053753/https://www.elnacional.com/venezuela/politica/cuarentena-radical-tras-la-flexibilizacion-de-diciembre-venezuela-retoma-el-esquema-77/

name: United States Virgin Islands
notes_H1: From March 13, Governor Bryan declares a state of emergency and established coordinated public campaign reflected through a timeline.     https://web.archive.org/web/20200730103133/https://www.vi.gov/usvi-covid-19-timeline/
notes_H2: People can register or walk in for testing at free pop-up sites.   https://web.archive.org/web/20210329171046/https://www.covid19.usvi.care/testing
notes_C7: There do not appear to be any restrictions on internal movement.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210117212512/https://usviupdate.com/
notes_C1: US Virgin Islands continue to remain in yellow 'safer at home' stage of reopening. According to guidelines, Virgin Islands Re-opening Schools Guidance 2020-2021, "Phase Yellow: Combination (Hybrid) of virtual and face to face classroom instruction."     http://web.archive.org/web/20201014180644/https://www.covid19usvi.com/sites/default/files/2020-2021%20Reopening%20of%20Schools.pdf Link: https://archive.fo/6xQbb The University of Virgin Islands still remains closed to in-person teaching. Link: https://archive.fo/RUOyn
notes_H6: Masks are required in all public places where distancing is not possible.     https://web.archive.org/web/20201121235059/https://www.covid19usvi.com/sites/default/files/2020-10/2020-09.30%2018th%20Supplemental%20Exec_%20Order--fully%20signed.pdf
notes_E2: Tenant-Based Rental Assistance and Emergency Rental Assistance are available.   https://web.archive.org/web/20210329165712/https://www.usviodr.com/covid-19-funding-details/
notes_E1: $300 of benefits available to those unemployed 'through no fault of their own' through the Lost Wage Assistance (LWA) scheme.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210323135225/https://www.vidol.gov/unemployment-insurance/
notes_C3: The Governor of the Virgin Islands announced the prohibition of gatherings of more than 10 persons in all parades, fairs, festivals, churches (Stay at home phase). Later in the Safer at home and Open Doors phase, the government allows these events to take place but participants (less than 50 people) must maintain 6 feet apart and wear masks. - Stay at home:     https://web.archive.org/web/20200729141201/https://www.vi.gov/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/2020-03.23-12-54pm-Order-Suppl-Exec-Order-re-Restrictions-to-Movement-Gatherings-Operations-of-Business-Govt.-and-Schools-.pdf - Safer at home:     https://web.archive.org/web/20200729141325/https://www.vi.gov/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/6th-Supplemental-Exececutive-Order-COVID-19.pdf - Open doors:     https://web.archive.org/web/20200729141731/https://www.vi.gov/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/8th-Supplemental-Exec-Order.pdf - Summary of 3 phases:     https://web.archive.org/web/20200729141833/https://www.vi.gov/covid/phases/
notes_C6: “As a community, we are trying to find a new normal. Our success in this endeavor is dependent on our willingness to adhere to the health guidelines and restrictions,” the Governor said. “Although we are now in week three of the moratorium on leisure guests, the virus is still being transmitted through person-to-person contact. This continues to be the most prevalent mode of transmission for the virus. We must all commit to doing our part to keep each other safe.”     http://web.archive.org/web/20201014181944/https://www.vi.gov/governor-bryan-moves-territory-to-safer-at-home-status/
notes_C8: All visitors and residents must provide proof of a negative PCR test to enter the Territory or must go into 14-day quarantine upon arrival.     http://web.archive.org/web/20201014181944/https://www.vi.gov/governor-bryan-moves-territory-to-safer-at-home-status/
notes_H8: Due to the reestablishment of the Stay at home phrase, from 17 August, everyone is required to stay at home with some exceptions.     https://web.archive.org/web/20200820045122/    https://www.vi.gov/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/13th-Exec-Order-Returning-to-Stay-At-Home.pdf
notes_C2: Non-essential businesses open, bars closed  Restaurants open with restrictions: open for indoor dining of 6 persons per table; no bar seating    https://web.archive.org/web/20210323133315/https://www.vi.gov/covid/phases/
notes_C4: In advance of the upcoming Easter holidays, Governor Albert Bryan Jr. has eased restrictions for churches, which now can have gatherings of up to 200 people or 50 percent of their capacity, whichever is less, Government House Communications Director Richard Motta Jr. announced during the Government House Weekly Press Briefing on Monday.  The new limit goes into effect immediately and will remain in effect moving forward.  “Just to be clear, you cannot seat 200 if your capacity cannot accommodate 200 people,” Director Motta said.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210405190131/https://www.vi.gov/covid/news-post/governor-bryan-eases-seating-capacity-restrictions-for-houses-of-worship/  https://web.archive.org/web/20210405184826/https://www.garda.com/crisis24/news-alerts/461106/us-virgin-islands-authorities-maintain-covid-19-travel-measures-as-of-march-29-update-15    https://web.archive.org/web/20210405184947/https://www.vi.gov/covid/phases/
notes_H7: A,B,C:  Pfizer and Moderna vaccines are available to all adults (16+)    https://web.archive.org/web/20210320201329/https://www.covid19usvi.com/vaccines
notes_H3: The specific testing benchmark beyond 2% will likely vary considerably by state and dependent upon local disease burdens. The Harvard Global Health Institute has suggested two methods to assess whether testing is adequate. Their benchmark is based on how much testing would be needed for a state to test all infected people and contacts that at predicted burdens. A testing capacity to test all symptomatic people and their close contacts (contact-tracing) is critical to prevent epidemic transmission. The second benchmark that the Harvard Global Health Institute suggests is that communities that demonstrate positivity rates (total positives/total tests) of 10% or lower are likely testing adequately.     http://web.archive.org/web/20201014190157/https://www.covid19usvi.com/sites/default/files/2020-05/Lab%20Faqs.pdf
notes_C5: Begin from May 4, 2020, a Stay safer at home order went into effect. There is no measure related to the closure of public transportations.     https://web.archive.org/web/20200729141325/    https://www.vi.gov/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/6th-Supplemental-Exececutive-Order-COVID-19.pdf

name: Vietnam
notes_H1: Gov't created Covid-19 Website for information, followed by numerous information sources.     First press release on site dated for Jan 29. May have been released earlier.     https://ncov.moh.gov.vn/web/guest/-/bo-y-te-ra-khuyen-cao-moi-nhat-huong-dan-7-cach-phong-ngua-virus-corona
notes_H2: "As of mid-November, Viet Nam had 86 laboratories nationwide which are capable of providing confirmatory testing for COVID-19, according to the Ministry of Health.  The total include 37 in the North, eight in the Central, three in the Central Highlands and 38 in the South.   In late August, the Government agreed with the Ministry of Health’s proposal to allow public and private medical establishments to conduct COVID-19 testing."    https://web.archive.org/web/20201118111536/http://news.chinhphu.vn/Home/86-establishments-capable-of-providing-confirmatory-testing-for-COVID19/202011/42164.vgp
notes_C7: There are currently restrictions on intercity or interstate travel. However, before travel, all passengers using public means of transport (buses, taxis, trains, planes, ships, etc.) must complete an online health declaration.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210405161744/https://vn.usembassy.gov/u-s-citizen-services/covid-19-information/
notes_C1: "Schools in Ho Chi Minh City resumed on March 1 following a month-long break to prevent the spread of the pandemic."    https://web.archive.org/web/20210301055144/https://www.vietnam-briefing.com/news/vietnam-business-operations-and-the-coronavirus-updates.html/      "Students from kindergarten to high school levels would return to school on March 2, while those from vocational schools would return on March 8. University student schedules would be determined by the schools themselves, though the National Steering Committee for Covid-19 Prevention and Control recommended they reopen starting March 15 to ensure social distancing measures, the municipal People’s Committee said Saturday."    https://web.archive.org/web/20210301053353/https://vietreader.com/life/34925-students-in-hanoi-will-be-back-to-school-next-week-as-covid-under-control.html
notes_H6: "Hanoi city’s government announced November 11 that wearing a face mask is mandatory at the following locations: 1) hospitals; 2) parking lots; 3) public transportation; 4) shopping malls; and 5) supermarkets and traditional markets.  Other localities in Vietnam may take similar measures without prior notice."    https://web.archive.org/web/20201130194455/https://vn.usembassy.gov/u-s-citizen-services/covid-19-information/      Mandatory wearing of masks in public, especially the 5 places enumerated above.  "Theo dó, Phó Ch? t?ch UBND Thành ph? Ngô Van Qúy d? ngh? các don v? ti?p t?c tuyên truy?n nh?t là vi?c b?t bu?c deo kh?u trang noi công c?ng; qu?n lý ch?t ch? các khu cách ly, các tru?ng h?p nh?p c?nh trái phép. 5 d?a di?m: B?nh vi?n, b?n bãi d? xe, phuong ti?n công c?ng, trung tâm thuong m?i, siêu th?, ch? ph?i b? trí ngu?i ki?m soát ch?t ch?, ai không có kh?u trang không cho vào, b? trí di?m bán kh?u trang ngay ? c?a."     https://web.archive.org/web/20201130201649/http://thanglong.chinhphu.vn/khong-duoc-vao-5-dia-diem-neu-khong-deo-khau-trang
notes_E2: According to IMF, the SBV has issued guidelines to commercial banks to reschedule loans, reduce/exempt interest, and provide loan forbearance.   Newly approved measures include deferring excise tax on domestically produced cars, lowering land rental, cutting or exempting various fees and charges, cutting CIT rate for small and micro firms, and raising PIT deduction.  Financial institutions are also exempting and reducing fees. Affected firms are eligible to concessional loans from Vietnam Social Policy Bank (VSPB) with no interest for making salary payment to their workers who temporarily stopped working.   http://web.archive.org/web/20200723164138/https://www.imf.org/en/Topics/imf-and-covid19/Policy-Responses-to-COVID-19
notes_E1: Vietnam on April 9 issued Resolution No. 42/NQ-CP (Resolution 42) to help individuals and businesses affected by the COVID-19 pandemic. The Resolution consists of a financial package for those affected by the pandemic and targets six categories of individuals and businesses not covered by unemployment insurance. Individuals affected are eligible for $43 per month (https://web.archive.org/web/20200507062819/https://www.vietnam-briefing.com/news/covid-19-vietnam-issues-financial-assistance-employers-employees.html/) GDP per capita in Vietnam is about $225 a month (https://web.archive.org/web/20200507063130/https://www.worldbank.org/en/country/vietnam/overview)
notes_C3: "A number of festivals and events in Vietnam have been cancelled or postponed in alignment with the government’s directive to avoid public gatherings:  - Hu? Festival 2020 - Postponed to 2021  - F1 Vietnam Grand Prix - Cancelled  - Techcombank Ha Noi Marathon - March 26-28, 2021  - Vietnam Trail Marathon 2021 - Cancelled"    http://web.archive.org/web/20210210070843/https://vietnam.travel/things-to-do/information-travellers-novel-coronavirus-vietnam
notes_C6: Curfew is currently no longer in place in specified areas. All individuals continue to recommend staying at home.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210405161744/https://vn.usembassy.gov/u-s-citizen-services/covid-19-information/  https://web.archive.org/web/20210405165951/https://ncov.moh.gov.vn/vi/web/guest/-/6847426-2265
notes_C8: Jan 4, 2021: "Vietnam's heath ministry has proposed suspending or limiting incoming flights from at least 34 countries and territories that have detected cases of the new COVID-19 variant first found in Britain, the government said on Monday."    https://web.archive.org/web/20210104201902/https://www.usnews.com/news/world/articles/2021-01-04/vietnam-proposes-suspending-all-flights-from-countries-with-uk-covid-19-variant      "Sources from the Vietnam Aviation Authority- Ministry of Transport said that so far, no flight has been permitted to bring Vietnamese citizens from countries around the world to their home in January 2021. In order to effectively control another possible COVID-19 break, it is essential that citizens strictly adhere to the Ministry of Health’s instruction on 5K message: Khau trang (facemask)- Khu khuan (disinfection) – Khoang cach (distance)- Khong tu tap (no gathering) – Khai bao y te (health declaration)."    https://web.archive.org/web/20210104202133/https://vietreader.com/news/29316-vietnam-covid-19-updates-jan-4-prevention-measures-tightened-for-lunar-new-year.html
notes_H8: Jan 14, 2021: "The UN Population Fund (UNFPA) handed over COVID-19 personal protective equipment meant to support the elderly to the Social Protection Department under the Ministry of Labour, War Invalids and Social Affairs in Hanoi on January 14. The supplies include gloves, face masks, anti-droplet face shields, thermometers, and hand sanitizer worth 30,000 USD.    They will be distributed to social protection centers and community caregivers in high-risk cities and provinces, namely Hanoi, Hai Duong, Da Nang and Quang Nam.    At the handover ceremony, UNFPA Representative in Vietnam Naomi Kitahara said the COVID-19 pandemic is amplifying the vulnerability of the elderly, and that the fatality rate for older people is higher, and for those above the age of 80, it is five times higher than the global average. Therefore, elderly people must be a priority in dealing with COVID-19 to ensure no one is left behind in humanitarian response as well as in development efforts, she added."    https://web.archive.org/web/20210215195932/https://en.vietnamplus.vn/unfpa-offers-aid-to-support-the-elderly-amid-covid19/194771.vnp
notes_C2: Authorities in Hanoi have allowed the reopening of bars, nightclubs, and karaoke parlors from March 23 effectively reopening all businesses and services.  Ho Chi Minh City authorities allowed the reopening of bars, nightclubs, and karaoke parlors from March 19 but with preventive measures.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210405161744/https://vn.usembassy.gov/u-s-citizen-services/covid-19-information/  https://web.archive.org/web/20210405162423/https://www.vietnam-briefing.com/news/vietnam-business-operations-and-the-coronavirus-updates.html/
notes_C4: Most Hanoi businesses and activities have resumed from March 2.  However, festivals and religious events in Hai Phong of over 20 people and street vendors remain suspended until further notice.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210316021309/https://vn.usembassy.gov/u-s-citizen-services/covid-19-information/
notes_H7: A: (AstraZeneca) On March 8, Vietnam begin vaccinations for front-line workers and health care staff in 12 provinces / cities: Hai Duong, Hanoi, Hung Yen, Bac Ninh, Bac Giang, Hai Phong, and Ho Chi Minh City. Ho Chi Minh City, Gia Lai, Long An, Da Nang, Hoa Binh and Khanh Hoa.  From March 8 to 15, a total of 15,865 people were vaccinated.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210316031826/https://ncov.moh.gov.vn/vi/web/guest/-/6847426-2069
notes_H3: evidence of contract tracing efforts on government website:  Emergency: People arriving at these 4 locations should contact their health immediately   On the evening of January 29, the Ministry of Health issue an urgent notice no. 29 and recommend those who have visited the following locations:  1. January 23: Wedding at 252 Trieu Khe, Dong Trieu, Quang Ninh (house in the alley)  2. January 24: Avengers Tea & Coffee, No. 25 Lane 1 Ha Huy Xi, Yen Park, Gia Lam, Hanoi  3. January 24: Grilled hotpot shop 176 Bridge Duong establishments, No. 25 Lane 1 Ha Huy Xi, Yen Park, Gia Lam, Hanoi  4. January 24: Manh Bridge Tea Room, Lich Son Cam Ly, Luc Nam, Bac Giang  WHAT TO DO:  - Contact the nearest health authorities immediately for support advice;  - Call the hotline to provide the phone number of people who have been in close contact with him  https://web.archive.org/web/20210201220112/https://ncov.moh.gov.vn/vi/web/guest/-/6851640-10
notes_C5: It has been over 21 days, so the suspension of public and passenger transport schools in Quang Ninh and Hai Duong is no longer in affect.     https://web.archive.org/web/20210201165815/https://vietnamnet.vn/en/society/pm-orders-residents-in-hai-duong-quang-ninh-not-to-leave-localities-709115.html

name: Vanuatu
notes_H1: Not sure about the starting date. I am considering the state of emergency declaratory http://web.archive.org/web/20200614235155/https://covid19.gov.vu/
notes_H2: Only those who meet the case definition will be able to be tested for COVID-19. This Includes people who have clinical symptoms, and travel history or contact with a COVID-19 case. People with clinical symptoms without travel history or contact with COVID-19 case will not be tested.  http://web.archive.org/web/20200614235453/https://covid19.gov.vu/images/Information-Sheets/Community_messaging_lab_testing_v2.pdf
notes_C7: "As of 1st December 2020, Vanuatu has no active cases of COVID-19. According to the the COVID-19 Health Sector Preparedness and Response Plan, Vanuatu is now in Scenario 1 (no cases)."    "Scenario 1 (no cases):   - No restrictions on schools, workplaces, public or private gatherings.  - Installation of handwashing stations.  - Preparation of response plans.  - Follow hygiene and prevention measures."    "Inter-islands travel restrictions" apply only for Scenario 3 (Community Transmission).    https://web.archive.org/web/20201204143207/https://covid19.gov.vu/index.php
notes_C1: "The Ministry of Health confirmed on 11 May 2020 that there are no confirmed cases nor suspected cases of COVID-19 in Vanuatu since the first declaration of State of Emergency on 26 March 2020. Thus, the MoET announced the re-opening of the schools to students on Monday 18 May 2020. The schools are required to resume all classes and to have good hygiene and hand washing practices in place for students and staff." https://web.archive.org/web/20200618131359/https://www.gov.vu/index.php/events/news/72-schools-to-reopen-on-monday-18-05-2020
notes_E2: Hardship loans were provided in 2020, but the loan facility closed in May 2020. Commodity Support Grants, Shipping Support Grants and other support available for businesses from April, but applications closed November 30 2020.     See IMF Covid-19 Policy Responses (https://web.archive.org/web/20210215151708/https://www.imf.org/en/Topics/imf-and-covid19/Policy-Responses-to-COVID-19#V).
notes_E1: Employment Stabilization Payment came to an end in June. The Vanuatu Chamber of Commerce and Industry (VCCI) has requested that an extension of a minimum of three months be made to the Employment Stabilization Payment (ESP) so that affected businesses can retain staff (but this has not yet been confirmed) http://archive.fo/IY1og
notes_C3: Move to Scenario 1 on the Vanuatu COVID-19 Disaster Response Plan. This means that no restrictions on public events, indeed between 23-30th mass celebrations for 40th anniversary of Independence  http://web.archive.org/web/20210321111107/https://covid19.gov.vu/images/docs/MOH_COVID_HSPRP_2_.pdf
notes_C6: Move to Scenario 1 on the Vanuatu COVID-19 Disaster Response Plan. This means that no restrictions on leaving the house  http://web.archive.org/web/20210321111107/https://covid19.gov.vu/images/docs/MOH_COVID_HSPRP_2_.pdf
notes_C8: All borders closed from state of emergency /web/20200615003756/https://www.theguardian.com/travel/2020/mar/24/coronavirus-travel-updates-which-countries-have-restrictions-and-fco-warnings-in-place
notes_H8: The state of emergency was extended until December 31. However, there is no stay-at-home policy in place.   Link: https://archive.vn/fTBbB
notes_C2: No measures.    https://web.archive.org/web/20200828083359/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/vanuatu/coronavirus
notes_C4: Move to Scenario 1 on the Vanuatu COVID-19 Disaster Response Plan. This means that no restrictions on gatherings or gathering sizes, indeed between 23-30th mass celebrations for 40th anniversary of Independence  http://web.archive.org/web/20210321111107/https://covid19.gov.vu/images/docs/MOH_COVID_HSPRP_2_.pdf
notes_H3: No change in policy    https://web.archive.org/web/20200614235614/https://covid19.gov.vu/images/Information-Sheets/Public_Health_Information_Sheet_Surveillance_V4_English.pdf
notes_C5: Move to Scenario 1 on the Vanuatu COVID-19 Disaster Response Plan. This means that no public transport restrictions  http://web.archive.org/web/20210321111107/https://covid19.gov.vu/images/docs/MOH_COVID_HSPRP_2_.pdf  http://web.archive.org/web/20210321111107/https://covid19.gov.vu/images/docs/MOH_COVID_HSPRP_2_.pdf

name: Yemen
notes_H1: "The Ministry of Public Health and Population announces the state of comprehensive health mobilization for doctors, health personnel, technicians, and preventive quarantine experts, in preparation for facing the Coronavirus." (Translated from Arabic)  http://web.archive.org/web/20200510135933/http://www.moh.gov.ye/news_details.aspx?id=2264
notes_H2: Authorities in Aden setup a new specialized field hospital in Al Mualla district for patients with fever. On 04 October 2020, a COVID-19 examination unit opened at the isolation center in Ataq, Shabwah Governorate. Fifteen sea border points and three land border points are partially open for movements. There have been ten transit points for public movement between southern and northern governorates. Since the COVID-19 pandemic outbreak, the Yemeni authorities have put additional preventive measures and health screenings for people passing through these transit points, specifically at points located in Taizz and Al-Bayda. For Yemeni returnees from KSA through the Al’Wadeeah border entry point, carrying a COVID PCR test report is mandatory by the Yemeni authorities. Authorities at Al’Wadeeah entry point have established and installed a PCR testing facility at the entry point for travelers who arrive without a PCR test report.  https://web.archive.org/web/20201029155117/https://displacement.iom.int/yemen
notes_C7: in response to the COVID-19 pandemic, the local authorities of Yemen declared a nationwide health emergency and introduced many preventative measures similar to those adopted by rest of the world starting in March 2020 in order to reduce the transmission of COVID-19. These measures include the adoption of restrictions on movement countrywide.     https://web.archive.org/web/20201029155916/https://reliefweb.int/report/yemen/covid-19-movement-restrictions-yemen-mobility-restriction-dashboard-14-21-october-2020
notes_C1: Schools are reported as fully open (in policy) on UNESCO tracker; confirmed in independent media reports. Public health prevention measures in place (e.g. hand washing). However, in practice armed conflict has also forced some school closures as reported in media, regardless of stated COVID-19 school closure policy.     http://web.archive.org/web/20201215001741/https://en.unesco.org/covid19/educationresponse    http://web.archive.org/web/20201215001546/https://www.unicef.org/yemen/stories/schools-reopen-yemen-after-months-closure-due-covid-19    https://web.archive.org/web/20201026164301/https://www.middleeasteye.net/fr/news/classrooms-rebel-held-yemen-shuttered-first-day-school-799916572
notes_H6: In response to the COVID-19 pandemic, the local authorities of Yemen declared a nationwide health emergency and introduced many preventative measures similar to those adopted by rest of the world starting in March 2020 in order to reduce the transmission of COVID-19.  But there is a lack of PPE means it not generally followed.  https://web.archive.org/web/20201029163154/https://reliefweb.int/report/yemen/yemeni-women-take-lead-fight-against-covid-19
notes_C3: "The committee called on the government to “declare a (public) health state of emergency in all provinces, prepare health centers and hospital, and provide medical staff with personal protective equipment.”  The committee called for the implementation of a “partial curfew” and for the closure of wedding halls, shopping centers and mosques outside of prayer times."  https://archive.vn/2S5bv
notes_C6: Curfews are in effect in Marib governorate from nine in the evening until six in the morning.  https://reliefweb.int/sites/reliefweb.int/files/resources/20201230_COVID19_DTM%20Yemen%20Mobility%20Restrictions%20Dashboard%20%2319.pdf  https://web.archive.org/web/20210118220329/https://dtm.iom.int/reports/yemen-covid-19-mobility-restrictions-30-dec-2020
notes_C8: Al Wadeeah border entry point returned to its normal position, open to travelers travelling between Yemen and Saudi Arabia, after a two week closure from 20 December 2020 to 8 January 2021.  /web/20210308221347/https://displacement.iom.int/system/tdf/reports/20210210_COVID19_DTM%20Yemen%20Mobility%20Restrictions%20Dashboard%20_N21.pdf?file=1&type=node&id=10766
notes_H8: Carrying over C6 indicator which has been coded as 2T due to a curfew in effect in the Marib governorate.   https://archive.vn/52MNi
notes_C2: "The committee called on the government to “declare a (public) health state of emergency in all provinces, prepare health centers and hospital, and provide medical staff with personal protective equipment.”  The committee called for the implementation of a “partial curfew” and for the closure of wedding halls, shopping centers and mosques outside of prayer times."  https://archive.vn/2S5bv

name: South Africa
notes_H1: 5 March 2020 - South Africa's President Cyril Ramaphosa has warned that the coronavirus will turn into a "national crisis" and its impact will be "huge".  His warning came after the first case of the coronavirus was detected in South Africa.     https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-africa-51752974     https://www.gov.za/Coronavirus
notes_H2: South Africa’s mass screening helps stem the coronavirus tide https://web.archive.org/web/20200611185300/https://www.ft.com/content/98d0d7c6-9bfb-4a64-bcab-19e0854a3b4d
notes_C7: Movement Restrictions:  Is a curfew in place?   Yes  Under Alert Level 3, the curfew will apply from 2100 until 0600 daily.  Are there restrictions on intercity or interstate travel? No  https://web.archive.org/web/20210114090801/https://za.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information-2/
notes_C1: Feb 15, 2021. South African schools reopen after delay over Covid variant. Schools were originally planned to reopen on January, but the government pushed the date back by two weeks as infections soared, fuelled by the new strain that was identified in the country.  https://web.archive.org/web/20210215182747/https://en.unesco.org/covid19/educationresponse   /web/20210215184357/https://news.yahoo.com/south-african-schools-reopen-delay-161004928.html
notes_H6: Facial coverings required in all public places. This is a change from previous coding, but policy has not changed — the way this is coded is in line with the coding interpretation guide.     Adjusted Alert Level 3 in place until 15 February (https://web.archive.org/web/20210201183707/https://twitter.com/PresidencyZA/status/1348697788679397377/photo/1), see government website for guidance on alert level 3 (https://web.archive.org/web/20210201185402/https://www.gov.za/covid-19/about/alert-level-3-during-coronavirus-covid-19-lockdown).
notes_E2: The government has put in place a loan guarantee scheme for companies below a certain turnover. The government also announced measures for relief for borrowers from banks  https://web.archive.org/web/20200608210933/https://www.imf.org/en/Topics/imf-and-covid19/Policy-Responses-to-COVID-19
notes_E1: President Cyril Ramaphosa has announced that government will direct R50 billion towards grants, in which child grant recipients will receive R300 in May and R500 in June. https://web.archive.org/save/https://ewn.co.za/2020/04/21/watch-live-ramaphosa-says-r50bn-allocated-towards-grant-recepeints  South African President Cyril Ramaphosa announced a 500 billion rand ($26.3 billion USD) rescue package, equivalent to 10% of the GDP of Africa’s most industrialised nation, to try to cushion the economic blow of the coronavirus pandemic.  The package will target large increases in existing welfare grants, funds for protecting jobs.   Additionally, 200 billion rand ($10 billion USD) in loan guarantees in partnership with the central bank of South Africa, finance ministry and commercial banks, and tax deferral for firms with more than 100 million rand turnover.    https://web.archive.org/web/20200501072953/https://www.ft.com/content/e07b70bd-71ae-4b8a-9855-09665330fed9     He is addressing the nation on Tuesday night on additional economic and social relief measures that form part of the national response to the coronavirus (COVID-19) pandemic.    All the other recipients will receive R260 extra for the next six months    The unemployed, with no source of income, will receive a monthly stipend of R350 for the next six months.    Ramaphosa said Sassa will be distributing food through the provision of vouchers for the vulnerable for the poor.
notes_C3: Political events and traditional community meetings prohibited. Venues such as cinemas, theatres, museums, galleries, conferencing facilities etc. open, with 50-person limits indoors.     Alert Level 3 continues be in place, see government website (https://web.archive.org/web/20210220160023/https://www.gov.za/#) and amended guidelines (https://web.archive.org/web/20210222181317/https://www.gov.za/covid-19/about/alert-level-3-during-coronavirus-covid-19-lockdown).
notes_C6: On July 12th, amidst rising COVID cases, President Cyril Ramaphosa announced that the country would remain at level 3 lockdown but would reinstate nightime curfews.     Source  https://web.archive.org/web/20200713161631/https://www.reuters.com/article/us-health-coronavirus-safrica/south-africa-reimposes-alcohol-ban-curfew-as-coronavirus-cases-spike-idUSKCN24D0QU
notes_C8: Effective 2-15-20221 20 land borders will reopen on Monday, says Motsoaledi. Valid negative Covid 19 test required.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210215191542/https://www.voanews.com/covid-19-pandemic/south-africa-reopen-20-land-border-crossings-next-week
notes_H8: All visits to care facilities for older persons were suspended at the beginning of lockdown.    "From midnight on Thursday, March 26 until midnight on Thursday, April 16, all South Africans will have to stay at home"    https://web.archive.org/web/20200427205507/https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2020/03/south-africans-brace-21-day-lockdown-virus-cases-rise-200324073801136.html    This article suggests that very strict protections for elderly care homes have been in place:    "But visitors are allowed only under exceptional circumstances as the quarantine is still in effect.     Some residents have been waiting for more than three months for a chat with their loved ones."    https://web.archive.org/web/20210311114833/https://www.courthousenews.com/virus-kills-22-of-residents-of-s-africa-care-home/    https://web.archive.org/web/20210212205538/https://www.spotlightnsp.co.za/2020/07/09/covid-19-more-government-support-needed-for-old-age-facilities-expert/
notes_C2: According to the government website. People can go to work. Cases are spiking.  Anyone who is sick or displaying symptoms should not go to school or work. If you have been in close contact with a confirmed COVID-19 case, you should self-isolate for 14 days from the date of close contact. If you are concerned, contact your medical practitioner for further advice.  https://web.archive.org/web/20201029001720/https://sacoronavirus.co.za/faqs/
notes_C4: Gatherings allowed with a maximum of 50 persons indoors and 100 persons outdoors, subject to public health protocol and social distancing.    Alert Level 3 continues be in place, see government website (https://web.archive.org/web/20210220160023/https://www.gov.za/#) and amended guidelines (https://web.archive.org/web/20210222181317/https://www.gov.za/covid-19/about/alert-level-3-during-coronavirus-covid-19-lockdown).
notes_H7: The first consignment of COVID-19 vaccines arrives on 1 February, and the government aims to vaccinate 1.2 million frontline healthy workers.     See government announcement (https://web.archive.org/web/20210201194704/https://www.gov.za/speeches/president-cyril-ramaphosa-receives-first-consignment-coronavirus-covid-19-vaccine-1-feb-31).
notes_H3: 7th March- tracing of all members of a group of 10 from Italy from which one tested positive.  The public must be notified that we have information and know the whereabouts of all the other 10 people who were part of the group that had travelled to Italy. All those who came back to South Africa, are currently being tested. We are now awaiting their test results to come out. Since being traced, they have remained in isolation to avoid any further contact with third parties.  	https://web.archive.org/web/20200406162441/https://sacoronavirus.co.za/2020/03/07/confirmation-of-second-case-of-covid-19-in-south-africa/
notes_C5: Per US embassy, Public rail, minibus taxi, and bus services have resumed at reduced levels subject to social distancing and mandatory use of face masks for passengers and drivers.  Minibus taxis and buses must reduce their maximum licensed passenger seating capacity to 70% a vehicle, e-hailing services that are licensed to carry up to four passengers are limited to carrying 50% of their permissible passenger carrying capacity.
